loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a busy place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 25 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Eden works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Eden has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Eden would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale like personal care products, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women Group

texts.en:
Sofia is a 53-year-old, widowed woman with three children, living in Fort Portal.

She has a business, selling second-hand clothes where she is actively involved for eight hours a day and she has been doing this business for 34 years now. She experiences hardships of a limited market and those who delay to pay her, hence, lowering her monthly income. However, she is looking forward to expanding her business to new areas and introducing good-quality clothes that her customers are asking from her.

Sofia has asked for a loan to help her buy more second-hand clothes to sell. She is a member of Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women Group where there is a group guarantorship for one to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a repeat client who lives in Namungo, in Mityana, with a piggery business. Besides that business, she grows sweet potatoes as a side income to supplement her business. She’s 37 years old and married, with three children.

Norah’s acquiring a loan of only KES 500 (five hundred shillings) to buy animal feed and de-wormers for her pigs. This will help her to overcome the challenge of disease outbreak.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: corrugated roofing, nails, bricks, cement, sand and to pay for labor to repair the roof of her home and construct a retaining wall.

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga ella es viuda y tiene 73 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos,cuyes y pollos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos,cuyes y gallinas. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the group that are part of the communal bank “SUMAC PURIRISUN” ; this bank is located in Cusco district , in Cusco province part of the Cusco region.

The members name is Dominga, she is a 73 year old widow and has 5 children. She has her own business rearing animals including pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them up and then sells them in various markets. This business has allowed Dominga to take care of her children. Now she wants to expand the animal rearing business. She is asking for a loan to buy pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

The other members of the group make a living from selling cosmetics, handicrafts, running a grocery store and selling livestock.

Dominga is grateful to everyone who shares her dream by supporting her in this way; she commits to paying the installments on the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and bags.

His business goal is to open a larger clothes store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and bags.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman who describes herself to be God-fearing. She has been operating a retail business selling shoes and bags for five years. Her enterprise enjoys a strategic location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest challenge to be dust in the area.

Purity will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes and bags. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; the previous one was fully repaid. Her goal is to be a wholesale distributor within five years.

Purity will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes and bags.

loans.name: Hottensia

texts.en: Hottensia is a single woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open a large shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a posho mill where she sells flour and cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low maize stock.

She will use the KES 110,000 loan to buy more stock of maize to produce maize flour.

Her business goal is to expand greatly within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, a married mother of three, describes herself to be humble. She has been operating a tailoring business where she makes dresses and sweaters for 16 years. Hellen's enterprise is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest challenge is inadequate working capital.

Her previous two loans with SMEP Microfinance Bank repaid, Hellen is requesting a new one for Kes 60,000 to buy a knitting machine. Her goal is to have an electric sewing machine within five years. She hopes to build rental houses in the future.

Hellen will use the anticipated profits to meet family needs.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are many. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more stock of maize. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved life. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Lawahez

texts.en:
Lawahez is 44, married, and has three sons and one daughter.

She has a small fattening project. She previously requested a loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the due dates.

She is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase her sales of milk, cheese, and butter.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child still in school. She has a buy-and-sell pottery business in the Philippines.

Erlinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy different kinds of pottery designs to sell to her stall. Erlinda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of pottery designs to sell to her stall.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man who has eight children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects livestock.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of livestock. His business goal is to start a butchery within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of livestock.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Emelinda works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell mineral water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Emelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water to sell for her buy-and sell-mineral water business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Chumbani

texts.en:
Chumbani is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. They live at their own house, which does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a Khanga (wrap cloth for women) selling business. She sells Khangas from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge - she lacks capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, Chumbani wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (wrap cloth for women) for resale.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a married man who has four children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a tailoring business where he repairs and makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a big business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. This will enable her to increase milk production. She hopes that in the future she will have increased income from her dairy farm. She will save the anticipated profits for future use.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with 5 children, and he describes himself as honest. He operates a hardware store where he sells cement and other construction materials. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cement and other hardware items. He hopes that, in the future, he will be very successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cement and other hardware items.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rise in prices for food ingredients. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a restaurant within five years. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a married man, and he has 6 children. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is operating during rain season, which affects his business.

He will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy a new motorcycle. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman who has six children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells poultry. She also does farming. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenges to be poultry diseases and inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of local chicken breeds within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes de 48 años de edad, vive al lado de sus dos nietas de 12 y 13 años de edad. Mercedes es una persona emprendedora quien en busca de mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos y refrescos como los cuales son: yuca frita, pastelitos, tamales de pollo, etc. actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años, lo que le permite que para este tiempo tenga un numero bastante grande de clientes que prefieren sus platillos. En vista que la demanda en su negocio ha crecido, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: yuca, maíz, verduras, pollo, aceites, y demás ingredientes para aumentar la producción de platillos típicos y de esta manera aumentar las ventas. Ya que gracias a este negocio puede ofrecerles el alimento y educación a sus pequeñas nietas.
texts.en: Mercedes is 48 years old, and lives with her two granddaughters who are 12 and 13 years old. She is an enterprising person who works selling traditional dishes such as fried yucca, patties, chicken tamales, etc., and soft drinks, in order to support her household. Because she has been doing this work for 20 years, she has quite a large number of clients who prefer her dishes. Since demand for her products has grown, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in yucca, corn, vegetables, chicken, oil, and other ingredients, in order to increase her production of traditional dishes and thereby increase her sales. Thanks to this business she is able to provide food and education to her young granddaughters.

loans.use: to invest in yucca, corn, vegetables, chicken, oil, and other ingredients, in order to increase her production of traditional dishes.

loans.name: Angel Joaquin

texts.es: Angel de 24 años de edad, reside en casa propia en la cual ha habitado toda su vida. Él es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Gracias a esta labor, logra mantener la economía del hogar y también logra cubrir sus necesidades básicas. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Angel solicita un crédito a FUSA para invertir en: puertas, ventanas, ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto habitación.
texts.en:
Angel, 24 years old, lives in his own house, where he has lived all his life. He is a hard-working person who for a business located in his community. Thanks to this work, he is able to make a living and meet his basic needs.

Angel wants to improve his quality of life, which is why he is applying for a loan with FUSA to buy doors, windows, bricks, cement, sand, and to pay labor costs to build a room in his home.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, bricks, cement, sand, and to pay labor costs to build a room in his home.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, sugar, bread, beauty products, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more inventory of sugar, bread, soap, and beauty products. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of sugar, bread, soap, and beauty products.

loans.name: Gibran

texts.en:
Gibran is a married man. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a farm where he grows watermelons. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be floods.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 55,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells plastic containers, sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to be an importer of products within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 59 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like juice, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Emerita has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Emerita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 41 years old and married with three children. Esperanza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Esperanza has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Reda

texts.en: Reda is 30, married, and she has two children. She has a small poultry project (chickens and ducks). She raises the poultry for one month and sells them by the kilogram. She is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more ducks and chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as competent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is bad weather.

This is Victoria's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy a cow.

She hopes that in the future, she will have increased income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells flasks, utensils and other plastic containers. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of plastic containers and other utensils. Her business goal is to have a shop offering more variety of utensils within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastic containers and other utensils.

loans.name: Sadden

texts.en:
Sadden is a married woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics and clothes and has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in product prices.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics.

Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a single man. He describes himself to be risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, bread and other items. He also has another business where he sells coral blocks. He has been involved in these businesses for 5 years.

His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour,soap, bread ,coral blocks and other items.

His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living conditions.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. All previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour,soap, bread and other items

loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengo is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, salt, bread, and other items. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment for others. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.name: By His Grace Group

texts.en:
The group is called “By His Grace” and is from the city of Accra-Chorkor. They are very self-sacrificing and united women who want to improve their living conditions through their effort and sacrifice. They are into the sale of pork, gizzards, materials, corn and cassava dough.

Khadijatu is one of the members of this group (far right in the photo). She sells materials and wax prints. She moves from home-to-home to sell to customers who always buy from her, and also recommend her to their friends and new customers. She is also self-sacrificing in order to be able to give a better quality of life not only to herself, but also to her family. She is 53 years old, married, and has one dependent child who is 18 years old and is in senior high school.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy materials and wax prints to sell to customers. This way she will be able to continue to give good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy materials and wax prints and sell to customers.

loans.name: Dorca Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Dorca, esta conformado por mujeres luchadoras, laboriosas, y sobre todo responsables en cuanto a sus actividades económicas, para el crecimiento sostenible de sus negocios. Estando con ADIM 10 ciclos, y solicitando crédito nuevamente Martha de 34 años, coordinadora del grupo, acompañada y con un hijo  de ocho años de edad. Se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 6 años, con el crédito anterior logro hacer un anexo en su vivienda.  Ahora para cubrir la demanda y poder crecer, ella requiere en invertir con la compra de perfumes, colonias, cremas y maquillajes. La segunda socia es Cira de 23 años quien vende ropa y calzado, la tercer socia es Aracelly de 32 años quien se dedica a la venta de fritanga.
texts.en:
The group Dorca is made up of determined, hard working women and above all, they are responsible with their financial activities in order to grow and support their businesses. They have been with ADIM for 10 loan cycles and they are now requesting a new loan.

Martha is 34 years old and the coordinator of this group. She has a son who is eight years old. She has been selling cosmetics for 6 years and with the previous loan she was able to make an addition to her house. To meet the demand and to be able to grow, she wants to invest in the purchase of perfumes, colognes, lotions and make-up. The second member is Cira, she is 23 years old and she sells clothing and shoes. The third member is Aracely, she is 32 years old and she makes a living selling fried foods.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jenit

texts.en:
As a previous member of Gata Daku MPC, Jenit is planning to expand her business by being funded again.

Jenit, 31 years old, is a hardworking woman; she is married with two children and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon (a village that the main livelihood is farming). Her husband is a laborer in the neighboring town. To help her husband in earning a living, she decided to make a vegetable garden five years ago.

Now that she plans to make a bigger vegetable garden, her huge problem is that she needs a fund to buy fertilizers & seedlings. Therefore, she went to Gata Daku MPC to ask for help. She applied for a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 and it was released Sept. 29, 2015.

Jenit’s main objective is to help her husband to earn a living for the daily survival of her family. She aims to have another piece of land for the expansion of her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is from Ronda, Cebu. She is 49 years old. She has three children. Among them her youngest is eighteen years old. She is dependent on her hog raising business for a living.

Raquel is asking for a loan to sustain her livelihood. She will use it to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption. Raquel dreams of having her own capital to make expansions in the future. Her income will be for her family's healthy diet and school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a repeat customer who hails from Namungo in Mityana. He is an industrious working man involved in a brick-laying project, which he started in 2000 to earn income to support his family. Besides that, he is a teacher and gets additional income through teaching.

He is married and 35 years old. He is an honest and hardworking person who is now looking forward to acquire a loan of 500,000 UGX to improve on his working capital. He will buy firewood and hire labor to make more bricks. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to hire labor to make bricks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 45 years old and from Moalboal, Cebu. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 4. While her husband works as a rice and corn mill operator, Rosita is engaged in raising chickens and livestock. This business has been ongoing for almost two years now.

She is requesting a loan to buy feed, chicks, and hardwood and nails for house repair. In the future, Rosita plans to make her poultry business bigger and to add more chicks to raise for increased profitability.

loans.use: to buy feed, chicks, hardwood, and nails.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia lives near the sea in the town of Valencia, Bohol. Being married to a fisherman allows her to learn fishing as well. She also helps her husband by selling his catch and preparing his fishing needs. In addition to this, Gaudencia raises hogs for supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets for their fishing business and more piglets to raise. In the future, she hopes to live in abundance out of her businesses. Gaudencia is 50 years old.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and piglets.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 29, married to a housewife, and has two children.

He has a small carpentry project in which he makes furniture such as bedrooms and kitchens. He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy wood to meet his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Wendy Alejandra

texts.es: Wendy se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, esto lo realiza desde su hogar. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas y artículos a sus clientes. De esta manera mejorará sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wendy sells clothing and perfume from her home. She is seeking a loan of one million and fifty colones (1,050,000 CRC) to buy merchandise. Her goal is to offer a greater variety of garments other items to her customers. This way she will improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Gamal

texts.en:
Gamal is 33, married, and has one son and one daughter. He is financially responsible for his mother.

He has a small poultry farm in a place he prepared for the birds, with fixed temperature and water. He sells them small after some time.

He is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy more ducks and chickens after he prepared the place for them.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Tuvyurane Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie  fait partie du groupe  Tuvyurane et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de  48 ans.  Elle a 4 enfants âgés de 9 à 20 ans, dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de banane  et de la pate douce  depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de banane et de patate douce  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une  vache, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pascasie is a member of the Tuvyurane group and lives in Gitega. She is a 48 year old widow and has four children between the ages of 9 and 20. Three of them are students.

She has had the banana and sweet potato business for seven years.

This is her first Turame loan. The Kiva loan will provide her with more money to buy a large quantity of bananas and sweet potatoes to resell and earn more money.

In the coming years she would like to buy a cow and see her children studying.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas and sweet potatoes to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Shidaa Aha Yehowa Group

texts.en:
The Shidaa Aha Yehowa group is starting their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana, as part of their loan procedure at the branch. The group is made up of six members, represented by Mayfair. The businesses that the members carry out are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of groceries, foodstuffs, slippers, rubber bowls, cloth, phone recharge cards, and general goods.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs. Mayfair is one of them. She indicated that she became a member of the group five years ago, joining on the invitation of a friend. She currently has a business selling groceries. She says she learned the business from her friend and started it more than eight years ago. She moves from house to house to sell to customers.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital for buying groceries at wholesale, which she will acquire at the market in the city of Accra. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she is a single mum of three children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she replied that she likes the health and savings services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale; she will acquire these at the market in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Dora De Jesus

texts.es: Dora de 56 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia junto a su hijo quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Dora es madre soltera y muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza por obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para los gastos de su vivienda, estos ingresos los obtiene gracias a que con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos lavando y planchando en diferentes hogares en su comunidad. Ella vive en una humilde casa que ha sido construida con láminas, la cual desea mejorar y por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, madera, láminas y pago de mano de obra para construir el corredor en su vivienda y reparar el piso de la misma. De esta manera mejorar considerablemente su condición de vida.
texts.en: Dora is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her son, who helps her with the household expenses. Dora is a hard-working single mother who tries hard to earn the income needed to pay her bills. She earns her income by working very hard providing domestic services, washing and ironing in different households in her community. She lives in a modest house that was built of sheet metal, and would like to make improvements to it. For this reason she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, wood, and sheet metal, and to pay for labor to build the hallway of her house and to repair the floor. In this way she can improve her living conditions considerably.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, wood, and sheet metal, and to pay for labor to build the hallway of her house and to repair the floor.

loans.name: Fe Y Vida Group

texts.es: Conformado por cinco mujeres, emprendedoras, luchadoras, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, nació el grupo Fe y Vida, coordinado por Juana, de 52 años, acompañada y dedicada al negocio de venta de nacatamales  desde hace quince  años, solicita el crédito número quince en la institución para comprar maíz, leña, cerdo, papa, vegetales y hojas de chagüites. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa Las otras socias son Massiel de 21años quien vende cosméticos, Ana de 22 años quien vende ropa, Juana de 34 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y Helida de 27 años quien vende ropa.
texts.en:
Five enterprising and hard-working women with a great desire to get ahead comprise the group Fe y Vida. Their coordinator is Juana, a 52 year-old woman. She is in a relationship, and for the last fifteen years she has had a business selling nacatamales [steamed filled corn cakes wrapped in a banana leaf].

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood, pork, potatoes, vegetables and banana leaves. With the previous loan she was able to buy building materials to improve her home.

The other members are Massiel, who is 21 years old and sells cosmetics, Ana, who is 22 and sells clothing, Juana, 34, who sells cosmetics, and Helida, who is 27 and sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, pork, potatoes, vegetables and banana leaves.

loans.name: Nelson Eduardo

texts.es:
Nelson Eduardo es un agricultor de 22 años dedicado a cultivar variedad de productos del campo, Nelson está soltero pero espera poder casarse pronto y formar su propia familia, su meta es construir su casa y prepararse económicamente para iniciar una vida totalmente independiente, la mayor fuente de ingresos de Nelson es la caficultura la cual practica desde hace mucho tiempo.
A Nelson le interesa todo lo que tenga que ver con técnicas para mejorar la calidad y la sostenibilidad de sus cafetales por lo que ya cuentas con certificaciones como ser: Comercio Justo y Rain Forest y en este momento quiere iniciar el proceso para convertir su producción a 100% orgánica lo que le dará más sostenibilidad a su cafetal y lo mejor de todo lo hará amigable con el ambiente.
En la actualidad Nelson solicita un crédito para convertir su producción de café a 100% orgánica, el producir café orgánico le ayudará a Nelson a tener  mejores oportunidades de mercado para su café además que le ayuda a mantener la integridad de los suelos de su finca, con las ganancias del café orgánico vendido Nelson espera tener suficientes ingresos para iniciar una vida independiente de sus padres.
texts.en:
Nelson Eduardo is a 22-year-old farmer dedicated to cultivating a variety of crops. Nelson is single but hopes to marry soon and begin his own family. His goal is to construct his home and prepare himself economically to initiate a totally independent life. The major source of Nelson's income is coffee cultivation, which he has practiced for some time.

Nelson is interested in anything to do with techniques to improve the quality and sustainability of his coffee plantings. He has already received certifications, including Just Commerce and Rain Forest, and, now he wishes to initiate the process to convert his production to 100% organic, which will give his crops greater sustainability and, best of all, make them environmentally friendly.

At present, Nelson is requesting a loan for converting his coffee production to 100% organic. Producing organic coffee will offer greater market opportunities for his coffee and, in addition, help to maintain the integrity of the soils on his farm. With his earnings from sales of organic coffee Nelson hopes to have sufficient income to initiate life independently from his parents.

loans.use: to purchase tomato plants, antiviral spray, organic manure, and other necessary materials for the construction of a hothouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy photopaper, laminating film and a printer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 49-year-old married mother who has been earning a living raising poultry in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She earns additional income selling charcoal.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants vivant ensemble à Adidogomé. Pour soutenir sa famille, Akossiwa vend des mèches et tissages dans son salon de coiffure et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Akossiwa réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Akossiwa désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de mèches et de tissages en vue de mieux revendre afin de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 32 year old married lady who is also the mother of three children. They live together in Adidogomé.

In order to support her family, Akossiwa sells individual hair extensions and weaves in her salon which she sources three times a month from the market.

This business is profitable and in order to satisfy the customers' needs, Akossiwa hopes to have this looan so she can buy the extensions and weaves so she can earn more profits. This in turn will allow her to help her children with their school education and meet the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy 60 individual hair extensions and 70 weaves.

loans.name: Yenny Maricela

texts.es:
La  Señora Jenny de 32 años de edad es madre soltera  vive en  Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de tortillas sus clientes son las personas vecinas y amigos y demás personas cercanas a la comunidad.

La señora Jenny es una mujer  trabajadora  con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  Prisma por darle la oportunidad de su segundo crédito en lo personal  y sus compañeros de grupo.  Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz y leña .Con el apoyo del crédito ella  pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio Solicita  para compra de granos básicos  y con el apoyo de este préstamo espera invertirlo y mejorar más sus ingresos.

Su sueño es prosperar para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y tener una mejor vida.
                  
San Lorenzo Valle Honduras -Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Miss Jenny, who is 32 years old, is a single mother. She lives in Nacome Valle. For five years she has worked in the business of selling tortillas. Her customers are neighbors, friends, and other people close to the community.

Señora Yenny is a hard-working woman with great desires to get ahead, and she is grateful to Prisma for giving her personally and the members of her group the opportunity for a second loan. She is applying for the loan to buy corn and firewood. With the support of the loan, she plans to stock and improve her business.

Her dream is to prosper in order to raise her children and have a better life.

San Lorenzo Valle Honduras -September 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Elinah

texts.en:
Elinah is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt , bread and other items and has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour,salt and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. All previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto con 63 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su familia, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Jacinto se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, además de su motocarguera de color rojo en la cual transporta sus herramientas, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio.Jacinto piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Jacinto es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de S/.500,00 y S/.1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de Edpyme Alternativa su negocio a mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma. .
texts.en:
Jacinto is 63 years old and single. He lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotún District, Chiclayo Province, Peru. The inhabitants of this place work mostly in agriculture, business and the cattle industry.

Jacinto works offering his services as a day laborer. He uses his own tools as well as his red motorcycle-trailer in which he transports his tools. With more than 20 years of experience in the area, his business is located in his own home.

He asks for this loan to buy and maintain equipment and tools. Said investment will help him to have his equipment and tools in better conditions, which will have a great influence on his business. Jacinto wants to better the productivity of his services and, thereby, to attend to the diverse needs of the inhabitants of the area.

Jacinto is a returning borrower from Edpyme Alternativa. He has had two loans of S/. 500,000 and S/. 100,000, which he paid of in a timely manner. Since he became a member of Edpyme Alternativa, his business has improved as well as his quality of life.

loans.use: para compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, a hard working married man, is aged 38 years. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of 5 children and all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into selling already made clothes for both men and women, among other items.

In order to supplement his income he carries out farming, mostly growing beans for home consumption and sale. He desires to grow and expand his business more so as to educate his children. He is faced with a challenge of having few customers during ordinary days as he normally struggles with vast numbers of customers during festive seasons. To prepare himself fully ahead of this season, Julius requests a loan facility to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 29 years old. He is hardworking and married. He has the responsibility of taking care of 4 children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

He operates a boutique clothing store selling men’s, ladies', and baby clothes. In addition, he also rears goats for additional income. He ventured into the clothing business in 2005 after realizing a need to generate enough income to support his family.

He is optimistic in expanding his business to satisfy the growing demands of his customer. He is challenged by inadequate capital and also previous bad debts that affect his returns. He is seeking for a loan to buy more inventory of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is from the municipality of Badian, Cebu. She is 39 years old and married with four children aged one to seventeen. Anecita has been a vegetable vendor for fifteen years. She sell carrots, squash, eggplants, christophene, taro and lime. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables such as eggplants, squash, carrots, taro, noodles and seasoning. Since her customers are increasing, Anecita would like to serve them better with fresh vegetables. She hopes to further expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy carrots, squash, eggplants, christophene, taro and lime

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies and prepaid reloads to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John of age 25 is married with 3 children whom all attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

He operates a clothing boutique store mainly selling secondhand shirts, blouses, trousers, and other clothing items for 7 days a week. In order to supplement his income, he also started a venture in mobile disco to hire entertainer and to provide musical entertainment to the people in his community.

He hopes to expand and develop his business so as to attract more customers. His main challenge is inadequate capital. John requests this loan to allow him to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is 35, is married, and has four children. Her husband works as a driver with a very small income and she has a small grocery store project, which she rents. She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to expand her project and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta

loans.name: Sa'deya

texts.en:
Sa'deya is 45, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works for a governmental institution earning a very small income and she runs a small grocery store.

She is requesting 4,000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase and expand her inventory for her store and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to sell at her store

loans.name: Winners Group

texts.en: From Chorkor, five members are part of a group called Winners. The members are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans, and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling groceries, gari (cassava flour), cosmetics, and rubber bowls and providing seamstress services. Elizabeth is married and is a member of this group. She is a 34-year-old trader in cosmetics for four years. Elizabeth wants to continue to work hard so that she can maintain and improve her business. Elizabeth sells her merchandise at retail. She buys cosmetics at the wholesale price from the market and sells to customers. She has made a tremendous improvement in her business, as have the other members. The majority of the members do not know how to read or write. The training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family and business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the members, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. The five members look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at the wholesale price from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30, single, and has a small grocery store (rented).

He is requesting a 4,000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as varieties of biscuits and potato chips.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as varieties of biscuits and potato chips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, seasoning, toiletries, soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a very hard working person who wants to see his business flourish to improve the standards of living of his family.

He deals in produce, predominantly the buying and selling of rice and maize. In addition, he rides a motorcycle for transport as extra income.

Ronald wants to grow and expand his business to become the main supplier of maize and beans in the areas surrounding him. The progress of his business is hindered by a poor road network system.

He is looking for a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco is a 33-year-old, married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children who entirely depend on him for basic needs. He buys and sells maize and beans, which has provided him some income. On learning that it was urgent for him to supplement his income, he ventured into cassava and rice farming. He desires to develop his business so as to become the main supplier of maize and beans in his area. He is seeking a loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm animals like goats, pigs, and cows.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 47 years old. She owns a "carenderia" which is a type of restaurant that is common in villages and towns. She also operates a Sari-sari store business.

She is asking for a loan through CEVI to buy soft drinks, vegetables, seasoning, toiletries, bath soap, and shampoo to stock her store. Epifania hopes that this will positively impact her sales and helps improve her customer base.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more sustainable. Her income is currently used to support her youngest son who is 17 years old.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, seasoning, toiletries, bath soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Columba

texts.en:
Columba is a 65-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.

She works hard in the farm while her husband is in carpentry. Farming is the source of her income.

Columba is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. With the fertilizer, she hopes to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

In the future, Columba dreams of making her farming business a success and a sustainable source of income for both herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her farm and harvest

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 58 year old married man with 7 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.
He is a farmer, growing food crops like banana, tomatoes, maize, and sweet potatoes on a large scale. In addition he also rears cows for milk production, a business he started since 1986 to raise more income for his family.

Charles dreams of constructing a dream house for his family and leaving with a legacy. His challenge is low capital and this limits his ability to realize this dream. Charles is requesting this loan to buy cement and plaster to build his family residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and plaster to build his family residential house.

loans.name: Shenouda

texts.en: Shenouda, 27, is recently married and is financially responsible for his aging and sick parents. He has a small fattening project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a hard-working mother of eight children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of cosmetics products, such as make-up, perfume and lotions. Desideria is also engaged in a rice farming business with her husband.

Desideria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for her children's tuition fees. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm. In the future Desideria hopes to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Atteya

texts.en: Atteya, 39, is married and has three children. He has a small fattening project. Atteya is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to make more cheese and butter for sale and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Zebra Ii Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old. He is a hardworking man with five children living in Masindi, Uganda.

He runs a general store that sells sugar, rice, and soap in the last 20 years. Due to the various responsibilities that he has, he bought a motorcycle to start a transport business in order to earn more income.

One of Joseph's dreams of to provide for his children education through to the university level. One of his challenges is the poor condition of the local roads in his area. Nevertheless, he believes in his dreams and wants to have his business stocked to full capacity so he could earn more income.

He requests a loan to buy sugar, soap, and rice to sell. Joseph is a member of Zebra II Group where every member guarantees one another in order to acquire the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is a 33-year-old married man from Rustavi City. He has mandatory wife and school-aged daughter. Shota has worked as a baker at a private bakery for 10 years already and bakes traditional Georgian bread that is very popular among local people. Shota gets a small income from the work however he has great experience in this kind of business. He is eager to make his own business and open a bakery.

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application for a loan of 800 USD for purchasing all needed equipment so he can continue his lovely job was approved under the framework of this program. Shota already has his own loyal costumers and will work the business in a profitable way.

The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market in case of need. Shota awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness and highly appreciates their support.

loans.use: To make his own business and open a bakery

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius, aged 43, is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children.  He has always admired having a reliable source of income; hence, he ventured into buying and selling maize. Julius works twelve hours a day and seven days a week. On realizing the need to supplement his income, he decided to farm beans and cassava. Julius' main challenges are price fluctuations and unfavorable weather changes that negatively affect his business. He is seeking a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer from Garu village.

As a Babban Gona member, he's excited to have access to a trained agronomist and helpful inputs that will give him a chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. He will use this loan to purchase his immediate food and clothing needs, therefore he could store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s services, Abdullahi no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Abdullahi hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy personal food and clothing need

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a forty-two-year-old hardworking married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar, soap and tea leaves, to mention but a few. He was forced to start the business due to family demands. He also started up a cosmetics shop to boost his income and engage his wife in business as a successful business plan for them both to have business experience. He dreams of widening his business though competitors are at his back. He wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, tea leaves and other items to sell, which his customers are lacking in his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, tea leaves and other items to sell.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Garu village. As a member of Babban Gona, Adamu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Adamu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdurrashid

texts.en:
Abdurrashid is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdurrashid has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Abdurrashid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Abdurrashid can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdurrashid will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Abdurrashid is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a thirty-two-year-old man. He is a resident of Masindi district, married and has three children. He does farming, where he works three hours a day and six days a week. Edwin also lectures at a technical college in Masindi, which is another source of his income. He has been in farming since 2003, having started with the aim of sustaining his family and ensuring a good education for his children.

Edwin wants the loan to pay for labor for weeding and to buy chemicals for spraying. He has a good customer language with his clients and they describe him as a hard working and honest man. His dreams are to construct a home for his family, educate his children, and expand and modernize his farmland but he faces a problem of inadequate capital. Edwin is normally challenged by weather changes and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to pay for labor for weeding and to buy chemicals for spraying.

loans.name: Teresita Group

texts.es: El grupo Teresita lo conforman tres mujeres laboriosas, dedicadas a sus negocios para crecer económicamente y sacar adelante a sus familias. Coordinado por María de 59 años de edad, acompañada, quien desde hace diez años se ha dedicado a la venta de sopa y repostería, solicita por primera vez el financiamiento de la institución para invertir en la compra de harina, azúcar, mantequilla y levadura, una de sus metas es abrir un puesto de venta de frutas, la segunda socia es Darling de 31 años quien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y Yara de 39 años quien se dedica a la venta de platanitos.
texts.en:
The Teresita group is made up of three hard-working women, devoted to their businesses so that they can increase their incomes and help their families get ahead in life.

It is coordinated by María, age 59, married, who has been selling soup and desserts for 10 years. She is requesting a loan from the institution for the first time so that she can invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter and yeast. One of her goals is to open a fruit stand. The second member is Darling, age 31, who sells nacatamales, and Yara, age 39, who sells platanitos (plantain chips).

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter and yeast.

loans.name: Abdullahi	Dan Tela

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi is thankful that his days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD/hectare, Abdullahi now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members.

He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Benhur

texts.en:
As a father to three children ages 6, 11, and 14, Benhur works hard to provide for his family. He is into farming rice and he also owns a sari-sari store business.

Benhur has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is applying for a new one.

Benhur is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He plans to use the revenue generated by his business to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Haikarua Group

texts.en:
Wankyo, who is in her late 20's, is single and has two kids who are still small. She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 5am to 1pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Wankyo's first loan From Tujijenge Tanzania. Wankyo will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe business (local restaurant) to serve more people. She dreams of expanding her business.

Wankyo will share this loan with her loan group Haikarua which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, de 47 años de edad, es muy conocido en la zona donde reside, está acompañado y vive con su pareja y 3 de sus hijos, porque los otros 4 ya tienen sus propias familias.

Edilberto, se dedica a la pesca y a la agricultura, él es el responsable de proveer para su hogar; toda su vida la ha dedicado a la pesca artesanal y al comercio de pescado en los pueblos cercanos de donde vive, sus hijos también son pescadores y le ayudan con el trabajo de la pesca.

Edilberto, necesita el préstamo para comprar alevines de tilapia para sembrar en una pecera grande que tiene y así tener su propio negocio, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Los sueños de Edilberto son, obtener buenas ganancias con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Edilberto, is 47 years old and very well known in the area where he lives. He is in a relationship and lives with his partner and three of his children, as the other four have their own families.

Edilberto works fishing and in agriculture. He is responsible to provide for his family. He has worked at small scale fishing all his life and selling fish in the communities close to where he lives. His sons are also fishermen and help him with his work fishing.

Edilberto needs the loan to buy tilapia fry to seed a large fish tank that he has and have his own business to improve the quality of living of his family.

Edilberto's dream is to obtain good profit from his labors.

loans.use: to buy tilapia fry to raise in a large fish tank he has.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with 2 children living in Masindi, Uganda. Francis sells body building food for Swissgarde to earn a living. He had a desire to support people's health and therefore started this business.

Francis realized that his business does not generate enough income and so he bought a popcorn machine and a grass cutting machine (lawn mower) to support him in getting more money. Due to inadequate capital, Francis desires to take a loan to buy more health food for selling.

loans.use: to buy health food to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth some day.

Traditionally, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Yusuf can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yusuf has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD/hectare.

Yusuf is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to improve his business and looks forward to using his additional earnings to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marieme's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis en Janvier 2004,  ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience en termes de crédit. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariéme, (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garcons. Elle s’active dans la vente de couscous.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs  de 50 kg de mil à 120f le kg, du bois pour la cuisson à 22000f et d’autres condiments pour la préparation du couscous d’un montant de 35000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec se bénéfices, elle compte prendre en charge ses enfants (dépense journalière, scolarité et soins médicaux) et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Created in January 2004, this group is made up of women with loan experience. Their main activity is local trading.
Mariéme (seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the representative of the group. She is a widow and the mother of five children - three girls and two boys. Her business is selling couscous.
With this new loan, she plans to buy three 50kg sacks of meal for 120f per kg, firewood for 22,000f and other condiments for making couscous for a total of 35,000. This couscous will be sold locally in portions.
With the profits, she plans to take care of the children (daily expenses, schooling and medical care) and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy three 50kg sacks of meal for 120f per kg, firewood for 22,000f and other condiments for making couscous for a total of 35,000.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, potatoes and propane gas for her business selling tortillas and potatoes to increase her profits.

loans.name: John

texts.en: With the previous loan that John acquired, he managed to buy a dryer and a hair-cutting machine for his salon. He operates a carpentry workshop and salon in a busy street of Fort Portal town. He started these activities with a hope of earning an income for his family and improve their standards of living.  He is faced with hardships of irregular customers, high electricity bills, and limited capital that hinders him from buying items that are the required standard in a salon. However, he is looking forward to buying a plot of land in his village where he can start commercial farming. John needs a loan to buy a hair cutting machine, warmers, and cosmetics for his salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair cutting machine, warmers, and cosmetics for his salon.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald a very hardworking married man in Hoima, Uganda, who is charged with the responsibility of taking care of 2 children who are attending school. He ventured into selling salt, general merchandise, cooking oil, and sugar among other items, on a retail basis so as to raise income to support his family.

On realizing a need to increase his incomes further, Ronald ventured into motorcycle transport. He has always wished to educate his children up to a degree level as well as extending retail services to the nearer people.

Ronald is faced with the challenge of limitation of capital. He is requesting for a loan facility to buy more stock items like sugar, salt, and soap to sell on retail basis.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Shitu Bala

texts.en:
Shitu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Hectare, Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. Yahaya would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, while he awaits better time to sell his crops.

loans.name: Musa Bala

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Hectare, Musa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing until he can get a higher price for his harvest.

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été en Janvier 1998. Les 15 femmes qui le composent sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame  Hawa (debout à extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est divorcée et mère 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de glace, de jus de fruits et d’arachide. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  04 sacs de sucre de 50 kg à 22000f le sac, de l’oseille à 45000, du  pain de singe à 30000f et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 7500f pour le jus des sachets pour l’eau 10000f et paie une facture d’eau de 19000f  pour ensuite le revendre en détails dans son quartier.
