Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de sa fille : scolarisation et  les soins médicaux et améliorer leurs conditions de vie en nourriture habitat
texts.en:
The banc villageois of which this group makes a part of was estabislied in January 1998. There are 15 women who are members and they share solidarity and, from their work together, a group spirit that is recognized in the village. The women work mostly in small-scale commerce.

Hawa, who is standing on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is divorced and the mother of one daughter. Hawa sells ice cream, fruit juice, and groundnuts.

With this new loan, she plans to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of sugar at 22,000 francs CFA per sac, roselle for 45,000 francs CFA, monkey bread for 30,000 francs CFA, and other condiments for the juice for 7,500 francs CFA. She will also buy sachets of water for 10,000 francs CFA and pay a water bill of 19,000 francs CFA. She will resell her products at retail in her area.

With the earnings, she plans to take care of her daughter: school and health costs. [She also wants to] improve their living conditions in regards to their diet and housing.

loans.use: to buy four 50-kilogram sacs of sugar at 22,000 francs CFA per sac and roselle for 45,000 francs CFA.

loans.name: Diamilatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Décembre 2010, ce groupe compte actuellement 10 cycles de crédit dans le programme des bancs villageois, presque 05 années de compagnonnage. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diamilatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée,mère de 07 enfants : 05 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la restauration.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz à 13500f l'un; 02 bouteilles de 20 litre d'huile raffinée à 20000f la bouteille et d'autres condiments d'un montant de 34500f du charbon d'un montant de 35000f et payer ses employé a hauteur de 50000f pour après préparation le revendre en détails.

Avec les bénéfices, en plus de rendre pérenne l’activité, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales plus particulièrement dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants,  les soins médicaux et acheter une maison.
texts.en:
This group was created in December 2010 and has been through ten loan cycles in the village finance programs; this amounts to almost five years of cooperation. The women all come from the same village. They share strong relations based on solidarity and mutual help. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Diamilatou (standing all the way to the right with her hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is married and a mother of seven: five boys and two girls. She works in the food business.

With her new loan, she plans to purchase three bag of rice costing 13,500 XOF each; two twenty-liter bottles of filtered oil costing 20,000 XOF each; other condiments for 34,500 XOF; charcoal for 35,000 XOF. She will also pay her employee 50,000 XOF to retail the food after it is prepared.

In addition to making her business sustainable, she intends on using profits to help her husband manage household expenses, in particular the costs of sending her children to school, healthcare, and purchasing a house.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice (13,500 XOF each); two 20-liter bottles of filtered oil (20,000 XOF each); and other condiments for 34,500 XOF

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is a 39-year-old man who lives in San Dionisio, Iloilo with his family. He has four children to raised, ages 16, 15, 5 and 2 years old. His wife stays at home and takes good care of them. Rey works hard as a fisherman to provide the needs of his family. He is requesting for a loan because he needs to buy fishing materials to help him increase his catch. He will buy fishing net and fishing knot (which serve as the baseline of the fishing net). In the future, Rey wants to improve his livelihood because he dreams for his children to finish their studies so they will have better lives someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing knots.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo con 61 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su mamá,en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Lorenzo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Lorenzo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola.

Lorenzo es socio nuevo para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. Lorenzo firma sólo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 61 years old, single and lives in his own home made from rustic materials with his mother, in Callacyuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Peru. Lorenzo has very good personal and work-related references from those who live in the region.

Lorenzo works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, and has eight years of experience in this area. He will use the loan to pay for agricultural work, applying and setting up plant protection products, fertilizer and labour for harvesting. This will help to improve the growth of the plants physiologically and morphologically as well as from the point of view of productivity and to provide a timely harvest, resulting in greater production levels and a better quality of product so that there will be no issues with selling it. He is also a farmworker.

Lorenzo is a new member of our financial institution, Edpyme Alternativa. Lorenzo applied for this loan alone.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, applying and setting up plant protection products, fertilizer and labour for harvesting.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Rusel and her family live in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. She is a 23 year old married woman and has two children, aged five and two years old. Her husband works hard as a mason in a construction company while Rusell is engaged in buri weaving. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living, and to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children.

Russel is asking a loan to buy buri (the largest palm in the Philippines) used in weaving. In the future, Rusel is determined to improve her livelihood to be able to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy buri (large palm leaves).

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer selling items like soft drinks, sugar, rice, cassava flour, and millet flour. With the previous loan, he bought sodas, sugar, rice, cassava flour and millet flour to sell.

Deo is working very hard and with the profits he was able to to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children. Even though he hopes to build a permanent shelter and a commercial building that can yield him more income, a challenge of limited capital is a big hindrance to his business expansion.

Deo has asked for a loan to help him buy more soft drinks, foodstuff and other essential goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia who operates a salon business, does farming and sells used clothes is a resident of Kasese-Uganda. She is a developmental woman who ventured into business purposely to boost the family welfare. Her main clients are women who love to beautify themselves so much that her stock is not enough to satisfy their demand. Scovia thus seeks for a Kiva loan through Hofokam to buy more cosmetics for sale in her salon. Her aspiration is to transform her salon into a bridal and re-known beauty parlor offering bridal services.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for sale in her salon.

loans.name: Thamsom

texts.en:
Thamsom is a responsible married man with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in general merchandise on a retail basis, selling daily consumables like salt, sugar, rice, soap and other items.

Thamsom started this business in order to support his family needs. He works tirelessly to expand his business with many outlets to the nearby trading centres, though being let down by price fluctuations which reduces on his profits. Thamsom has asked for a loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, salt, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Bishop Angelo Tarantino School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Br. Robert. He is the Head teacher of Bishop Angelo Tarantino School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Arua with 364 students. Bishop Angelo School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bishop Angelo School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Br. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is an individual client. She’s a single mother of two children and a resident of Kito. The client operates a restaurant in one of the universities around town. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to pay tuition for her child, in order to reduce the burden pressed on the business, when she withdraws a large sum of money from it to pay tuition instead of buying more stock.

High competition is her major challenge. She is happy with Kiva and UGAFODE support. Jennifer is pictured with the UGAFODE staff in her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Miguel Armando

texts.es: Miguel es un hombre trabajador de 22 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder brindar lo mejor a su familia con este negocio. Miguel habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y hermanos desde hace varios años. Además posee una tienda en la cual vende artículos básicos del hogar y lo que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva de administrar estos negocios, han aumentado la demanda a sus productos y es por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas y productos para surtir su tienda, de esta manera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is a hard-working man who is 22 years old. He makes a living from selling clothing on foot, because of which he is very happy to be able to provide the best to his family with this business.

Miguel has lived in his own home along with his parents and siblings for many years. Furthermore, he has a store from which he sells basic articles for the home and which allows him to make the income necessary to cover his and his family’s basic necessities. Owing to the time that it takes to manage these businesses, the demand for his products has increased.

It is because of this that he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, and products to supply his store, and thus increase his sales and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in: shirts, blouses, pants, skirts,and products to supply his store, and thus increase his sales.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas

	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 3 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.6 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad la  presidenta es Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, perfumes y sandalias).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para fin de año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para la  época de navidad y vacaciones de verano.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar, la cual se comprometen a cancelar en un plazo de 8 meses. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Katia, quién se dedica a la venta de ropa, perfumes y sandalias en la zona, la va a traer a San José y realiza viajes a la frontera con Panamá, es apoyada por su esposo y mantiene una cartera de clientes grande, tiene 36 años y es una mujer trabajadora y de respeto en la comunidad. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ve  a sus hijos y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas" [Women's Bank of Enterprising Women]
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas

"Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas" presents the loan request of 3 members who are working in a community of Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) with high levels of poverty. The group of women in the area maintains savings and participate in the group activities for income generation. They have eight years of work in their occupations. They have requested loans and know the method of group work. The Board of Directors has been formed and the Act No.6 loan request of "Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas" has been drafted. In this occasion, the president is Katia. Their work and effort has allowed them to have consolidated businesses which are, in general, in trade (clothes, perfume, and sandals). The loan will contribute to improve the working conditions of their group; it will allow them to invest for the end of the year, increasing their inventory and covering orders for the Christmas season and summer vacation. They carry out the quota recovery weekly, allowing them to have a broader range of payment to be made which they are committed to cancel within 8 months. Some of them are female heads of household. Such is the case of Katia, who makes a living selling clothes and sandals in the area. She will bring them to San José and make trips to the border with Panama. She is supported by her husband and keeps a large customer portfolio. She is 36 years old and a hardworking and respected woman in the community. In addition to tend to her financial occupations in the afternoons, she also looks after her children and complies with the group meetings. The goal is to improve the conditions of their enterprises by obtaining a loan that meets their needs, support the development of the area, and certainly improve the quality of life of the families. The group's name motivates them to be better each day, "Mujeres Esforzadas".

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, and sandals.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en: Dionesia is a farmer and a sari-sari store owner from San Miguel, Bohol. She works hard because of her three dependents who are 11, 13 and 15 years old. She needs additional funds to buy soft drinks, canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits, and liquor for her sari-sari store and to buy steel, cement, and hollow blocks and pay for labor to renovate her house. Dionesia's income will also be used for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits, and liquor to sell and buy steel, cement, and hollow blocks and pay for labor to renovate her house.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona farmer. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Musa can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Musa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Musa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años y su negocio es el alquiler de trajes típicos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy  optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área lejana del centro; que contiene una significativa parte de la población total de la ciudad.
Nelida es de físico delgado cabello negro y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es el alquiler de trajes típicos, estos trajes se utilizan para bailes en colegios y actos u homenajes patrios, “inicie con unos pocos trajes la demanda del servicio me ayudó…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por temporada, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para mejorar el ambiente de trabajo. Su sueño es tener una tienda en su casa, ella desea comprar maniquíes y estantes para exponer los trajes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 meses que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nelida solicita un préstamo para comprar maniquíes y estantes para exponer los trajes.
texts.en:
Nelida is a woman of 32 years of age. She is single and has a two-year-old son. Her business is renting traditional costumes.

She is a good mother, independent and very optimistic. Her business is located in the zone south of the city, an area far from the center that contains a significant part of the total population of the city.

Nelida has a thin physique, dark hair, and short stature. Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her son, who can already walk. They live in a rented room made of bricks that has all the basic services. Her business is renting traditional costumes. These costumes are used for dances in schools, ceremonies, and national tributes. "I began with a few costumes, and the demand for the service helped me," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has seasonal sales. The problem is the lack of money to improve the working environment. Her dream is to have a store in her house.

She wants to buy mannequins and shelves to display the costumes. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the six months that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Nelida is applying for a loan to purchase mannequins and shelves to display the costumes.

loans.use: to buy mannequins and shelves to display her costumes.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Ii Group

texts.es: Doña Juana es coordinadora del Grupo Bendición de Dios II, el cual solicita por 21 vez el financiamiento de la institución, para poder crecer económicamente mediante la inversión de más mercadería. A sus 66 años se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos desde hace diez años, Contando con el apoyo de una de sus nietas quien le ayuda a vender. Actualmente  el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes, cremas, vanidad, mascara y labiales. Con el crédito anterior logro hacer unas mejoras en la infraestructura de su casa Los otros socios del grupo son Daysi de 46 años, quien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y Karla  de 31 años, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of the Bendición de Dios II group, which seeks financing from the institution for the 21st time, in order to be able to grow economically through an investment in more merchandise. At 66 years old, Juana has worked selling cosmetics for ten years. She relies on the help of one of her granddaughters who helps her sell.

Currently, the loan she seeks will be invested in the purchase of perfumes, creams, compacts, mascara and lipsticks. With the prior loan she was able to make some improvements in the infrastructure of her house. The other borrowers from the group are Daysi, who is 46 years old and sells tamales, and Karla who is 31 years old and sells cosmetics and used clothes.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, compacts, mascara and lipsticks.

loans.name: Karla Alicia

texts.es: Karla de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y vive al lado de su hijo de 10 meses de edad y su madre. Ella es una joven que se esfuerza día con día por poder darle todo lo necesario a su querido hijo, y para ello se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, negocio el cual administra en el mercado cerca de su comunidad. De esta forma obtiene los ingresos económicos necesarios para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Karla solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, y demás productos y accesorios con los que comercializa para poder aumentar las ganancias de su negocio y de esta manera mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Karla, who is 21 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her 10-month-old son and her mother. She is a young woman who makes an effort every day to be able to give all the necessities to her beloved son. To do this, she sells clothing and accessories, a business that she runs in the market near her community. In this way she obtains the necessary economic income to be able to cover the family necessities.

Karla is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, and other products and accessories that she sells in order to be able to increase the earnings of her business and in this way improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, and other products and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José de 45 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijas de 8 y 15 años de edad. José es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijas, ya que es el único que vela por ellas. En busca de ofrecerles todo lo necesario para que no les falte nada, se dedica a la venta de lácteos de forma ambulante. Actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años aproximadamente. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijas, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: quesos, cremas, leche y un recipiente más grande para poder transportar sus productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old, he lives together with his daughters who are 8 and 15 years old. Jose is a very responsible and hard-working man who struggles to help his daughters get ahead, as he is the only one who watches out for them.
Wanting to offer them everything necessary so that they don't lack anything, he works in the sale of milk products as a street vendor. He has had this occupation for approximately 3 years. In searching for a better quality of life for himself and his daughters, he asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cheeses, creams, milk, and a bigger container to be able to transport his products and in this way improve his sales and his profits.

loans.use: to invest in: cheese, creams, milk, and a bigger container to be able to transport his products and in this way improve his sales.

loans.name: Estela Yamileth

texts.es: Estela de 26 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual vive al lado de su hija de 6 años y su hijo de 2 años de edad.  Ella es una joven trabajadora que en busca de sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, con este negocio puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar y gracias a que cuenta con 3 años de administrar el negocio la demanda a sus productos ha aumentado. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, pantalones, faldas, etc. de esta forma aumentar las ventas y las ganancias, así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Estela is 26 years old.  She resides in her own house along side her 6 year old daughter and 2 year old son.  She is a hardworking young woman, who in looking to get her family ahead, works selling women's clothing in the market that is found close to her community.  With this business, she can obtain the necessary income to maintain the economy of the house; and because she's administered this business for three years, the demand for her products has increased.

It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in blouses, pants, skirts, etc. in order to increase the sales and the earnings, and thus be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To invest in blouses, pants, skirts, etc. in order to increase the sales and the earnings.

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: Sandra de 23 años de edad es una joven emprendedora que lucha por ayudar a su madre a cubrir los gastos del hogar y de esta manera buscar la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Sandra vive al lado de su madre y hermanos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también recipientes plásticos, negocio que administra con el fin de obtener ingresos económicos para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, maquillaje, cremas, etc. y también herméticos plásticos para aumentar las ventas y de esta manera sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra, who is 23 years old, is an entrepreneurial young woman who strives to help her mother cover the household expenses and in this way seek a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Sandra lives with her mother and siblings. She sells beauty products and also plastic containers, a business that she runs with the goal of obtaining economic income to cover her necessities and those of her family.

It is for this reason that she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in lotions, make-up, creams, etc., and also air-tight plastic containers to increase her sales and in this way her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, make-up, creams, etc., and also air-tight plastic containers to increase her sales and in this way her earnings.

loans.name: Erendida Abigail

texts.es: Erendida de 35 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 2 años y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido desde hace 14 años, para mantener la economía del hogar labora en una empresa cercana de su vivienda de forma temporal, además para poder tener un ingreso extra se dedica a la venta de ropa. Gracias a esto puede mantener la economía del hogar y ofrecerle una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, blusas, camisas y pantalones para aumentar las ventas y de esta forma aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Erendida is 35 years old.  She lives along side her life companion, her 2 year old daughter, and her 6 year old son.  She lives in her own house in which she has lived for 14 years.  To maintain the economy of the house, she works in a business near her home as a temporary worker.  In addition, to be able to have an extra income, she works selling clothing.  Thanks to this, she can maintain the economy of the house and offer a better form of life to her children.

And it is for that that she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in skirts, blouses, shirts, and pants to increase the sales and in this way increase the earnings.

loans.use: To invest in skirts, blouses, shirts, and pants to increase the sales and in this way increase the earnings.

loans.name: Ivonne Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Ivonne de 41 años, vive en casa propia al lado de su compañero de vida, su hijo de 8 años y sus hijas de 10 y 13 años de edad. Ivonne es una madre muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos para que no les falte nada. En busca de ofrecerles todo lo necesario para que puedan vivir de la mejor manera se dedica a la venta de artículos plásticos, negocio que le permite obtener los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, además su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía de la familia. Ivonne en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: guacales, ganchos, herméticos y gran variedad de productos plásticos para aumentar sus ventas y así también las ganancia.
texts.en:
Ivonne, who is 41 years old, lives in her own house along with her life companion, their 8-year-old son, and their daughters, ages 10 and 13. Ivonne is a very responsible woman who looks out for the well-being of her children so that they don't lack for anything. Seeking to offer them everything necessary so that they can live in a better manner, she works selling plastic items, a business that allows her to obtain income to cover the household expenses. In addition, her husband helps her with the household economy.

Ivonne, seeking to improve their quality of life, is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in crates, hangers, air-tight containers, and a great variety of plastic products in order to increase her sales and thus also her earnings.

loans.use: to invest in crates, hangers, air-tight containers and a great variety of plastic products in order to increase her sales and thus also her earnings.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: Mauro de 56 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos mayores de edad, su nieto de 5 años y su nieta de 11 años de edad. Mauro es un hombre muy responsable que en busca de sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a la venta de tilapia, además de eso se dedica a la agricultura, dentro de la cual sus principales cultivos son las legumbres que luego comercializa. Estas labores le permiten obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar. Mauro en busca de mejorar su negocio solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, piedra y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un estanque para incrementar el número de tilapias. De esta manera aumentar las ventas y así también las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mauro, who is 56 years old, lives in his own home along with his life companion, their two adult children, their 5-year-old grandson, and their 11-year-old granddaughter. Mauro is a very responsible man who, seeking to support his family, works selling tilapia. In addition to this, he works in agriculture, where his principal crops are the vegetables that he then sells. These activities allow him to obtain the necessary income to support the household economy.

Mauro, seeking to improve his business, is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in sand, cement, and rocks and pay for labor for the construction of a pond in order to increase the number of tilapia [he raises] and in this way to increase his sales and thus also his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, and rocks and pay for labor for the construction of a pond to increase the number of tilapia [he is raising]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement, bricks, and to pay for labor to build new ponds to increase his tilapia production.

loans.name: Elsi Felipa

texts.es: Elsi de 47 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Elsi es una madre responsable y trabajadora, que en busca de mantener la economía del hogar administra un pequeño negocio de molino de nixtamal, en vista que es la única persona que presta estos servicios en la comunidad, posee una cantidad bastante grande de clientes. Gracias a este negocio y a la ayuda que brinda su compañero de vida puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro e instalación de un portón en su vivienda para poder tener mayor seguridad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Elsi is 47 year old.  She lives alongside her life companion and her 17 year old son.  Elsi is a responsible and hardworking mother, who in search of maintaining the economy of the home, runs a small business of a corn mill.  Since she is the only person that lends this service to the community, she has a fairly large clientele.  Thanks to this business and the help that her life partner provides, she can satisfy the basic needs of her family.

In search of improving her quality of life, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, and payment of manual labor to build a wall and installation of a portion of her home to be able to have better security in her home.

loans.use: To invest in bricks, cement, sand, and payment of manual labor to build a wall and installation of a portion of her home.

loans.name: Ma. Leonisa

texts.en:
Ma. Leonisa is engaged in a farming and hog raising business in her town of San Miguel, Bohol. She started farming four years ago to provide for her five children. Her eldest is 12 and her youngest is 2.

Ma. Leonisa needs help to maintain her farm. She is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to pay for the labor of other farmers who will be helping during the planting season. Ma. Leonisa can only dream that everything will pay off in terms of her capacity to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to pay for labor for her farm.

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
Era is 48 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family, including running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods, and shampoo and other personal care products.

Era has taken and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling beverages.

Era aspires to build and to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods, and shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline, 44, is a married woman with twelve children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been running for 20 years. Evangeline requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is 61 years old and a retired man. He lives alone as his kids are adults already. Sergio is a very optimistic man and he needs another loan to keep fixing his house.

This time he will paint the front of his house. Sergio is healthy and he hopes you can trust him again, because he has the time to supervise the work, so this is a good chance for him.

loans.use: to paint the front of his house

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Con 61 años de edad, Alejandro reside en casa propia al lado de su compañera de vida y su hijo quien es mayor de edad. Alejandro en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia se dedica a la crianza y venta de tilapia. Negocio que le permite poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener la economía del hogar. Este negocio lo administra desde hace 6 años aproximadamente, gracias a esto es muy bien reconocido en el mercado y hace que sus clientes le prefieran. Es por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillos, piedras y pago de mano de obra para construir una pecera en donde criar a un número mayor de tilapias y así aumentar las ganancias para mantener la economía de su hogar. También Alejandro se siente muy agradecido con el crédito anterior, ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir en una pecera y de esta manera aumentó su ganancia.
texts.en:
At 61 years of age, Alejandro resides in his own home alongside his life companion and his adult son.  Alejandro, in search of improving his quality of life and that of his family, works raising and selling tilapia.  This business allows him to be able to obtain the necessary income to be able to maintain the economy of the house.  He has administered this business for about the last six years.  Thanks to this, he is very well known in the market and his customers prefer him.

It is for that that he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, bricks, stones, and payment of manual labor to be able to build a fish pond in which to raise a larger number of tilapia and thus increase the earning to maintain the economy of his home.  Also, Alejandro feels very grateful for the previous loan, since thanks to that, he could invest in a fish pond and in this way increase his earnings.

loans.use: To invest in sand, cement, bricks, stones, and payment of manual labor to build fish pond in which to raise a larger number of tilapia.

loans.name: Umaki Group

texts.en:
Sospitar is in his early 60s and is married with four children. Three of them are grown up and one of them is still in school. He has been running a butcher business. He works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the meat stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the meat stock and serve more customers. He dreams building another house and to buy a motor cycle.

Sospitar will share this loan with her loan group Umaki which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the meat stock and serve more customers.

loans.name: The Builders Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is forty years old Aminata. She is married and has three children. Her children are all school aged. Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of three women, who have come together to help each other achiev their individual dreams. “The Builders” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group. “The Builders” group needs a total loan of SLL6,000,000. Aminata will receive SLL3,000,000 which she needs in order to purchase cartons of milk, sugar, dozens of eggs etc. for her business. (see group picture, Aminata is in the middle).

Aminata established her ice cream business 16 years ago; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Aminata uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and to support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday from 9 am to 7 pm. every week. Aminata is a hardworking woman.

In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire University education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting the group.

loans.use: purchase cartons of milk, sugar, dozens of eggs etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Farming is the most common source of income for residents of San Miguel, Bohol. Marites, who is 46 years old, is from this town and she also does farming and raises hogs for a living. She is married with 3 children ages 12, 15 and 17.

Marites is struggling to keep her farming business and so she is asking for a loan to buy two kinds of feed for the sow and for the piglets as well as supplements. Her main goal is to have a higher income out of this business. The additional income will go towards her family's daily consumption and her children's education. In the future, Marites hopes to successfully send her children to college until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a piggery owner from the municipality of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 54 years old and and raising hogs has been something that she knows best having done this for 21 years. She is also a rice farmer. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer to keep her crops healthy and disease-free and more piglets to raise. Julieta hope to make her planned expansion possible by help of the loan. Her income will pay for her two chlildren ages 13 and 15. In the future, she hope to make her business more successful so she can save for old age and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of five school-aged children. She has been in the farming business for more than 13 years with her husband. Her husband also works as a carpenter. Janet is asking for a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer, urea, and pesticides. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm as well as her yield and income. In the future, Janet has hopes of making her farming venture sustainable and reliable. Her profit will be used primarily for school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Mathew has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Mathew can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Mathew will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Mathew is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Mrs. Thao is a hardworking woman, 55 years old and lives with her husband in a small house. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business . With more than 15 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 39 years old, married and has four children. The loan can help her to build a latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Argelia Marina

texts.es: Argelia de 61 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijas mayores de edad y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Argelia es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora que en busca de cubrir sus necesidades básicas se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas como lo son las pupusas, este negocio lo administra desde hace 12 años. Gracias al tiempo que tiene de manejar el negocio ha logrado adquirir una gran cantidad de clientes y es por ello que la demanda ha aumentado, por lo que decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijol, queso y chicharrón para aumentar la producción de pupusas y de esta manera aumentar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en: Argelia is 61 years old. She lives with her adult daughters and her life companion who helps her with the household economy. Argelia is a very responsible and hard-working woman who looking to cover the basic necessities works selling traditional food such as pupusas. She has run this business for 12 years. Thanks to the amount of time she has operated her business she has managed to acquire a good quantity of clients and because of this her demand has increased. So she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, beans, cheese and pork cracklings to increase her production of pupusas and in this way increase the sales of her business.

loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, cheese and pork cracklings to increase her production of pupusas and in this way increase the sales of her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five school-aged children Jessica has been a seaweed farmer for six years. Jessica has requested a loan to purchase straw, wooden stakes and fuel. Jessica hopes to have a good business so she can continue to pay for her children's school fees and give them healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden stakes and fuel

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 57-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She cooks rice cakes and steamed rice cake to sell in her neighborhood. She also farms rice. This has been her business for nine years now. Nida is living in a very simple house, made of light materials. It is her dream to make it sturdy and possibly concrete.

She is asking a loan to buy hollow block, cement and pay for labor of carpenters. She will also use some money to pay for school fees for her children ages 15 and 17. Nida dreams of a better life for her family through her business.

loans.use: to buy hollow block, cement to improve her house and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs. Lan is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. She is married and has two children. She needs loan to build a latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from small business so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Fuente De Amor Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Fuente de Amor¨ lo conforman mujeres dedicadas a sacar adelante a sus familias de unas maneras honradas y orgullosas de sus actividades comerciales. Coordinado por Francisca, de 43 años de edad, ajuntada y que por cinco ciclos ha estado trabajando con los financiamientos de ADIM, ahora solicita nuevamente crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras  y con la ayuda de su hijo ha sacado adelante. Ahora comprara plátanos, cebollas, quequisques, tomates, repollos, papas, y para el mantenimiento de la berlina que ayuda a trasportar sus productos. Las demás socias son Ángela y Carmen, ambas se dedican a la venta de  repuestos para bicletas; y Rosa de 42 años dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The group "Fuente de Amor" (Fountain of Love) is formed by women who are dedicated to raising their families with integrity and are proud of their business activities. It is coordinated by Francisca, who is 43 years old, is in a relationship, and for five years has been working with financing from ADIM. Now she is again applying for a loan to invest in her business of selling fruits and vegetables, and with the help of her son, she has gotten ahead.

Now she will buy bananas, onions, coco yams, tomatoes, cabbages, and potatoes, and she will maintain the car that helps to transport her products.

The other members are Ángela and Carmen, both of whom sell spare parts for bicycles, and Rosa, 42 years old, who sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, coco yams, tomatoes, cabbages, and potatoes and to maintain the car that helps to transport her products.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 59 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia con la que vive, Diego está muy contento porque gracias a su préstamo pudo realizar la  inversión en su cultivo y sus ingresos mejoraron, Diego solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar sus insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de hortalizas.
Diego tiene le anhelo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Diego is a 59-year-old man. He is married and lives with his beautiful family. Diego is very happy because thanks to his loan he was able to make an investment in his crops and his income improved. Diego requests a new loan to buy his agricultural supplies for the maintenance of his vegetable crops.

Diego wishes to improve his family's quality of life and to finish the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana es una joven muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropas, comenta que con sacrificio esta logrando hacerse conocida con su clientela, y tiene ya bastante que siempre les hace muchos pedidos. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar insumos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo de la compra de nuevas prendas para la venta, como ser: pantalones, camisas, polleras, blusas y otros, y de esa forma mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Biviana it Is a very hard-working young woman who sells clothing. She says that with sacrifice she is succeeding in making herself known to her clientele and already has enough customers that she gets many orders.

She says that she used her previous loan to be able to buy a variety of supplies so that she could continue with her sales. Today she is requesting this new loan so that she can invest in the purchase of new articles of clothing to sell, such as pants, shirts, skirts, blouses and other items, and that way improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell, such as pants, shirts, skirts, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Ytororo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es un comité unido que se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leticia, una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio del programa de comité de mujeres ha podido crecer y mejorar el emprendimiento que tiene, el cual es la venta de ropas variadas de todo tipo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, blusas, vestidos y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of San Lorenzo. It is a united committee that works to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones, through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Leticia, a very hard-working woman who, through the women's group program, has been able to grow and to improve her business selling clothes of all types. She is a very hard-working person who fights to better her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to purchase t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses, dresses, etc. so that she can continue to meet her customers' demand. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has, and it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y los prestamos de Kiva ha podido mejorar y crecer mucho en su negocio el cual es una despensa, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior ha podido surtir su negocio con productos variados que le permitió poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
Pide hoy este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, panificados, carne, y otros insumos, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando y creciendo a través de la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman who with the help of Fundación Paraguaya and the Kiva loans has been able to improve and expand her small grocery store business a great deal.

She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, and says that through the previous loan she has been able to stock her business with a variety of products that enabled her to fill orders from her customers. Now she is asking for a new loan so that she can buy fruits, vegetables, baked goods, meat and other supplies, and that way be able to continue with her sales, improving and growing through the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy stock for her small grocery store, such as fruits, vegetables, baked goods, meat and other supplies.

loans.name: Muhammed Sani

texts.en:
Muhammed Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Muhammed Sani is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone.  As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Muhammed Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.  With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammed Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Muhammed Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар молодая, умная и красивая девушка. Ей всего 22 года. Она замужем и пока не имеет детей. Нилуфар жительница района Пяндж. Она там родилась и выросла. Нилуфар учится заочном отделение в университете города Душанбе. Нилуфар в городе Душанбе проживает вместе с тетей. Она еще работает ассистентом по программе KIVA  в МДО «ХУМО». Нилуфар выбрала себе хороший опыт в работе, она освоила все навыки своей работы. Нилуфар самостоятельная девушка. Она обратилась за кредитом, для лечения отца. Ее отец болеет и ему надо сделать операцию. Для операции и лечения у них нет денежных средств. По этой причине Нилуфар просит кредит. Ее отец еще молодой и его жизнь впереди. Он скоро будет дедушкой, и у него много мечта в дальнейшем. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет Нилуфар сохранить жизнь отца. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!!
texts.en:
Nilufar is a young, smart, beautiful woman. She is 22 years old, married, and doesn't have any children yet. She lives in the Pyandj area, where she was born and raised. Nilufar studies through the distance learning department at a university in Dushanbe. She stays with her aunt there. She also works as an assistant with Kiva and MDO Humo. Nilufar mastered the skills needed for her job and has earned great experience. She is an independent woman.

Nilufar is requesting a loan to pay for her father's medical treatment. He is young and has his life ahead of him, but is also sick and in need of an operation. Soon he will become a grandfather - something he has dreamed of for a long time! This loan will help Nilufar save her father's life. You can help her right now!!

loans.use: pay for her father's surgery and treatment.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 58 years old and has two children. Rosalina is married woman.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Rosalina has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ronesia

texts.en:
Ronesia is 57 years old, married, and has five children.  For 4 years she has operated an agricultural business farming coconut in the Philippines, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ronesia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ronesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anionting Group

texts.en:
Theodora is a member of Anointing Group. She is married with three children, aged twenty-two, fourteen and two months old. Two of her children are attending school. In the group picture, Theodora is in the middle.

Five years ago, Theodora established her drinks business to support her children in school. From the profit she makes from the business, she pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food. She sells drinks 6 days per week from 10am to 6pm.

Theodora plans to use the loan to buy 5 cartons of beer, 5 crates of soft drink and 20 bundles of pure water etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used in paying her children's school fees.

Theodora and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL, of which Theodora is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.
Theodora plans to give her children the best education possible, to build a house and to live a happy life.

Theodora and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Augustine has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land - 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Augustine would have had to sell his maize at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With the help of this loan, Augustine can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Augustine will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Augustine is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saifullahi

texts.en:
Saifullahi is a Babban Gona farmer. Saifullahi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Saifullahi would have had to sell his maize at Harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With this loan, Saifullahi can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Saifullahi has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Saifullahi is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: No Worry Group

texts.en:
Abie is a thirty-two years old business woman. She is a member of No Worry solidarity group. Abie's solidarity group has five members. In the group picture, Abie is in the middle of the picture.

Fifteen years ago, Abie established her provision business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days a week, from 8am to 6pm. 

“Nor Worry” group needs a total loan of 6,000,000 SLL. Abie is entitled to 1,200,000 SLL which she will use to buy cartons of milk, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her to generate more profit to support her family. Abie is married with two children, aged thirteen and fifteen years, and all are attending school.
In the future, Abie plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. 

Abie and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of milk, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sumamei 1 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Simamei 1 and are into the trade of fish, banku (cooked corn and cassava dough), soft drinks, cosmetics, and also provide seamstress services. They have been in the loan business with ID-Ghana for some time now and are very hardworking and extremely competent in their trades. 

Priscilla is the group representative and is taking a loan from Kiva for the second time. She has been very instrumental and active in the group. She is in her forth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and is standing in the far righthand side of the photograph. She has been selling cosmetics for three years. She is now 27 years old and married with one dependent child, and they are live together in an apartment. Priscilla and her colleagues will need GHS10,500 to expand their businesses, and Priscilla will use her share of the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell to customers. 

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. 
Evelyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.
She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has one child and he lives in Masindi, Uganda.

He sells milk and ghee to earn income. He started the business to support himself and his child. When he saw that little income was being generated, he decided to extend his business to Sudan, outside of Uganda, where he trades some of his ghee. 

He dreams of buying a lorry that can be used for transporting his goods to Sudan. He is always affected by dry seasons due to seasonal changes, and this can significantly lead to little yields. 

He needs a loan to buy milk and ghee to sell.

loans.use: to buy milk and ghee to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felomina is 48-years-old and has two children attending school.

Felomina has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Felomina requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Felomina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona farmer. Isah is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Isah would have had to sell his maize at Harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market. With this loan, Isah can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Isah has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Isah is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva hails from Trinidad, Bohol.  She is 42 years old with three dependents who are ages 7, 8 and 18. She works hard on the farm, growing rice for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for house renovation expenses. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business. In the future, she hopes to see her children having a better chance in life through attending school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for house renovation expenses.

loans.name: Zamirahan

texts.ru: Замирахан, 57 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, с 1993 года работает учителем в средней школе. Ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 7,800 сом (KGS). Замирахан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), на ремонт дома. Свои доходы Замирахан будет и дальше направлять на улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Zamirahan is a 57-year-old widow with two children.  She has a university education and she has been working as a school teacher since 1993.  Her monthly salary comes up to 7,800 som (KGS).  She has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, to request a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to this loan, she'll be able to perform repairs inside her house.  She will continue to use her income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements in her house.

loans.name: Kulsara

texts.ru: Кулсара, 62 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, по характеру очень спокойная, трудолюбивая и доброжелательная женщина. Кулсара начала свой бизнес в 2000 году, начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсары, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на закуп 4 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулсара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kulsara is 62 years old and married.  She has a secondary education.  By nature, she is a quiet, hardworking, and friendly woman.  She started her own farming and animal husbandry business in 2000, with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has 15 sheep and she makes a monthly income of about 12,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Kulsara has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow her to buy four sheep and therefore increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business, which will in turn help her to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase four sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: San Geronimo Group

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 48-year-old woman with the goal of moving successfully ahead in her life. She also wants to help out her parents with their household expenses. She belongs to the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Gerónimo” along with seven other ladies. The Trust Bank is located in Chiantla in northwestern Guatemala.

Three years ago, Magdalena opened a small restaurant where she sold pizza. The business was a success in the community. Today, this hardworking entrepreneur has a business partner. Nevertheless, she needs financial capital and so she joined Friendship Bridge to ask for a loan. She would like to buy ingredients for her delicious pizzas including flour, sausages, pepperoni, as well as supplies for the restaurant. Her goal is to continue to expand her business so that it is self-sustaining.

Magdalena and her friends in the Trust Bank learn a lot from their monthly educational trainings that take place after they transact business on their loans. A facilitator from Friendship Bridge shares information with them about the world within them and around them. One month, they may learn about health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. Another month, the topic might be women’s health, women’s bodies and proper hygiene. Since the women have had little or no education, they are eager to learn.

Gratitude to Kiva lenders for learning about Magdalena and the seven members of the Trust Bank. Armed with their new tools, they are ready to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community of Chiantla! Thank you!

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her delicious pizzas including flour, sausages, pepperoni, as well as supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
From Chorkor, these women are part of a group called Happiness. These ladies are focused on transforming their lives through empowerment, small loans and education. They have a vision of raising their standard of living and creating a more prosperous future for themselves and their families. They are selling foodstuffs, wigs, porridge, rice and also provide services like seamstressing and hair dressing. 

Helena, a member of Happiness, is married with one child. She is a 45-year-old trader who has been selling foodstuffs for three years. Helena wants to continue to support her family. Helena buys rice, which is well patronized by customers in her area of residence. She has made a tremendous improvement in her business and so have the other members. The ladies do not know how to read or write and so ID Ghana's training sessions are essential to their success as caretakers of their family and as business entrepreneurs. The training is given in the indigenous language of the women, often with pictures, and covers a variety of subjects including effective business management practices, nutritional and health tools, and self-esteem. 

The seven women look forward to creating a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice which is well patronized by customers in her area of residence.

loans.name: Rosas Del Jardin Group

texts.en:
The Mission of Friendship Bridge is “to empower impoverished Guatemalan women to create a better future for themselves, their children and their communities through microfinance and education called 'Microcredit Plus'". The vision of the organization is a world in which empowered women eliminate poverty.

Dionicia is 38 years old, married, and President of the “Rosas del Jardin” Trust Bank in Huehuetenango. She, along with her husband, make and sell shoes which are in great demand at this time of year because of end-of-the-year parties, graduations, baptisms, etc. Dionicia needs to inject capital into her business and will use the funds to buy raw materials for the shoes. She wants to take advantage of increased sales at this time of the year.

The women are keenly aware of the value of education for their children. An overwhelmingly majority of them hold this as their highest goal. The ladies have had little or no education and so the training held at their monthly meetings is very important to them. They are eager to learn how to manage their loans effectively and learn about budgeting, planning, pricing, marketing, customer service and accounting. They take better care of their families with information about nutrition, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. And they become more aware of themselves as women as they learn about how their bodies work and women’s health.

The generosity of Kiva investors is greatly appreciated by Dionicia and the ladies in the “Rosas del Jardin” Trust Bank. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoes.

loans.name: Nyabu Bi Yoona - Nakpayili Group

texts.en:
Ayishetu is a 42-year-old married woman living in Nakpayili, located in the eastern corridor of the northern region of Ghana. Ayishetu has six children, all of who attend school. She is the individual seated first on the right with her hand on the basin of gari (baked cassava chippings) in front of her in the group photo. 

Ayishetu is a member of a hard working women's group called ‘Nyabu bi yoona - Nakpayili’. The group members are engaged in gari processing and petty trading, yet challenged with inadequate capital to sufficiently operate.

Therefore, the group has requested a loan of GHC 3,500, of which Ayishetu’s share is GHC 200. The loan will help Ayishetu to buy cassava from farmers to make gari to sell at the local markets. She intends to get more income to pay off this loan, look after her children and grow her business.  

Ayishetu is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy cassava from farmers to process gari to sell at the local markets.

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.ru: Счастливая мать двоих детей, это  Умедахон. У нее 2 маленьких детишек. Детям 6 и 3 года. Умедахон вместе мужем, свекровью и детьми живет в городе Исфара. Ее муж честный и ответственный человек. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. У Умедахон тоже есть свой постоянный источник доход. Она сидя дома зарабатывает на жизнь. По ее словам удобно заниматься шитьем дома, потому что она ухаживает за детьми и параллельно занимается шитьем. Умедахон любить свою работу, она любить кроить и шить. Умедахон решила взять кредит для мероприятия обрезания старшего сына. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Умедахон обратилась за кредитом. Она будет очень благодарно на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Umedahon is a happy mother of two children. She has two small kids. They are six and three years old. Umedahon lives with her husband, mother-in-law and children in Isfara city. Her husband is an honest and responsible person. He works in construction, renovating houses.

Umedahon also has her own regular source of income, and earns a living from home. In her words, it is convenient to do her sewing from home, because she can care for the children and do her sewing at the same time. She loves her work cutting and sewing.

Umedahon has decided to take out a loan for her oldest son's circumcision celebration. Umedahon has applied for a loan because of insufficient funds. She will be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to circumcise her elder son.

loans.name: Balbibi

texts.ru:
Балбиби  очень жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 55 лет. Она замужем и имеет одну дочку. Сама она работает библиотекаршей. Она всегда мечтала дать своей дочери достойное образование и старается делать всё возможное чтобы её дочь этого достигла и стала образованным человеком. 
 Дочь Балбиби  учится  в университете, и они должны оплатить за обучение. Но у Балбиби на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд, где узнала что есть возможность получить кредит на образование. Балбиби  желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своей дочки. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Balbibi is a very hardworking woman with a positive attitude in life.  She is 55 years old, married, and she has one daughter.  She works as a librarian.  She has always dreamed of giving her daughter a good education and tries to do everything possible so her daughter will achieve this and become an educated person.

Balbibi's daughter is a university student.  The family needs to pay for her education.  However, Balbibi doesn't have enough money to make this payment right away.  For this reason, she has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, because she has heard about the possibility of getting an education loan.  Balbibi would like to get a loan to pay for her daughter's education.  She is looking forward to a positive outcome and she thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим, 34 года, не замужем, воспитывает дочь. У Мээрим - высшее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и ответственной женщине. Мээрим в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2003 года ведет свой бизнес - салон красоты. Уже наработаны постоянные клиенты. Доходы от бизнеса Мээрим составляет 31,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мээрим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оборудования. Доходы от кредита Мээрим планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем намерена приобрести авто.
texts.en: Meerim is 34 years old, unmarried, and is raising a daughter. Meerim has a higher education. She has very good feedback from her neighbors.
