They speak of her as a kind and responsible woman. Meerim has been running her own business since 2003 as the main source of income for her family - a beauty salon. It has already established regular customers. The income from Meerim's business is 31,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business further, Meerim has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 85,000 som (KGS) to buy equipment. Meerim plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further growth of her business, and also intends to buy a car in future.

loans.use: to buy equipment and furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David continúa con su negocio de servicio técnico a computadoras. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando muebles para su negocio, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajó constantemente. Actualmente su negocio cuenta con demanda y las necesidades que tiene son nuevas a mediada que la tecnología avanza, “necesito una nueva herramienta de trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda del servicio, la desventaja es la falta de un re grabador de BIOS para mejorar el servicio. Su sueño es tener una tienda en su domicilio, él desea comprar un re grabador de BIOS para mejorar el servicio generando mejores ingresos económicos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para comprar un re grabador de BIOS para mejorar el servicio técnico.
texts.en:
David continues in his computer technical services business. He used a previous loan to buy furniture for his business and his loan payments were made on time as he worked consistently.

Currently, there is a demand for his services and he needs to stay up with new technology. "I need new work tools..." he says. The advantage of his business is the demand and the disadvantage is the lack of a BIOS programmer to improve his service.

His goal is to set up a shop at home. He wants to buy a BIOS progammer to improve his service and earn more income. This is his second loan through the institution in the five years he has been in business.

Therefore, David is requesting a loan to buy a BIOS programmer to improve his technical service.

loans.use: to buy a BIOS programmer to improve his technical service.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de arena y piedra.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy constante. Su trabajo lo realiza en el rio ‘kalajahuira’ zona urbana donde existen vertientes que son utilizan por los pobladores para abastecerse de agua. 
Fernando es morena de baja estatura y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus padres que son ancianos y no trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de arena y piedra, para realizar su trabajo él reúne arena y piedras para lavarlas en una máquina que se encarga de separarlas, luego las carga en su camión y las entrega, “el trabajo es bien duro, 2 ayudantes me colaboran…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar un motor para su máquina lavadora de piedras. Su sueño es comprarse una volqueta, él desea comprar un motor para su máquina lavadora de piedras. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Fernando solicita un préstamo para comprar un motor para la máquina lavadora de piedras.
texts.en:
Fernando, 29, is single and has no children. His business is selling sand and stone.

He is enterprising, independent and very consistent. He works in the urban area of the Kalajahuira River where there are slopes used by the locals for their water supply.

Fernando has a dark complexion, is short in height and has a thin physique. His native language is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He lives with his parents who are eldery and no longer work. They live in an adobe house that has electricity and well water.

Fernando sells sand and stone, and does his job by cleaning the sand and stone in a machine that separates the two. Then he loads them on his truck for delivery. "The work is very hard and I have two assistants who help me..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he has steady customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a motor for the cleaning machine.

His dream is to buy a dump truck,
and he wants to buy a motor for the cleaning machine. This is his first loan through the institution in the two years he has been in business.

The loan requested by Fernando is to buy a motor for the cleaning machine.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his stone cleaning machine.

loans.name: Wendy Yesenia

texts.es: Wendy es una joven de 22 años que reside en casa propia, en donde vive al lado de su compañero de vida. Ella administra una pequeña tienda que posee en su vivienda, además en busca de aumentar los ingresos para su hogar se dedica a la venta de sandalias. Estos negocios los administra desde hace algunos años, lo que le permite contar con un número bastante grande de clientes y gracias a esto posee una gran demanda para sus productos. Y es por lo que Wendy solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandalias, bebidas, pan, salsas, y demás productos para maximizar sus ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Wenday, 22, lives in her own house with her life partner. She runs a small store at home and also sells sandals for extra income. She has been in business for several years and has a good number of customers, thanks to which there is a big demand for her products.

Therefore, Wendy is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy sandals, beverages, bread, sauces and other products to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy sandals, beverages, bread, sauces and other products to increase sales.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan es de la Ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, es tornero, se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 5 años, empezó como ayudante de su hermano luego trabajo en varios talleres, y de esa manera se hizo de muy capital para poder montar su propio negocio.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Hernan is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. He is a lathe machine operator and has worked in the trade for over five years. He started out helping his brother and then worked in several shops and earned enough capital to open his own business.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy tools so he can continue offering services to his customers. He is grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Paula Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Paula es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de equipo industrial necesario para el desarrollo de dicho proyecto. De esta forma logrará incrementar su volumen de ventas y aumentar los ingresos de dicha actividad.
texts.en: Paula is an entrepreneur who makes and sells bread.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,050,000 CRC to buy the industrial equipment she needs for her business.  This will allow her to increase sales and income.

loans.use: to buy industrial equipment for her bakery business.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
La Sra. Alba es comerciante, tiene una cantina en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, tiene 2 hijos ambos un pequeños, que con la ayuda de su marido luchan para poder salir adelante. Comenta que su marido tiene una carnicería, y por medio de su trabajo ambos se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para surtir su despensa, como ser golosinas, bebidas, comestibles, y otros variados, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is a trader. She has a snack bar where she works everyday starting very early. She has two small children for whom, with the help of her husband, she fights so they can progress. She tells us that her husband has a butcher shop and, through their work, they both help each other to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy items to stock her shop such as candies, drinks, groceries and other various items so she can keep up with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her snack bar like sweets, drinks, groceries and other various things.

loans.name: Josue Leonardo

texts.es:
Josúe, de 22 años de edad, es un hombre muy luchador, trabajador y reconocido en su comunidad, estudio hasta noveno grado en el centro escolar de su comunidad, está acompañado y tiene un hermoso bebé de 7 meses de nacido.

Josúe, se dedica a  la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, pues su padre le enseño a cultivar la tierra, este trabajo es pesado porque lo hacen bajo el sol, pero a pesar de eso, se esfuerza para salir adelante con su pequeña familia.

Josúe, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos y así obtener una buena cosecha.

Josúe, sueña con seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer mejores condiciones a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Josúe, 22 years old, is a very hard working man, known in his community. He finished ninth grade in the central school in his community. He is married and has a beautiful 7 month old baby.

Josúe has been dedicated to farming since he was very small since his father taught him to cultivate the land. This work is tough because he does it under the son, but despite this, he works hard to progress with his small family.

Josúe needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs for his crops and thus obtain a good harvest.

Josúe dreams to continue working to improve his family's quality of life and to offer better conditions to his small son.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his crops.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La Sra. Petrona continua con su negocio de confecciones, comenta que por medio de su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido ha podido crecer y de esa forma mantener a sus seres queridos, evitando que pasen por necesidades como las que ellos tuvieron que pasar.
Petrona comenta que este es su segundo préstamo, y el anterior le ha sido muy útil para poder mejorar su servicio. Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar telas en cantidad para uso en confecciones, y de esa forma poder continuar luchando.
texts.en:
Petrona continues with her clothing business. She tells us that through hard work and with the help of her husband, she has been able to grow and thus support her loved ones avoiding giving up necessities like they had to give up before.

Petrona tells us that this is her second loan and the previous has been very useful to improve her service. She is requesting this new loan to be able to buy fabric in bulk to use in making clothing and thus be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
La Señora Nilsa tiene 30 años de edad es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, y con mucha humildad y sacrifico se está ganando el cariño de sus clientes  tiene un negocio en la ciudad donde vende todo tipo de hules plásticos, termos , todo tipo de reciclados 
Solicita el préstamo para agrandar su negocio y para salir más adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su emprendimiento, y de esa forma ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Nilsa is 30 years old. She is from the city of Paraguari. She is a very entrepreneurial and hard working woman who wants to progress and, with a lot of humility and sacrifice, she is earning the love of her customers. She has a business in the city where she sells all types of rubber, plastics, thermos, and all kinds of recycled items.

She is requesting the loan to enlarge her business and so she can progress more. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her enterprise and thus help her loved ones.

loans.use: to enlarge her sales business.

loans.name: Aida Del Rocio

texts.es: Aida es una persona muy trabajadora y divertida tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su sobrino Michael  de 3 añitos de edad, a quien da techo y comida  y su esposo el cual trabaja en  ventas de ropa ambulante pero el dinero que gana es muy poco y no puede cubrir todos los  gastos de casa,  desde 7 meses aproximadamente se dedica a su pequeña tienda la cual le ha ayudado a cubrir gastos y ha mejorado su situación económica Aida desea incrementar sus ventas con el préstamo para poder ahorrar y comprar una casa  además prepararse para la escuela de Michael ya que sus deseos son que estudie y sea todo un profesional y no tenga que abandonar los estudios
texts.en: Aida is a very hard working and fun person who is 20 years old. She lives with her nephew Michael who is 3 years old and to whom she provides food and a home and with her husband who works selling clothing on foot. The money he earns is very little and he can't cover all of the expenses of the home. For almost 7 months she has been dedicated to her small store which has helped her cover expenses and has improved her economic situation. Aida wishes to increase her sales with the loan so she can save and buy a house, as well as prepare herself for Michael's education since her wish is that he go to school and become a professional and does not have to abandon his education.

loans.use: to buy products for the store.

loans.name: Las Activas De Las 8 Group

texts.en:
The community of Corral Chiquito is located in a rural area in the majestic department of Huehuetenango. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Activas de la 8” was formed by 8 women. The majority of them are mothers who are hard-working and seeking a better future for themselves and their children.

The Treasurer of the Trust Bank is 46 year old Telma who is married with 4 children (2 boys and 2 girls). She wants to help her husband meet the monthly expenses of the family that include education for the children. The couple understands that education is a key to a better future for them. Telma sells chicken meat and has seen a way to open up a second business. She is going to open a tortilla shop and is requesting a loan to purchase large sacks of corn and lime as well as firewood. She is hopeful that this second business will generate the extra income that is needed by the family. In her words, “Thank you for giving me the opportunity to get a loan. I really need it. I’m really happy that I have found a new business that my community really needs. I want to fill that need and open my tortilla shop.”

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge combines microloans with basic education on everyday topics including budgeting, marketing and sales, nutrition, women’s rights and self esteem.  These educational trainings are presented by a Facilitator from the organization in the indigenous language of the women. As the women have had little or no formal education, there are a lot of pictures, photographs, drawings and role playing.

KIVA investors are greatly valued by Telma and the ladies in the Trust Bank. We look forward to providing a follow-up report on the group in the future. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase large sacks of corn and lime as well as firewood.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 49 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school, Solita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Solita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Solita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general sstore. Gloria is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to  buy variety of vegetable to sell for her vegetables vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicitas is 63 years old now.

Felicitas has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Felicitas requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fruit to sell.

Felicitas has been in this business for 37 years. In the future, Felicitas would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 48 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods home product care, and other groceries.

Flora has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Cozette

texts.en:
Cozette is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cozette is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Cozette has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Cozette requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

Cozette has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Cozette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old, with three children. With two children in school, Gladys works very hard to provide for them.

Gladys runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Gladys has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gladys would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 54 years old and has four children. Patricia is married and has three children who are in school.

Patricia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Patricia has been in this for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en: Mrs. Hoan is a hardworking woman, 25 years old . She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without an hygienic latrine. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and small business. She would like to borrow  he loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building her dream, a home for her daughter.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 19 a farmer, has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Ann is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.
Come on, go ahead and support this business woman.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.ru: Холнисо уроженка района Вахш. Она 54 летняя женщина. Холнисо очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она живет вместе с братом, невесткой и племянниками. Холнисо работает санитаркой в больнице. Еще у нее имеется еще деятельность. Холнисо у себя дома выращивает скота и занимается земледелием. У нее имеется 1.82 Га земельный участок. Ей в работе помогает невестка. Холнисо на все успевает, ей нравится выращивать скота и проводит времени на земле. Холнисо решила расширить деятельность. Она планирует сажать новый урожай, и ей надо отработать землю с минеральными удобрениями. Холнисо с такими планами обратилась за кредитом, для купли минеральных удобрений и семян урожай.
texts.en: Kholniso is a native of the Vakhsh region.She is a 54-year-old woman. Kholniso is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her brother, sister-in-law and nephews. Kholniso works as a hospital cleaner. She also has another business. Kholniso rears livestock at home and grows crops. She has a 1.82 hectare plot of land. Her sister-in-law helps her with her work. Kholniso manages to do everything. She likes rearing livestock and spending time on the land. Kholniso has decided to expand her business. She plans to sow a new crop, and she needs to treat the soil with mineral fertilizer. Kholniso has applied for a loan with these plans, to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maya Natividad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYA NATIVIDAD” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chamarras, venta de zapatos, salón de belleza, venta de productos medicinales, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de edredones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace ocho años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será  para el aumento de capital (compra de edredones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres  hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Maya Natividad" communal group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Rosa is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal group carry out are varied and among them are jacket sales, shoe sales, a beauty salon, medicine sales, transportation service, clothing sales, and quilt sales.

The loan they are getting will benefit the small business owners of whom Rosa is one. She says that this is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a massive promotion that the institution did in the area. Currently, she has a business selling quilts, she indicates that she learned this business at her own initiative eight years ago.

The loan that she is getting now will be to increase her capital (purchase quilts in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase quilts in bulk.

loans.name: Rebaño De Dios Group

texts.es:
Conformados por mujeres laboriosas y emprendedoras se encuentra el grupo ¨Rebaño de Dios¨, quien por 2da vez solicitan crédito para seguir creciendo y ver sus negocios a flote para sacarle provecho y así ofrecer a sus seres queridos una mejor condición de vida. La líder del grupo es Anielka, 27 años, quien se dedica a la ventas de cosechas de diversas frutas según la temporadas, y tiene una pulpería en su domicilio. Su marido es quien le ayuda en los negocios para sacar adelante a su hijo de 10 meses. Ahora con crédito invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, chiverías y más. 
Las demás socias son Olga, 52 años, dedicada a la preparación  y venta de nacatamales, y a la venta de frutas. Ena, 28 años elabora diversos vestidos de niñas en su casa desde hace 3 años, Rosa, 24 años quien se dedica a la costura y elabora en blusas, huipiles, vestidos desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The Rebaño de Dios¨ group is made up of hardworking and enterprising women. They are asking for a loan for the second time to keep growing and seeing their businesses buoyed. They want to benefit from this and offer their loved ones better living conditions. The leader of the group is Anielka, aged 27. She sells different seasonal fruit harvests and she has a store in her home. Her husband is the one who helps her with the businesses in order to get her 10 month old son ahead. Now, with the loan, she will invest in buying sodas, rice, beans, oil, candies and more.

The rest of the of the members are Olga, aged 52, who makes and sells nacatamales and sells fruit; Ena aged 28 , who has made varied dresses for girls in her home for 3 years; Rosa, aged 24 who has sewed blouses, huipiles, and dresses for 8 years.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, beans, oil, candies and more.

loans.name: Fatima Johana

texts.es: Emprendedora, laboriosa y perseverante son características que describen a Fátima, una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro niños de 7,6,3 y 2 años de edad, quienes son su mayor motivación para trabajar día a día y brindar un futuro mejor junto con el apoyo económico de su marido, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales desde hace tres años, donde oferta a sus clientes variedad de sabores, solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de frutas como: naranja, cálala, pitaya, cacao, leche y azúcar. Una de sus metas es crear un puesto de carnicería, para seguir creciendo económicamente.
texts.en: Enterprising, hard-working, and determined are the characteristics that describe Fátima, a 28-year-old woman, married and the mother of four children, ages 7, 6, 3, and 2, who are her greatest motivation to work day by day and offer them a better future along with the economic support of her husband. She has worked selling natural drinks for three years, where she offers her customers a variety of flavors. She is applying for her first loan cycle in the institution to purchase fruits such as oranges, passion fruits, dragon fruits, cocoa, milk, and sugar. One of her goals is to make a butcher shop to continue growing economically.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, passion fruits, dragon fruits, cocoa, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Renacer, ya que las integrantes se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y renacer en sus vidas. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por poder mejorar y darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo es la Sra. Basilisa, una humilde y trabajadora señora, ella se dedica a las confecciones, y por medio de este trabajo están saliendo adelante con toda su familia. Ella se define a si misma como una mujer muy luchadora,  que pese a los problemas ha podido salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, gomas, botones y otros productos para poder seguir con sus confecciones, y de esa forma cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar cada una sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group is called Renacer [Rebirth], since the members came together to be able to improve their living conditions and be reborn in their lives. They are in the poverty elimination program, fighting and working hard to be able to improve and give their families a better quality of life.

One of the people who make up this group is Basilisa, a humble and hard-working woman. She works making clothing, and through this work she is getting ahead with her whole family. She defines herself as a very determined woman who, despite the problems, has been able to get ahead and improve her living conditions.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fabric, elastics, buttons and other products to be able to continue with her sewing and in this way, meet the customers' orders. She is grateful for the opportunity that they get to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones each day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, elastics, buttons and other products to use in sewing clothing.

loans.name: Edith Maria

texts.es: Edith es una mujer laboriosa de 31 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 1 y 5 años de edad, por quienes trabaja duro para darles una buena educación y sean personas de bien en la sociedad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado desde hace diez años, solicita por noveno ciclo el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas, chores y zapatos. Una de sus metas es desarrollar su negocio y abrir la venta de prendas de acero, con las ganancias que obtuvo en créditos anteriores logro la compra de una vitrina y una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Edith is a hard-working woman, 31 years old, married and the mother of two children, ages 1 and 5, for whom she works hard to give them a good education and so that they become good people in society. She has worked selling clothing and shoes for ten years. She asks for her ninth loan cycle with the institution to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, and shoes. One of her goals is to develop her business and begin selling steel jewelry. With the earnings that she got from previous loans, she managed to purchase a display case and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, shorts and shoes.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Don Adolfo es un microempresario exitoso de 61 años de edad, casado, quien se dedica a la elaboración de ataúd desde hace quince años y solicita el financiamiento número quince a los socios de Kiva para la compra de Madera, vidrio, tela, hilo y juegos de herraje. Con créditos anteriores logro el aumento en la producción y la compra de un compresor.
texts.en: Adolfo is a successful micro-entrepreneur, 61 years old, married, who has worked making coffins for fifteen years and asks for his fiftheenth loan from the Kiva members to purchase wood, glass, fabric, thread, and iron fittings. With previous loans, he managed to increase his production and purchase a compressor.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glass, fabric and thread.

loans.name: El Gueguense Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨El gueguense¨ coordinado por Jimmy de 23 años, ajuntado y padre de dos hijos de 12 y 5 años edad, esta por 3era vez  con ADIM, para solicitar crédito para poder  seguir manteniendo y ayudando a soporte y crecimiento de su fuente de ingreso. Con la ayuda de su cónyuge se dedica a la comercialización de venta de verduras. Y ahora compraran limones, ayotes, pipianes, chilotes, quequisques y yucas. Así podrán tener variedades de productos para ofrecer a su clientela y quedarse con ellos y no con la competencia. Las otras socias son Justa de 37 años, dedicada a la carpintería donde  elaboran  sillas, puertas, y camas. Griselda de 27 años quien comercializa frutas y verduras.
texts.en: The group "El gueguense" coordinated by Jimmy, 23, married and father to two children who are 12 and 5 years old, is for the third time with ADIM to request a loan to be able to keep maintaining and helping to support and grow their sources of income. With the help of his spouse, he is dedicated to selling vegetables. And now they will buy lemons, pumpkins, zucchinis, baby corn, taro and yuccas. Thus they will be able to have a variety of products to offer their customers and they will stay with them and not the competition. The other members are Justa, 37, dedicated to carpentry where she makes chairs, doors and beds and Griselda, 27 who sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy lemons, pumpkins, zucchinis, baby corn, taro and yuccas.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre “Mujeres Trabajadoras” ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres muy trabajadoras que luchan por sus familias, para poder darles un mejor porvenir al que ellas pudieron acceder. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por crecer y mejorar las vidas de cada una.
Las integrantes del grupo se esfuerzan por crecer, ponen su mayor esfuerzo para capacitarse y ayudar a sus familias, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Sofia, ella es vendedora ambulante de ropas, y es por medio de las ventas que hace, que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser: remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros, y de esa manera poder continuar con su humilde trabajo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: The group is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Hardworking Women) because they are such women. These very hardworking women struggle for their families so they can give them a better life to the one they had. They are within the poverty elimination program, working hard to grow and improve the lives of each of them. The group members work hard to grow. They put a large effort in getting trained and helping their families. Sofia is one of its members. She sells clothes as a street vendor, and it is through her sales that she is able to help her family. She is requesting this loan to buy diverse clothing items to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and other things. This way, she will be able to continue with her humble job and keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy diverse clothing items to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and other things.

loans.name: Magna

texts.en:
Magna is 46 years old, married and lives in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She is a farmer, primarily growing vegetables that supply the local market.

Recently, she approached Paglaum MPC for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers.

location.town: Sindangan-Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting to earning income. Isabelita has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Isabelita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that can result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Isabelita hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to produce higher-yielding seedlings.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda has a mango orchard in Sindangan. She also makes a living through her riceland.

As she faces the next cropping season, she wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations.

She wants to have enough supply of fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the cooperative. She hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for more produce.

location.town: Sindangan -  Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends for her farming activities.

She borrowed an amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her boost her farming income.

She looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Ana Corazon

texts.en:
Ana Corazon is an enthusiastic farmer. She has cultivated their rice land in Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, and it has yielded good earnings.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Ana Corazon knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Carolina Arvicenda

texts.es: Carolina es una mujer laboriosa de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos niños de 5 y 6 años, desde hace diez años emprendió su negocio el cual es una pulpería, junto al apoyo de su madre quien le ayuda a atender a los clientes, por segunda vez  requiere financiamiento de la institución para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y  gaseosas. De esta manera su negocio será más visitado por  la variedad de productos que ofertara y sus ingresos serán mayores, con las ganancias que obtuvo con el crédito anterior logro la compra de una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Carolina is a hardworking 28 year old woman. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 6. Ten years ago she started her grocery store business with support from her mother who helps her assist customers. For a second time, she needs a loan from the institution to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and sodas. This way, her business will be better visited because of the diverse products she will sell, and her earnings will be greater. With the income she obtained from the previous loan, she was able to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and sodas.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.ru: Ее зовут Хакима. Ей 41 года. Хакима пережила много бед своей жизни, но не потеряла себя и осталась сама собой ради своих детей. Хакима рано потеряла своего мужа и осталась с двумя детьми одна. Она вырастила своих детей и старается поставить их на ноги. Ее дочке 20 лет, а сыну 18 лет. Ее сын окончил школу и хочет продолжить свое обучение в медицинском колледже. Сын всегда мечтал стать врачом и долг Хакимы перед его сыном в том, чтобы его мечта сбылась. Хакима понимает, как его сын жаждет желания учиться. Но их денежных средств не хватает, чтобы сын учился, поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она верит, что мечта ее сына осуществится. Спасибо Вам за понимания.
texts.en: This woman is called Hakima. She is 41 years old. Hakima has been through many troubles in her life, but she has not lost herself and has stayed herself for the sake of her children. Hakima lost her husband early and was left on her own with two children. She has raised her children and strives to put them on their feet. Her daughter is 20 years old, and her son is 18. Her son has graduated from school and wants to continue his education in a medical college. Her son has always dreamed of becoming a doctor and Hakima owes it to her son to realize his dream. Hakima understand how her son thirsts with the desire to study. But they do not have enough funds for her son to study, so she has applied for a loan. She believes that her son's dream will come true. Thank you for your understanding.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS BLANCAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Graciela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida rápida, venta de api, venta de condimentos, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de salteñas, venta de poleras, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Graciela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio tejido y venta de prendas de vestir de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió realizando unos cursos de tejido y con estos conocimientos adquiridos decidió emprender su propio negocio, tejido y venta de ropa de lana, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en este negocio es su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank “ROSAS BLANCAS” will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional hub. It is formed by eight members and directed by a board where Graciela is president. This communal bank's businesses are varied: fast food sale, sale of api (local drink), sale of spices, clothing sale, sale of empanadas (pastry), sale of t-shirts, sale of blankets. The loan they take will benefit small businesswomen, Graciela being one of them. She says that it is the first time she is part of Pro Mujer. She entered the group invited by an assistant who is a member of the institution. Currently, Graciela has the business of knitting and sale of wool clothes. Currently, her sister helps her with the business. She will use the loan to increase capital (buy wool at wholesale prices) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto; and later for production, that she will sell in her place of sale. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she lives with a domestic partner and has a son. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 34 years old with school age children. She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC in good standing for almost 4 years. Finda has improved their living condition with a house of good roofing. She also makes good savings from their profits.

Finda wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 5,000 for the purchase of new nets. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floats to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 68, married with adult age children in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, she runs a store that provides the primary support for their family. She never gets tired tending her store everyday.

Conchita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for additional inventory of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning a profit as well for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Nancy wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with 4 children of school age. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. Her wish is to send her children to school until they finish college and have landed good jobs. She doesn't want to see her children doing back-breaking work in tilling and cultivating the land, as she is doing to provide for their needs.

Mary Ann recalls that everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum MPC to farmers like her.

Now, to make a head start for the next cropping season, she is taking out a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing, and to purchase a good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more productive plants.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing, and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more productive plants

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is engaged in running a vegetable store. She has been operating her business for 12 years and earns a monthly net income of 10,000 PHP.

Jocelyn is 47 years old, married and has 3 school-aged kids. She is from Pagadian City. In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to be able to engage in business activities.

Now Jocelyn is requesting her 6th loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en: Roxanne has successfully built a decent home for her family with the profits of her farming activities. She has been doing this for the past two decades. Now, she is preparing for the post harvest operations of her rice in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and received a loan. She hopes to see all her children finish their degree and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy has been operating a bakery in Pagadian City for 5 years already. She is 39 years old and married with 4 school-age children. She has also been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2012.

She's doing well in her business and so she is looking forward to expanding her bakery. This time, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase bags of flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, margarine, butter and other items.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, leavening, shortening, margarine, butter and other items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a resident of the town of Tolosa, Leyte, and she is a 52-year-old married woman with no dependents.

Elsie prepares home-cooked meals for the locals in her own place. She cooks lumpia (fried spring rolls), stewed vegetables, and adobo, which is a marinade, sauce or seasoning. Adobo involves the immersion of raw food in a stock or sauce which is composed variously of paprika, oregano, salt, garlic, and vinegar to preserve and enhance its flavor. This has served as her main source of income for the past 5 years.

Elsie has decided to take out a loan to acquire additional capital to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, chicken and condiments. In this way, she can improve her earnings and be able to set aside some of the profit for expansion.

She is hoping that someday she will become sustainable in her chosen field and can also improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, chicken and condiments.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora has been a fruit vendor in Pagadian City for 35 years. She is 63 years old and married with 6 adult children.

Recently she has taken out a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bulk supplies of bananas and other fruits to sell retail.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies of bananas and other fruits to sell retail.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita makes a living doing farming activities in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and married.

She has been a farmer for the past 20 years. She earns 13,000 PHP each month, and she is a new member of PMPC. She is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer.

In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jed

texts.en: Jed has always been enthusiastic about farming. He has cultivated their rice land in Balanlinao, and has made a good earning from rice farming. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase better rice seeds, which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Jed knew that he has to get things right, to yield more income this cropping season. In the future, Jed hopes to buy a hauling truck, which will enable easy transport of the produce.

loans.use: to purchase better rice seed which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, not only because she is doing her hobby, but also because she is earning an income as well. At the age of 60 and married, she keeps busy in order to sufficiently provide for the family.

Estrella grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC, and she credits the cooperative for the capital which has supported her gardening activities. Recently she has applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Estrella wishes to supply vegetables in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn manages a stall selling various cosmetics and beauty products, and it gives her an approximate income of PHP 10,000 per month. She needs to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family, as knowingly she has increased the household expenses.

Erlyn is 29 years old and an active member of Paglaum MPC, who are her partner for all her financial needs for her business ventures. Recently, she has taken out a loan of PHP 50,000 as additional capital so that she can supply the demands of her growing number of clients. The amount will be used to purchase bulk supplies of cosmetic products, fragrances, beauty soaps & other items.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies of cosmetic products, fragrances, beauty soaps & other items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian is 69 years old, married and lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is an active member of Paglaum MPC, in good standing.  He has been a farmer for almost 40 years. He is successful as a farmer, and as a father to his children who are professionals. Currently, he needs funds to purchase maintenance medicines, so he is asking for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro has a wealth of experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing, caring & harvesting, and earning income as well. Pedro has supported his family by farming.  Pedro has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knew he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. Someday, Pedro hopes to purchase another piece of land to cultivate rice, that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Hans Damian

texts.es:
Hans es un hombre de 37 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Él es independiente, paciente y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Paurito’ situado a 60 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad, un pueblo orgulloso de sus tradiciones.
Hans es de tez morena, cabello corto y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que son ancianos y no trabajan, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad como; verduras, refrescos, aceite, pan, azúcar, levadura y otros, “voy a amplia mi negocio y necesito una heladera para conservar los alimentos frescos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas continuas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es tener un supermercado, el desea comprar una heladera para conservar los alimentos frescos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Hans solicita un préstamo para comprar una heladera para conservar los alimentos frescos.
texts.en:
Hans is 37 years old, single and does not have children. He makes living selling groceries.

He is independent, patient and hardworking. He works in the town 'Paurito' which is proud of its traditions. It is located 60 kilometers south of the city.

Hans has dark complexion, short hair and strong physique. His mother tongue is Guaraní and speaks Spanish. His lives with his parents who are elderly and do not work. They live in a family house built with brick equipped with electricity and water well. He sells groceries and basic necessities like vegetables, soft drinks, oil, bread, sugar, yeast etc. "I will expand my business and I need a fridge to keep food fresh ..." he says. The advantage of the business is that the sales are sustained. The disadvantage is the lack of money to improve the business. His dream is to have a supermarket. He wants to buy a refrigerator to keep food fresh. This is the 1st loan in his three years of business.

Hans requests a loan to buy a refrigerator to keep food fresh.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep food fresh.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with four children. He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is the rain season, which affects business.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to buy replenish his stock. His business goal is to own a lorry for supplying charcoal within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 41 years old, married and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given the necessary financial literacy and other training in which she actively participated. Rosalyn had seen the changes in her general living condition from the moment she sign up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she requests a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to purchase materials such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets for boat making.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets for boat making.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired supporting her family.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Sindangan - Mandih, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Latipa

texts.en: Latipa is managing her fish vending business in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Along with her husband, she has been doing this business since the early years of their marriage, and has mastered it. The business has been doing well to support the needs of their family. Latipa has local customers, and also delivers bulk fish to neighboring towns for additional income. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase more stock of fish for selling. She wants to expand her business in future and would love to have a fishing boat, so that she can provide opportunities to her jobless neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children, four attend school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth has run a general store for 2 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, snack food, home care products, and other groceries.


In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Medielen

texts.en:
Medielen is a 26-year-old married woman with three children, one child attends school.

Medielen has raised livestock for 5 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Peregrinos Group

texts.es:
Irene es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 18 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los damnificados de la riada de años pasados, hoy convertida en un área de producción manufacturera.
Irene es morena de baja estatura y físico mediano (la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa fucsia), su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como electricista y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la hizo liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; taller de cerrajería, artesanía en porcelana, taller de llaves, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de cosméticos y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella tiene un pequeño taller dónde se ocupa de arreglar prendas de vestir como, el largo de pantalón, ancho de cintura, ancho de espalda y otros, “estoy iniciando a confeccionar prendas de vestir…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para iniciar a confeccionar. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprar más máquinas, ella desea comprar tela por rollo para iniciar su negocio de confección. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Irene solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para iniciar su negocio de confección.
texts.en:
Irene is 47 years old, married and have 2 children at ages 8 and 18. She is a tailor.

She is a good mother, persistent and very responsible. Her business is in the neighborhood ‘plan 3000’ which hosts the victims of the flood from years past. It has been converted into a manufacturing area.

Irene has a dark complexion, short and medium build (far left wearing pink shirt). She lives with her husband, who is an electrician, and their children who study in school. They live in a wooden house that has all the basic necessities. The need to improve her business made her lead a banking enterprise. Members work in locksmith shop, porcelain crafts, keys, food sales, second hand clothes sales, natural health products sales, cosmetics sales and soft drinks sales.

Irene’s business is tailoring. She has a small workshop where she alters clothing such as pants length, waist width, shoulder fit etc. "I'm starting to make clothing ..." she says. The advantage of her business is that there is continuous flow of customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to start making clothing. Her dream is to improve her business and buy more machines. She wants to buy fabric rolls to start her business of making clothing. This is the first loan with the institution in her nine years of work.

Irene requests a loan to buy fabric roll to start her business of making clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric roll to start her business of making clothing

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en:
Mr. Davaajav, 41 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a filterer at a copper enrichment facility for 18 years. His wife sells construction materials to local people. Their children study at university.

He is requesting a loan of 1,600 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass to renovate his house's second story. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Cambitas Group

texts.es:
Elvira continúa con su negocio de sastrería. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando una máquina de coser industrial, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual (sentada al centro, viste polera rosa). Actualmente su negocio cuenta con clientes fijos y continuos, “inicie mi negocio arreglando ropa, la demanda me lleva por el camino de la confección…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos y demanda, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar tela por rollo. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta en la feria para poder vender sus confecciones por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos  con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elvira solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar ropa y venderla por mayor.
texts.en:
Elvira continues with her tailoring business. She used the loan that she got to buy an industrial sewing machine. Her payments were punctual. (She is seated in the middle, and she is wearing a pink t-shirt.)

Her business now has fixed and continious customers. "I started my business by fixing clothes. The demand took me down the road to making clothes," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has fixed customers and demand. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy fabric by the roll.

Her dream is to have a fixed sales stand at the fair in order to be able to sell the clothes she makes wholesale.

This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Elvira is requesting a loan to buy fabric by the roll in order to make clothes and sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fabric by the roll in order to make clothes and sell them wholesale.

loans.name: Los Kukichas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS KUKICHAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quellouno, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia , la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "Los Kukichas" Communal Bank. This group is located in the district of Quellouno, which belongs to the province of La Convención, in the Region of Cusco.

The featured member is Señora Alejandrina. She is now single, 60 years old, and has 4 children. She works in her business of cultivating fruit. She has land where she grows bananas, coffee, tangerines and oranges, working from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm. She is a hardworking and enterprising person, who has used this business to raise up her family. She already has several years of experience in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her cropland. She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers.

The other group members are in the business of selling candies, selling clothes, running a grocery store, and a restaurant.

Señora Alejandrina gives thanks to those who are part of this dream-come-true through Kiva, and agrees to comply with her payment due dates.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en: Basilisa is a member of PMPC. She is 62 years old, married, and has a fish selling business in Danao, Plaridel. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 10,000 per month. Recently, Basilisa availed a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for to complete her house. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Emma has maintained her membership with good standing and without records of default up to the present day. She has taken several loans and all were paid back in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her barbecue business. Emma wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her barbecue business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina signed up for her membership with PMPC and took the needed capital to start up a barbecue business. She is thankful for the capital the Co-op extends to a small-time borrower like her.

Lina has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her barbecue eatery business.

In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her barbecue eatery business.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a 20-year-old, single, young lady from Masabud, Clarin. Her father works as an employer where he gets a low and unstable income. His income barely covers all the family's needs.

Rhea is a student in the local university, where she studies commerce. She wants to earn a B.A. degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Rhea took a loan from GDMPC. This loan will help her to pay her tuition fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Rhea will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for this semester.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 25 years old and married with school-age children. She has been an operator of a fishing business in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, for almost two years. From this experience, she already has high knowledge in dealing in this kind of business.

Even though there are many competitors in her area, Lolita still gets more fish catch above the rest. She has been successful over the years and manages to save money for her family.

For now, Lolita is planning to purchase new fishing nets; for that, she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets.

loans.name: Sylvia Vilma

texts.en:
Sylvia Vilma is a 63-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sylvia Vilma has had a fish vending business for 4 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Sylvia Vilma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, two attend school. Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita has run a general store for 29 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, and home care products.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and home care products.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a 67-year-old widowed woman with four children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Candida has had a food vending business for 3 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy flour and sugar.

In the future, Candida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ganchuluun

texts.en: Mr. Ganchuluun is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling children's toys for 10 years. His wife sells cosmetics at a trade center. Their children go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy toys in large quantities in order to increase his working capital. By doing so his business will yield more income and his family's living standard will improve greatly.

loans.use: to buy toys in large quantities.

loans.name: Rizalita

texts.en: Rizalita operates a convenience store.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She dreams to own a larger grocery store and to be able to provide better for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is responsible and dedicated in her work as a potter. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.
She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy soil for pottery making. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater more orders.

loans.use: to buy soil for pottery making.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is 61 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Aurelia has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business, that together earn approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and floaters for her fishing activities. Aurelia has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and floaters for her fishing activities.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a hardworking mother who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets to tired to support her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of having additional pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is a 61-year-old widow with eight children.

Filipina has grown rice for 8 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Filipina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. Jasmin works very hard to provide for them.

Jasmin has run a general store for 2 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 53-year-old married woman with three children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Brenda has runa fish vending business for 20 years and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Brenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Violeta has run a food vending business for 9 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar and flour.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  sugar and flour.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Saber is a 35-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support. Saber has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Saber took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Flor Del Sol 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of Flor del Sol (Sunflower) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, in a community district called Los Alcarrizos. These 10 women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community. 

Juana makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. They live together in this neighborhood of scarce resources with their four children. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza. She sells miscellaneous products like shoes, cosmetics, women accessories and other different products in her little general store that is called in Dominican Republic "Fantasia" and this loan is intended to increase her inventory. 

She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to help her partner with their expenses at home. She is also planning to reinvest in the success of her business. 

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 33-year-old, married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the main breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Wisam has a stall for selling candies in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Wisam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of candies to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business

loans.use: to buy a new collection of candies to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.es:
Claudia continúa con su negocio de venta de pollo frito. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la construcción de un techo para su puesto de comida, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funcionó correctamente (al centro, viste; POLERA BLANCA Y PANTALON  FLORERADO).
