Actualmente su negocio es estable, sus ventas y clientes son diarios y continuos, “los insumos de cocina son la base mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; aceite, pollo, papa y otros. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio ella desea comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar a diario. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar a diario.
texts.en:
Claudia is continuing her business of fried chicken sales. The previous loan was invested in the construction of a roof for the food stall. Her payments were punctual because her business worked properly (at center in white shirt and pants with flowers). Business is currently stable. Sales and customers are daily and continuous. "Ingredients are the base of my business ..." she says. The advantage of her business is that sales are steady. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy ingredients such as oil, chicken, potato etc. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to buy the ingredients for daily cooking. This is the 2nd loan in her two years of the business.

Claudia requests a loan to buy wholesale ingredients for daily cooking.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients for daily cooking.

loans.name: Peacefull Sisters Group

texts.en:
This is thirty- nine years old Eyella, married with one child. Her child is eighteen years old school going child. Eyella belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Peaceful Sisters” is the name of Eyella’s solidarity group. “Peaceful Sisters” group needs a total loan of 7,500,000SLL. Eyella will receive 1,500,000SLL which she needs in order to purchase 10 phones, 4 television and 1 dozen African dresses for women for her business. (see group picture, Eyella is in the Middle).
Eyella established her television, phone and cloths business 10 years ago; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Eyella uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her child’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Eyella is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 9 am to 7 pm.
In the future, Eyella plans to support her child to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 10 phones, 4 television and 1 dozen African dresses.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry has started a small business and is her own boss at her sari-sari store. Her store is popular, as it often times mistaken to be owned by her husband. She has managed to have enough inventory and is able to roll together her capital to earn more profit. Everyday she makes good sales since she is the only store in their area. Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock the store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to acquire a descent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is passionate about selling fish to support her family. She is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

She never gets tired of running this business. Edna is a full fledged member of PMPC and has had several previous loans. She has a good payment history. She will use a new loan to buy more fish which will provide more income.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy  fish.

loans.name: Sector Xon Group

texts.en:
The 8 women of “Sector Xon” trust bank live in the rural outskirts of Chichicastenango, an Indigenous Maya K’iche city high up in the mountains of central Guatemala, in the department of Quiché. They take advantage of the huge market of Chichicastenango every Thursday and Sunday, which brings people from all over, to sell their products: farm-fresh peaches, which they grow, and harvest, and huipiles, blouses traditional to their culture.

Rosalía is the president of the trust bank. She is 32 years old, and has 2 children, studying in primary school. Her husband works in agriculture, and Rosalía runs a weaving business, creating huipiles, traditional mayan blouses, embellishing them with elaborate embroidered designs. When she is not creating her beautiful detailed product, Rosalía is in the market of Chichicastenango selling it to locals and travelers who come to the market. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, this talented woman will invest in materials for the creation of her huipiles, threads and dyes to diversify and color her designs. Rosalía has been with Friendship Bridge for 2 cycles, and her work with this organization has relieved some of the stress in her life and strengthened her business.

With between 30 and 60 years of age, some of these women did not have the opportunity to study and those who did only studied though some level of primary school. Most of the women are married and have from 2 to 11 children of their own who are in school. These ladies greatly appreciate the opportunity to receive quick and consistent credit through Friendship Bridge and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials for the creation of her huipiles, threads and dyes to diversify and color her designs

loans.name: Jasmin Group

texts.en:
The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge combines loans with education to help women expand their business and learn practical applicable lessons on topics including business, health and self-esteem. On average, a client from the organization has 2.6 years of formal education and is unable to read and write. But the ladies are determined, industrious and eager to learn.

Santa Clara La Laguna is a town above beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is known for the main industry of the town that is the fabrication of bamboo baskets of all sizes. Women find it most convenient and comfortable to carry things in these baskets, often balancing them on their heads. They are handmade, sturdy and very nice.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Jasmin” was formed by seven indigenous women in Santa Clara La Laguna. One of the members is 59 year old Juana who is married with six children. She is very motivated and determined to see that her children are educated. Juana has an animal husbandry business and raises chickens, pigs and cattle.  Her business is going well and she needs to inject more capital into it and so, she is requesting a loan to buy 2 more bulls, as well as 2 pigs, 2 dozen chickens and feed for all of them.

The women of the Trust Bank are very appreciative of KIVA investors. They are realizing specific results of the “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge including increased self-esteem and empowerment and maintenance and expansion of their businesses. They are also able to send their children to school! Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy 2 more bulls, as well as 2 pigs, 2 dozen chickens and feed for all of them

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 18-year-old, single young man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the main breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Fadi has a stall for selling kids clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Fadi took a USD murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall

loans.name: El Bi Group

texts.es:
Eugenia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 21 años y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy decidida. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ área rural caracterizada por encontrarse el santuario de la virgen patrona de la ciudad. 
Eugenia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lacio y baja estatura (sentada la 2da de la derecha, viste blusa a rayas horizontales). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia y trabaja viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, taller automotriz, venta de verduras y venta de productos naturales. Su negocio es la panadería, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en la cocina de su casa para realizar la venta ambulantemente, “tengo pedidos y realizo entregas a mercados…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar un horno industrial de 4 latas. Su sueño es tener más clientes y vender más, ella desea comprar un horno industrial de 4 latas para producir más pan y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eugenia solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial para producir más pan y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Eugenia, age 38, is single and has a 21 year old son. She has a bakery business. She is a good mother, enterprising, and very determined. She conducts her business in the Cotoca area. This is a rural area known for the the sanctuary of the Virgen patron of the city.

Eugenia has a dark complexion and long, straight, black hair. She is short. (She is seated, second from the right, and is wearing a striped blouse.) Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her son, who goes to school and works. they live in their own house, which is made of wood. They have electricity and well water.

The need to improve her business took her to form a bank of people with businesses like a neighborhood store, leather handicrafts, making hats from Sao palm, selling food, selling second-hand clothes, an auto repair shop, selling vegetables, and selling natural products.

Her business is a bakery. She engages in this business activity every day of the week in the kitchen of her house. She sells in an itinerant manner. "I have orders, and I make deliveries to the market," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has steady customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy an industrial overn with four drawers.

Her dream is to hae more customers and to sell more. She wishes to buy an industrial oven with four drawers in order to produce more bread and improve her sales. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Eugenia is requesting a loan to buy an industrial oven in order to produce more bread and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven in order to produce more bread and improve her sales.

loans.name: Icyerekezo Group

texts.en:
Francoise is a 45-year-old, married mother of five children. She is the leader of the ICYEREKEZO Group. She is the third person on the first line and left side, carrying a baby on her back. All members of the group are requesting funds to expand their businesses with the hopes of supporting their children and families.

Francoise sells beans, sweet potatoes and vegetables etc., at the market. She works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life. Every morning Francoise opens her stand at 7 a.m. and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. beans, sweet potatoes and vegetables are staple foods in the Rwandan diet, so Francoise foresees an unwavering demand, which she hopes will allow her to expand her business as she acquires more funds.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to buy larger quantities of beans, sweet potatoes, and vegetables to sell to her community.

With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family, pay the school fees for her children and to become an wholesaler in the community.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of beans, sweet potatoes and vegetables to sell to her community.

loans.name: Serapiona

texts.en: With a vast land to till, Serapiona started farming 15 years ago. She also raise hogs so that she can support the needs of her four school-aged children. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and piglets. The additional funds will help motivate her to continue even with the waiting of four months. In the future, Serapiona wants to expand her farming business so that it will generate more revenue to meet the needs of the family especially to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old, and married with four children to provide for. For twenty  years, she has been earning an income through selling what her husband catch as a fisherman. 

She wants to improve their livelihood and address the current problem on their fishing business right now. For this, Yolanda is taking a loan to buy engine, adhesive and paints to repair their fishing boat.

Yolanda shared that aside from dreaming of becoming a successful businesswoman, she also hope to keep a good record of being a member by paying her loan on-time.

loans.use: to buy engine, adhesive and paints

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis has started her small-time business of retailing gasoline. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day, she makes good sales since she is the only gasoline store in her barangay (neighborhood).

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to buy gasoline to resell. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to resell.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is maize farmer from Ranau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Lawal is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Lawal is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Changes Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Hawanatu is a member of Changes solidarity group (see group picture, Hawanatu stands in the middle). She sells provisions. Hawanatu has been selling provisions for the past 47 years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Hawnatu and other group members of Changes solidarity group are requesting for their first loan. Hawanatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 6,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Hawanatu will personally receive 3,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more bags sugar, cartons of milk, etc for her business.
Hawanatu is forty-seven years, married and has four children age 29, 25, 24 and 20 years old. Hawanatu hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well
Hawanatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase more bags sugar, cartons of milk, etc for her business.

loans.name: Altanbat

texts.en:
Mr. Altanbat, 36 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He runs an automobile repair shop and grows vegetables on his land.

Using his previous loan, he bought spare parts for his automobile repair shop. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass for his house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Solongo, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been providing taxi services to local people for one year. Her husband works as a welder at a building company. Their children go to secondary school.

Using her previous loan, she installed an electric heater into her house. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to install vacuum insulated windows into her house. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows into her house.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is a 27-year-old, married young man from Dier Al-Balah, Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the main breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Saeed has a stall for selling cosmetics in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Saeed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of cosmetics to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of cosmetics to sell at his stall

loans.name: Damian

texts.en:
Damian is 62 years old. He is known in the Usocan, Plaridel area for his sari-sari store. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the microfinance co-op offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). He is thankful that all of the financing needs of his retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is from the town of Trinidad. She is a food vendor. To make a living, Lourdes cook ss comes primarily from making "puto" (rice cakes) and sell it in her place. She also farms rice for supplementary income. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor on farmers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to increase her rice cake production. Any other profit will be for her savings and healthy meals for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor on farmers

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 63 years old, married and lives in Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon the sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional bags of animal feeds.

Cerila really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of animal feeds.

location.town: Plaridel - Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela started her small-time business and became a boss with her sari-sari (variety) store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day, she makes good sales since she has the only store in their barangay (neighborhood).

Recently, she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a responsible mother who requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Some time ago, Luis learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to members like him. He had spent almost his entire life in responding to the needs of his family. He has utilized various services of the cooperative, including insurance. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital.

To this day, Luis feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him. Recently, he borrowed a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Helping Family Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is a forty years old business woman. She is a member of Helping Family solidarity group. Mabinty solidarity group has three members. (see group picture, Mabinty stands in the middle).
Ten years ago Mabinty established her cooked food selling business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

“Helping Family” group needs a total loan of 11,500,000SLL. Mabinty is entitled to 3,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy 1 bag of rice, 1 rubber of oil, 1 rubber of palm oil etc. for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mabinty is married with three children age seventeen, fifteen and twelve years and all are school going children.
In the future, Mabinty plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family Mabinty and the rest of the group members’ thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of rice, 1 rubber of oil, 1 rubber of palm oil etc

loans.name: G.s La Union Hace La Fuerza 1 Group

texts.en:
Milagros is one of the members of G.S La Union hace la Fuerza (In the Union is the Strong) 1. This group is comprised of 5 businesspeople are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community They are located in the city of Santo Domingo, which is one of the rural cities around the capital in the country. Its economy is dependent on different sales markets and working in the capital industry. Milagros enjoys attending church and visiting her family.

Milagros, is the mother of 2 children, and she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their children, living in the north of Santo Domingo in a small and simple home structure. She is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza. She runs a cosmetic products business and she sells all kind of cosmetics and also son different products like clothes, shoes, etc. This loan will be uses to increase her inventory by buying more merchandises.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help her partner with home expenses. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 18-year-old, single young man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the main breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Haitham has a stall for selling cosmetics in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Haitham took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of cosmetics to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more products for his cosmetics business to resell.

loans.name: Villas Del Sol Group

texts.en:
The large northwestern state of Quiche in Guatemala is a land of varying altitudes with many different climates that range from arid to tropical.  The 200 square mile area of Chicamán in Quiche is one of those distinctive areas with its moderate climate and tropical vegetation.  Chicaman is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Villas del Sol” that has eight industrious and dedicated members. 

The President of the group is 37 year old Leandra who sells traditional clothing along with contemporary clothes for children and adults in her local markets, as well as those in surrounding villages.  She also sews items on commission.  Because Leandra knows the importance of having a large inventory on hand for her customers, she is requesting a loan to buy more clothes that will be readily available for the upcoming holiday season. 

Leandra was married at 16 and now has five children - the oldest is 21 and the youngest is 15.  They have been able to attend both primary and secondary schools.  Along with her husband, she has been able to earn enough to build her business.  With the addition of loans, she has been able to save enough to buy land that her family can build a home on.  This is a very exciting step for the entire family.
KIVA investors are essential partners in this process.  Thank you for providing a helping hand!!!

loans.use: to buy more clothes that will be readily available for the upcoming holiday season

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.en:
Atanacio is the owner of his own vehicle, which he has been using as a taxi since he was very young. He needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his car. Atanacio lives with his two kids and he has made great efforts to buy a house for his family.

Atanacio also makes money by taking pictures, so sometimes he goes to weddings. Atanacio hopes you can help him. He is a single father, so he takes care of his family alone

loans.use: to pay the maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Benjamin Lito

texts.es:
Benjamin continúa con su negocio de chapa y pintura automotriz. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando un motor para su bomba de aire, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas con su herramienta. Actualmente su negocio funciona correctamente aunque no cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias, “poco a poco voy mejorando mi negocio, algunas veces pierdo trabajos por falta de herramientas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda, la desventaja es la falta de herramientas para cubrir toda la demanda. Su sueño es tener un taller en su casa, el desea comprar un equipo de oxígeno y arco de soldar. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Benjamin solicita un préstamo para comprar un equipo de oxígeno y arco de soldar para cubrir la demanda de su negocio.
texts.en:
Benjamin continues with his sheet metal and automobile painting business. He used the loan that he got to buy a motor for his air pump. His payments were punctual because he had no problems with his tools.

His business is now functioning correctly even though he does not have the needed tools. "Little by little I am improving my business. Sometimes I lose jobs because of the lack of tools," he says. The advantage of his business is that there is demand. The disadvantage is to lack of tools to cover all of the demand.

His dream is to have a shop at his house. He wishes to buy a blow tourch and a welding arc. This is his third laon cycle with the institution in the 17 years that he has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Benjamin is requesting a loan to buy a blow torch and an arc welder to cover the demand in his business.

loans.use: to buy a blow torch and an arc welder in order to cover the demand in his business.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh is 47 years old and she is married. 
She has had a farm, where she raises poultry, for more than 10 years.
Oanh lives in Quang Xuong district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family earns a low-income as the profit from their farm is not high enough for her to afford some basic things in life. 
One of the most difficult things that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Oanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan will make her little dream come true.
In the future, Oanh hopes her business will do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio, a 55-year old married man, resides with his wife in the rural town of Tolosa, Leyte. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like coffee, powdered milk, seasonings, eggs, noodles, and insect repellent. For a long time now, his store has catered to neighbours and local settlers in his community. He needs capital to maintain the inventory of merchandise in his store.

Eleuterio would like to improve the content of his store and boost his business. He wants to buy additional stocks for the store such as biscuits, beverages, and assorted dry goods. These items will help him to slowly expand the business and enable him to settle his obligations.

In the future, Eleuterio will do his best to seek ways of becoming sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for his store such as biscuits, beverages, and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
In 2002, Gloria learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Gloria tried her luck with running a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Gloria has borrowed another amount to purchase bags of fertilizers. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Gloria is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Chanmanet's Group

texts.en:
Chanmanet’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanmanet works as a factory laborer and raises chickens, and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a roof that will give them shelter from the winter

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en:
Mariles is 47 years old and lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children of adult age. Mariles has been engaged in managing an appliance repair shop, together with her brother as the repairman, for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing soldering rods, ICs and other electronic pieces.

Mariles has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Mariles hopes to expand her appliance repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase soldering rods, ICs and other electronic pieces.

loans.name: Sreynov

texts.en:
Sreynov is 36 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. All of her children attend school (one of her sons is shown in the picture).

She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in feeding cows, pigs and poultry. She earns about $2.5 per day. Her husband runs a soil delivery service and earns about $8 per day.

Sreynov is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to increase her family’s income. In the future, she is going to save money to build a new proper house and to support her children in earning a higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Las Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
Emilene es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tienen 3 hijos de 14, 16 y 18 años y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos. 
Ella es buena madre, optimista y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘pampa de la isla’ que es una de los zonas más pobladas de la ciudad, cuenta con cadenas de supermercados e incluso cadenas de restaurantes.
Emilene es de piel morena, cabello negro y físico mediano (al centro viste blusa celeste y pantalón negro), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a liderar la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos, todos los días sale junto a su carro de 2 ruedas cargado de electrodomésticos para buscar un sitio donde armar su puesto de venta, “aquí en el barrio las ventas son buenas, la gente es trabajadora y pagan bien…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende a crédito y las ventas son continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para trabajar. Su sueño es abrir una tienda, ella desea comprar electrodomésticos para vender a crédito. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emilene solicita un préstamo para comprar electrodomésticos para vender a crédito.
texts.en:
Emilene is a 35 year old, single woman who has 3 children of 14, 16 and 18 years of age, and her business is the sale of appliances.

She is a good mother, optimistic and hardworking.  She has her business in  the 'pampa of the island' area, which is one of the most populated areas of the city, with supermarkets and even chain restaurants.

Emilene has brown skin, black hair and medium physique (center wears blue blouse and black trousers).

Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she also speaks Spanish. Her life is shared with her children who are studying in school.  They live in a brick house owned by the family and which has all the basic services. T

The desire to improve her business led her to organizing this banking venture. 

Her business is selling appliances.  Daily she takes off with her two wheel cart loaded with appliances to find a place where to build her stall, "here in the neighborhood sales are good, people are hard workers and pay well ... " she says. 

The advantage is that her business sells on credit and sales are continuous.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to work with.

Her dream is to open a store.  She would like to purchase appliances to sell on credit. This is the first sequence of the loan with the institution, and she has been working in this business for seven years.  

These are the reasons for which Emilene is requesting a loan:  to purchase appliances to sell on credit.

loans.use: to purchase appliances to sell on credit.

loans.name: Vingunguti C Group

texts.en:
Faraja is in his mid 30s, married with two schooling children. He has been running a business of animal sales for thirteen years now. He works from 5am to 4pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be his 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy goats and has been able to pay back all his loans successful. He is doing fine with the and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, to repay loan, started building his house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the goat stock to resale. He dreams of selling his goats out of the country and also to finish building his own house.

Faraja will share this loan with his loan group Vingunguti C which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the goat stock to resale.

loans.name: Patzala Centro Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz del Quiche is located about 127 miles from Guatemala City.  It is 6,600 feet above sea level with a subtropical mild climate.  It is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Patzala Centro” with its eight hardworking members. 

The President of the Trust Bank is Blanca who is 26 years old with an animal husbandry business raising pigs and chickens.  The business has been successful enough that she has been able to support her family.  At this time, however, she needs to have a loan in order to increase her income through purchasing a larger number of pigs and chickens.  Blanca’s long range dream is transform her small business into a large one that provides enough income for her three children to graduate from high school and then go to the university to get advanced professional degrees.  She has this dream for her children because she was only able to go to school to the 6th grade. 

Blanca and her friends in the “Patzala Centro” Trust Bank benefit from the “Microcredit Plus”  Program (small loans + education) of Friendship Bridge that provides relevant lessons. 

Thank you, KIVA investors, for supporting these programs that are life changing for women like Blanca and her friends in the “Patzala Centro” Trust Bank. You are valued and much-appreciated!

loans.use: to increase her income through purchasing a larger number of pigs and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en: Eustaquia is 54 years old.  She owned a Sari-sari store business which she started four years ago. This is her source of income. She is asking a loan to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits. Eustaquia plans to use her profits to continue making expansions on her store, introducing many merchandise that she does not previously offer.  Eustaquia hope to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee and biscuits

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs Mai is 55 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture as a farmer for more than 10 years. Mai lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.
One of the most difficult things that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
In 2014, Mai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
In the future, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma has been a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She and her husband have been tilling their own land for years, providing all the needs for their family. Norma has realized that their income in farming was insufficient for the family needs before, especially in times like when their eldest child entered college. As a hardworking farmer, she works hard to repay her loans from the cooperative. Previously, she decided to expand her farm and asked for financial support from Paglaum MPC. Norma is grateful that the co-op has lent to her so that she was able to buy the neighboring parcel of land. She successfully repaid the loan and this cropping season, she asked for another loan to augment her production. The amount of PHP 41,000.00 is intended to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides. Norma is hopeful that she can have a good harvest this season so that she can repay her loan ahead of schedule.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en: Flordelisa is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 42 years old with three children ages 12, 13 and 15. For the last two years, Flordelisa is engaged in a Sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is asking a loan to buy feed, gasoline, salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk. Her income will be utilized for family daily consumption and pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy feed, gasoline, salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, milk

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido has a rice farm in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This is his primary source of income for his family.

Brigido makes it a point to have enough supplies of fertilizers and insecticides to produce maximum yields, and will have a good income. Recently, he needed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC.

Brigido wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and bottles of insecticides

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en: Ma. Magdalina is a 50-year-old married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like coffee, sugar, biscuits, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks. Her business started years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various groceries like beverages, seasonings, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk and toiletries to fill her shelves with stock. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various groceries like beverages, seasonings, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk and toiletries

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en: Kosal’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kosal works as farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Esther Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mildred is a thirty-one years old business woman. She is a woman of “Esther“ solidarity group. “Esther” solidarity group belongs to a solidarity group of five women. (see group picture, Mildred is in the middle). Mildred has been in the charcoal business for the past 3 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm. Mildred established her business to help support her child in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from the business.

Mildred and her group members needs a total of 10,000,000 SLL of which Mildred is entitled to SLL2,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy additional 200 bags of charcoal for his business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mildred is married and has one child age ten years and a school going child.

In the feature, Mildred plans to generate more money to provide for her child’s university education. She believes educating her child to university will better the lives of her family.
Mildred and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional 200 bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokun makes a living cultivating rice and raising chickens and he also does extra work as a construction worker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Channy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Channy works as factory laborer and she also does work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is a 38-year-old, married mother with three children in her care. She resides in a village in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She earns main income from running a beauty salon and she has been doing the business for over two years. All of her children attend school and her husband is a worker in industrial. Together, they can make approximately USD 18 per day.

Now, she would like to request a loan because she needs finances to buy materials for her beauty salon. With this loan, she will be able to buy more materials and improve her business. In the future, she is going to expand her business, save money to build a new house, and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: buy materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Trò

texts.en:
Mrs Trò is 52 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business making wood furniture for more than 10 years.Trò lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most difficult that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Trò first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Trò hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of two dependents aged 17 and 19. Juanita has been engaged in a fishing business for more than a year. Juanita is asking for a loan to buy crab traps and fishing weights. Through this, Juanita will be able to continue fishing and expect a better catch with the new fishing materials. In the future, Juanita dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to save money to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and fishing weights

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en: Ma. Luisa is a 49-year-old married woman and mother of two children aged 13 and 18 from Bien Unido, Bohol. from Ajuy, Iloilo. She helps her husband in their fishing business. This is the source of their income. She is asking for a loan to buy plywood, adhesive and paint to repair their fishing boats. With a loan, Ma. Luisa and her husband will be able to improve their daily catch which they can sell to the market for a good price. Ma. Luisa hopes to make their business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy plywood, adhesive and paint

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita finds pleasure in gardening. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. She is 51 years old and married, and she is busy enough to sufficiently provide for her family.

She seized the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with providing her capital and supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Teresita wishes to become the supplier of vegetables in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Honeylo

texts.en: Honeylo is 32 years old, married and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training which she actively participated. Honeylo had seen the changes in her general living condition from the moment she sign up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she ask a loan of PHP 14,500.00 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Analita

texts.en: Analita is preparing for the next crop season. She wants to prepare well, especially for the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to buy squash and corn fertilizer. Analita hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy squash and corn fertilizer

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en: Mun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khein's Group

texts.en:
Khein’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khein makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. She has one young son.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokneoun's Group

texts.en:
Sokneoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokneoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en: Sokong’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sokong makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nueva Creacion 3 Group

texts.en:
Yada is the group coordinator of Nueva Creacion (New Creation) 3. Her group is located in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic and is composed of 5 micro-entrepreuners. She lives in a simple home structure with her husband, they only had a child that is not living with them but also she lost a son. Yada said her most difficult challenge has been to overcome the loss of her child. She enjoys attend to the church.

This is Yada's eigth loan with Esperanza. She started her business with the help of an aunt and with the first loan she received from Esperanza International, around four years ago. She thanks God to be running this beauty salon and she plans to use this loan to purchase hair extensions and different hair and beauty product lines.

Yada wants to reinvest the profits from her business and to save because her future plan is to provide more for her daughter's education and she wants to see her become professional and to have her own family. She hopes to be able to save enough money to continue improving her family's lives and to make one of her dreams come true. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and some beauty products.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Asunta es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 10, 12, 15 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, migrantes de occidente y damnificados del desborde del río, se apropiaron del lugar para convertirlo en una creciente ciudadela.
Asunta es morena de cabello negro largo y físico robusto (de pie al centro, viste blusa celeste), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, artesanía en cuero, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de cosméticos, taller de soldadura, tienda de barrio y panadería. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza ambulando por ferias y zonas comerciales, “este verano se viene bien fuerte y la demanda de ropa de temporada no se deja esperar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende ropa de temporada, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar ropa por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea comprar ropa de temporada por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Asunta solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano de temporada verano por mayor.
texts.en:
Asunta is a 39 year old woman. She lives with her partner. They have 4 children, ages 10, 12, 15 and 17. Her business is the sale of used clothes. She is a good mother, and is independent and very enterprising. She runs her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, known for the diversity of its inhabitants, who are migrants from the north, victims of the flood from the river. They took over the area to convert it into a growing neighborhood.

Asunta has a dark complexion, long black hair, and a sturdy build. (She is standing in the center of the photo, with a light blue blouse.) Her first language is Guaraní, and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and her children who are in school. They live in a family-owned home, that has all the basic services.

The need to improve her business led her to head up the solidarity group. The businesses of the members are sale of food, leather handicrafts, sale of natural health products, sale of cosmetics, welding shop, corner store, and bakery. Asunta's business is the sale of used clothes, which she sells informally in fairs and commercial areas. "This summer is coming on strong, and the demand for seasonal clothes won't wait," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she sells seasonal clothes. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy clothes wholesale. Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to buy seasonal clothes wholesale. This is her first round of loans with the institution in the 3 years she has had this business. For these reasons, Asunta seeks a loan to buy used clothes for the summer season wholesale.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for the summer season wholesale.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 37 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling snacks for more than 10 years. Hoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hoa faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking more breakfast and other meals and to raise her income.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Her group consists of six members.
In the future, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking more breakfast on her stall and raise her income.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna busies herself on her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella runs a sari-sari (variety) store for a quite period of time. Her customers mostly neighbors and local dwellers in her place. Aside from operating a store, she also engages in food vending and prepares pastries, and snack food like fish ball, lumpia(spring roll), and hotcake.
She is a married woman and has six children from the town of Tolosa, Leyte. Of which three of them are still attending school.

She would like to boost her food vending, so Rosella has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, CEVI to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar and leaving agent. These will improve her earnings and able to cope with demands. She would like to continue improve her both business but food vending is in demand at the moment.

Rosella is hoping that she will be handling her sources of living successfully to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar and leaving agent

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 33 years old with school age children. Rolly personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC, he has been a member in good standing for almost 6 years. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 14,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. He already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  He wishes to see his children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 46 years old, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Victor, a driver. Living in a Third World country is really a big challenge, majority of the Filipinos most families struggle to make ends meet. Her husband's salary is not enough to raise a family so that Elizabeth thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income.

Vilma has been operating her store for nine years already and it has helped fund their daily needs and send their children to school. She is humbly requesting for a Php 15000 loan to pay and refill her store with rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, etc. to sell at her retail price. Although at times some of her customers do not pay on time, she is still grateful that God provides enough for their basic needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial aid that will be given to her. 

She dreams that someday she will own a bigger grocery store. She desires for her children to finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Pricela

texts.en: Pricela has always the enthusiasm of her fishing operations. She has been into fishing business with her husband as one of the fishermen in Eastern Looc, Plaridel and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase new fishing net. This will ensure that she has always good catch. Pricela knew that she has to get things right to yield more income every fishing activities. In the future, Pricela hopes to buy another fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing net

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is juggling in managing her business and supervising the renovation of their home. Teresita hopes to live comfortably in a newly renovate house supported by her loan of Php 7,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. Matter that Teresita has given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo thatch for house renovations

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: La Nueva Creacion Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 3, 5, 7, 9 y 11 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por el comercio manufacturero en todas las áreas. 
Claudia es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto (la segunda de la derecha, lleva una cartera blanca), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer asalariado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. la necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, venta de verduras, reparación de electrodomésticos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, taller de llaves, venta de cosméticos, venta de huevo, tienda de barrio y peluquería. Su negocio es la panadería, negocio que inicio desde su casa realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de masitas tradicionales, como; Cuñapé (bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo) y otros, “deseo aumentar mi producción para que mis hijos me ayuden a vender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar harina por quintal. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande y vender por mayor, ella desea comprar harina por quintal para aumentar su producción. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar harina por quintal para aumentar la producción de pan.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 33-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and she has five children, ages 3, 5, 7, 9 and 11. Her business is baking.

She is a good mother, enterprising and hardworking. Her business is in the southern part of the city, an area characterized by all kinds of manufacturing businesses.

Claudia is dark-skinned, short statured and has a robust physique (the second on the left, wearing a white purse). Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish.

She shares her life with her partner, who works as a salaried chauffeur, and her children who are in school. They live in a house of their own, made of wood, which has all the basic services.

The need to improve her business brought her to lead the banking undertaking. The businesses of the other members are: food sales, vegetable sales, domestic electronics repair, second-hand clothing sales, leather goods, key making, cosmetics sales, egg sales, a neighborhood shop and hair styling.

She started her baking business from her house with a minimal investment, making tradicional pastries like cuñapé (a yucca-flour bread ball with cheese), empanada de arroz (baked with rice and cheese), bizcochos de trigo (hard wheat-flour biscuits), and others.

"I want to increase my production so that my children can help me sell..." she says. The good thing about her business is that sales are daily; the downside is the lack of money to buy flour in bulk. Her dream is to have a large bakery and sell in bulk. She wants to buy flour in bulk in order to increase her production. This is the second loan cycle with the institution in three years.

For those reasons, Claudia requests a loan to buy bulk flour so she can increase her bread production.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk to increase bread production.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Sirinaika es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vie con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 8 meses y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es buena madre, sensible y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ área rural caracterizada por su artesanía en cerámica y cuero.
Sirinaika es de piel morena, cabello negro y físico robusto (sentada la primera de la derecha, viste blusa celeste), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevo a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; artesanía en cuero, venta de cerámica, venta de comida, taller de reparación de electrodomésticos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de verduras y venta de huevo. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, ella compra fruta por mayor y la vende al menudeo en un mercado de la zona, “la fruta se vende a diario, y la que se malogra la vendo como comida para animales de la granja…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar fruta por mayor. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande, ella desea comprar fruta por mayor para ampliar su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sirinaika solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta por mayor para ampliar su frutería.
texts.en:
Sirinaika is a young woman aged 20 years who lives with her partner. She has two children, aged 8 months and 2 years, and works selling fruit. She is a good mother, empathetic and very hard-working. She works in Cotoca, a rural area characterised by its ceramic and leather handicrafts.

Sirinaika has a dark complexion, black hair and a solid build (sitting first on the right, wearing a light blue top). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, a construction worker, and her children, who have not yet reached school age. They live in their own wooden house, which has electricity and well water. 

The need to improve her business brought her to lead this group of entrepreneurs. The members' businesses are: leather handicrafts, selling ceramics, selling food, a workshop for repairing electrical appliances, selling second-hand clothes, selling vegetables and selling eggs. Her business is selling fruit. She buys fruit in bulk and sells it at retail prices at the local market. "The fruit is sold on a daily basis and I sell the rotten fruit as food for farm animals," she says. Her business has the advantage of counting on daily sales. However, the lack of money for bulk-buying fruit is a disadvantage. 

Her dream is to have a larger business. She wants to buy fruit in bulk to expand her business. 

This is the first series of loans in five years with the institution that performs this activity. 

For these reasons, Sirinaika is requesting a loan to buy fruit in bulk to expand her fruit business.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk to expand her fruit business.

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es:
Mery continúa con su negocio de tienda de barrio (sentada la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa rosa tipo solera). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando material escolar, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su tienda mejoró, los clientes compran abarrotes y también material escolar, “mi pequeña librería funciona correctamente, los clientes acuden todo el tiempo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ahora cuenta con mayor variedad de productos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para reponer la mercancía vendida. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda y tenerla bien surtida para ganar más clientes, ella desea comprar mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Mery (seated first on the left in the pink shirt) continues to run her neighborhood store. She used her previous loan to buy school supplies, and she repayed her loan on time. Her store has improved, and her customers buy groceries and school supplies. "My little book shop is working well; customers come all the time ..." she says. Her business now has the advantage of offering a greater variety of products, but the disadvantage is her lack of funds to replenish the sold merchandise. Her dream is to expand her store and have it well stocked to obtain more customers. Mery would like to buy merchandise for her shop. This is the third sequence of loans in two years with the institution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
In the picture, Kosal is with her group member. Kosal is a 49 years old, a rice farmer and married woman. Kosal is pictured 1st from the right, and she has been a farmer since 1988. Her husband is 52 years old and a rice farmer as well. All of them lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has three children, two of them are factory workers and another one attends school. Together, they can earn approximately USD14 per day.

Kosal, a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan helps her increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes that she can do farming both in dry and rainy seasons more than two times per year, and build a ground-floor room and support her youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season

loans.name: Trường's Group

texts.en:
Mr Trường is 25 years old and he is married. He has had a service business cutting hair for 4 years. Trường lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in a village.

The main hardship that Trường faces is lack of capital. He is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for expanding his business by buying modern equipment and raising his income.

In 2015, Trường joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve his business. He hopes that this loan could improve his living standard. His group consists of five members.

In the future, Trường hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase modern equipment for expanding his hair cutting business and raise his income.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hard working woman from Quezon City, Philippines and she has been a long time member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). For 10 years already, she’s been selling fresh meats and vegetables and able to earn to approximately Php 7,000 each month. The business helped her pay their household expenses and other bills. She’s focusing on how to succeed on the business to earn more income in the future.

Edna aims to attract more customers. She makes sure that the daily supply of products are still fresh and of good quality. She wants her children to finish their college and have stable jobs in the future through her business. She needs supplementary capital for this. This is why Edna decided to apply for a loan amounting to Php 10,000. This will buy fresh meats and vegetables she needs daily. She believes that the amount will be of great help for the growth of her business.

Edna has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: The amount will be used as an added capital for buying fresh meats and vegetables daily.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Julieta has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Julieta wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is the age of 26 living to the Lahore area. Her husband owns a workshop in nearby town; he provides dent removal and painting services for damage bodies of vehicles. He has been doing this practice for many years and has well reputation in the market. He hired a helper at his workshop to look after and to convince the customers from outside. The number of customers has increased due to his good attitude and impressive dealing.

To keep constant his reputation and to meet the increasing demands, he has urgent need of paint. He is poor person; due to household expenses he does not have enough savings to buy desired material and dent removal tools for his workshop.
Therefore, Shumaila is trying to help her husband in the form of a loan. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes into business and in the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy paint and dent removal tools for her husband's car workshop. .

loans.name: Ablavi Yayra

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Ablavi est âgée de 26 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Ablavi est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ablavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes Hitarget afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ablavi is an energetic, married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two children and her husband. Ablavi is 26 years old and works hard to have a good financial situation. Ablavi resells "pagnes" (local fabric dresses) that she purchases at the market two times a month and sells by walking around nearby neighborhoods.

To meet her goals, Ablavi is asking for this loan to order Hitarget pagnes to meet the needs of her customers. She would like to have financial autonomy to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy nine pieces of Hitarget "pagnes" (local dresses).

loans.name: Rosas De Alisos Group

texts.en:
Aguacatán is a small town outside of the city of Huehuetenango in Northern Guatemala, located amongst the Cuchumatanes mountains. Aguacatán is a municipality known for its unique ethnic and cultural mix, bringing together 5 different people groups.
