Living within much diversity and culture, “Rosas de Alisos”, or “Alder Roses” is a trust bank made up of 7 women entrepreneurs who reside in the outskirts of the city who have been working in family businesses from young ages, and now run their own microenterprises, taking advantage of the experiences life has presented them with. 

President and representative of her trust bank, 26-year-old Rosa is also mother to an 8-year-old son who is in first grade at their local primary school. Rosa studied to 5th grade and currently lives with her father, running her own chicken farm to defray the costs in her household. In addition to her farm, Rosa embroiders and sells huipiles, traditional blouses, for extra income. With this loan that she is requesting, she will invest in 200 chickens, addressing her main concern, which is the continued growth of her chicken farm.

Some women in the group raise and sell chickens, others sell traditional clothing which they weave and embroider themselves or sell more casual clothing and do tailoring work, fixing traditional blouses, and some sell produce. A minimum of fourth grade education is an indispensable tool for business management that these women are thankful to have, and they prioritize education as mothers of between 2 and 4 children who are studying in local primary and secondary schools.


Thank you for all the support, which moves us forward in fulfilling all the potential of our businesses!

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, addressing her main concern, which is the continued growth of her chicken farm

loans.name: Talu

texts.en: Talu is a 50-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. Talu has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, material, scissors, thread, and needles. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie has banana farm in Plaridel. This is her primary source of income for her family. Elsie makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and will have good income. Recently, she needed an amount to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans of which she loaned from Paglaum MPC. Elsie wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply banana in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for irrigation to soften tillage pans on her banana plantation

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is managing his fish vending business in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He has mastered the business since his teenage years helping his mother doing same kind of business. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Recently, he loaned an amount to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Soklim's Group

texts.en: Soklim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soklim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Muth's Group

texts.en: Muth’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Muth makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Uluiva

texts.en: Uluiva is 52 years old and a widow with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy oil, flour, baking powder, a fry pan, a gas oven, etc. In the future, Uluiva hopes to expand her business by baking moon pies and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies to start a business making pancakes.

loans.name: Leoia

texts.en: Leoia is 59 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing and selling clothes in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience in this line of business. Leoia needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, material, scissors, thread etc. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, material, scissors, thread etc.

loans.name: Procedes Group

texts.es:
Francisca continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional (sentada la segunda de la derecha, viste mandil blanco). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar muebles de comedor e utensilios de cocina. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque los clientes aumentaron. Actualmente su negocio funciona todos los días y los clientes crecen en número, “ahora que cuento con mayor clientela los insumos de cocina se terminan rápido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existen mayor número de clientes, la desventaja es que no cuenta con dinero para comprar insumos de cocina. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante dónde puedan trabajar sus hijos, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina como; arroz, fideo, yuca, carne, verduras y otros. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Francisca solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is continuing to run her business selling traditional food (she is sitting second from the right, wearing a white apron). She used the loan she received to buy dining room furniture and cooking utensils. She repaid it on time because her number of customers increased. Her business now operates every day and her customers are growing in number. "Now that I have more customers, my cooking supplies quickly run out," she says.

The advantage of her business is that there are more customers. The disadvantage is that she has no money to buy cooking supplies.

She dreams of opening a restaurant where she can work with her children.

She wants to buy cooking supplies such as rice, noodles, yucca, meat, vegetables, etc. This is her second loan series from the institution in her 16 years carrying out this activity. For these reasons, Francisca is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies to stabilise her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to stabilise her business.

loans.name: New Begining - N3P3Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vui is 45 years old and married. She has operated a small restaurant selling food and snacks for five years. Vui lives in Thanh Hoa City, a urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Her family has a low-income household in village, moreover her job is unstable. The main hardship that Vui faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook for sale.

This is Vui's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Vui hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook for sale

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina, 48, is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 30 years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the financial needs of the entire family. Robina's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring supplies such as pieces of cloth, lace, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints her husband is not able to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that her husband can earn more income. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy tailoring supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 43-year-old married woman, and mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband alone must earn enough to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Bushra's husband has been running a food stall where he sells different types of food items, such as channa chat, dahi bhalay, fruit chat, etc. He needs to purchase different types of food and other items for his business, so that he can grow the business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. But, due to his unfavorable financial position, he cannot purchase these items. Therefore, Bushra has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the items he needs for his business.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items for her husband's food stall.

loans.name: Talosia

texts.en:
Talosia is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and ice cakes in her community. She has been doing this for three years.

Talosia has requested a loan to buy shopping bags, cooking oil, frying pans, sugar, flour, and related items. She joined SPBD in this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Talosia will use her profit to support her family financially and to pay for her children's education as well.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, cooking pots, spoons and related items.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is 20 years old and single. She resides with her parents in the Kampot Province in Cambodia. She is a freshman, taking a midwifery major. Kunthea’s family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Due to the fact that she is short of funds to pay her tuition fees for the first year, Kunthea requested a loan, which she will use to cover her university fees. In the future, she hopes to run her own clinic.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 38-year-old married woman, with five children.

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. Luisa has two years of experience in this business. She needs a loan to purchase bags of flour, cooking oil, shopping bags, sugar, yeast, etc.

Luisa plans to use her profits to support her family, and to pay for her childrens' education. Luisa has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, shopping bags, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Lan's Group N5T9 Qđại

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 40 years old, and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.

Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family has a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Inolvidables Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 30 años, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
Ella es buena madre, generosa y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores y por recibir la migración campo ciudad.
Ana es morena de cabello negro largo y baja estatura (sentada al centro, viste polera blanca), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar su negocio, en esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, ella recorre largas distancias en busca de nuevos clientes, visita oficinas, centros comerciales y todo tipo de comercio, “las distancias son largas pero mis clientes siempre compran algo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene rutas establecidas y clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa y todo tipo de cosméticos, ella desea comprar cosméticos y ropa por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de fin de año. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería para abastecer a sus clientes por fin de año.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old and married. She has two children, ages six and three years old. Ana has a business selling cosmetics and clothing.

Ana is a good mother. She is generous and very friendly. Her business is in the Plan 3000 area, known for its multi-cultural inhabitants and for the number of people who have moved there from the countryside.

Ana is short, dark-skinned, and has long black hair. In the photo, she is sitting in the middle, wearing a white shirt. Ana's native tongue is Guarani but she also speaks Spanish. Ana shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and her children, who attend school. The family lives in a house that they own. it is built with wood and has all basic services.

Owing to a need to improve her business, Ana is leading this communal bank. Ana has a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She travels great distances in search of new customers; she visits offices, shopping centres, and all types of businesses.

She says, "The distances are great but my customers always buy something".

The strong point of Ana's business is that she has well-established routes and regular customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy merchandise.

Ana's dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothing and all types of cosmetics. Ana wants to buy merchandise to stock up her business for customers for end of year festivities. This is her second loan with Emprender in the two years that she has had this business.

For the above reasons, Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise to stock up her business for customers for end of year festivities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up her business for customers for end of year festivities.

loans.name: Solidarity Group -N03T8Qđại

texts.en:
Mrs Tuấn is 48 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fish sauce for more than ten years.

Tuấn lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Tuấn faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to make fish sauce to sell.

In 2013, Tuấn joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tuấn has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Tuấn hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make fish sauce to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 53 years old, married, and has a snack vending business in Biasong, Lopez Jaena. This is how she supports her family with a meager income of PHP 10,000 per month. Recently, Caridad availed a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. Eddie is able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales, these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he took a loan to restock his store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a 32-year-old married woman, and the mother of one daughter and two sons. She lives with her husband in near Lahore, Pakistan.

Lubna does embroidery work by hand in her home, and financially supports her family. Her family is not wealthy. Her husband’s income is very small, so she decided to start doing embroidery work at home. Lubna learned this art as a child, and now she has adopted it for her occupation. She made herself independent, and is earning sufficient income.

Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase thread, silk, fancy decorations, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her, and for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thread, silk, fancy decorations, sequins, and pearls for embroidery work.

loans.name: Yerson Leandro

texts.es:
Yerson es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de cotillón.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, que se caracteriza por ser la principal zona receptora de la migración interdepartamental y campo-ciudad.
Yerson es de tez morena, cabello corto y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de cotillones, los cotillones son decoraciones en globos y telas para todo tipo de fiestas como ser; matrimonio, quince años, cumpleaños, despedidas de soltero, etc., “nuestros Cotillones son el accesorio ideal para toda fiesta temática ya que le aporta originalidad y detalles a las mismas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con fiestas todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar materiales de trabajo como, plastoformo, cartulina de colores, pegamento y otros. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda grande y reconocida, él desea comprar material de cotillón para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yerson solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar cotillón para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yerson is a young man aged 22 years. He lives with his partner and has a son aged 1 year, and works making and selling party favours. He is a good father, enterprising and very hard-working. He runs his business in the south of the city, known for being the main area for receiving migrants from other departments or from the country to the city.

Yerson has a dark complexion, short hair and a slight build. His mother tongue is Guaraní and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his partner, who works in the same business, and with his son, who is not yet of school age. They live in a rented brick house with all basic services. He works making and selling party favours, which are decorated balloons and fabrics for all types of party, such as for weddings, quinceañeras, birthdays, stag parties, etc. He says "our party favours are the ideal accessory for any theme party, as they provide originality and fine details". 

The advantage of his business is that there are parties all year. The disadvantage is that he lacks money to buy working materials such as polystyrene, coloured card, glue, etc. He dreams of having his own large, well-known shop. He wants to buy materials for party favours for his business.

This is the first series of loans from the institution in his two years of carrying out this activity. 
For these reasons, Yerson is requesting a loan to buy materials for making party favours for his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making party favours for his business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been farming for many years, and she earns a better income from this work. With her previous loan used for buying livestock to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm to have a productive and good harvest that can earn more income.

She is now happy to say that she can have more pigs to sell and will be able to increase her income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Shim's Group

texts.en: Shim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Shim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanthorn works as factory laborer and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 12 y 16 años, y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña y alpaca. 
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Cosmos 79’, caracterizada por encontrarse el nuevo estadio de fútbol.
Wilma es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de vicuña; este consiste en comprar lana de vicuña y alpaca, la cual asea para luego hilvanarla, una vez que tiene suficiente lana se dispone a tejerla en una máquina manual. La labor es netamente artesanal y cada manta lleva un promedio de 2 a 3 días en terminarla. “inicié mi negocio porque mi cuñada me incentivó a tejer…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su cuñada le ayuda a vender, la desventaja es que ella sola se ocupa de toda su familia. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa, ella desea realizar la compra de lana de vicuña y alpaca por mayor para aumentar su producción. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Wilma solicita un préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca y vicuña por mayor para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Wilma is a 36 year old woman. She is single and has three children aged 6, 12 and 16 years old. Her business is weaving vicuña and alpaca shawls.

She is a good mother, understanding and very hard-working. She does her business in the ‘Cosmos 79’ area which is where the new football stadium is.

Wilma is dark skinned, short and thin. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children who study in school. They live in a rented house made of brick that has all the basic services.

Her business is the weaving of vicuna shawls. It consists of buying vicuna and alpaca wool which she cleans and then makes into thread. When she has enough wool she starts to weave it on a manual machine. The work is clearly artisan and each shawl takes an average of two to three days to complete. "I started my business because my sister-in-law gave me the motivation to weave", she commented. The advantage of her business is her sister-in-law helps her to sell her disadvantage is that she has to care for the family alone. Her dream is to buy a lot to construct her house. She wants to buy vicuna and alpaca wool wholesale to increase her production. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years that she has been doing this activity independently.

For these reasons Wilma is requesting a loan to buy vicuna and alpaca wool wholesale to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy alpaca and vicuna wool wholesale to increase her production.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 52-year-old woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Nasreen has been running a food stall where she sells different types of edible items, including samosas, rolls, chips, tea and more. She is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

She needs to purchase different types of edibles and other items for this business purpose so that she can increase the size of business, improve her sales growth, and earn maximum profit. Due to her unfavorable financial position, she is not currently in a condition to purchase these items for her business purposes.

Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can purchase the above items for her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her canteen business.

loans.name: Women In Coastal Area -N8T8Qđại Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ is 31 years old, and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.

Huệ lives in Quang Xuong District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family has a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

In 2014, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Mcrofinance Institution.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la elaboración de habitas.
Ella es emprendedora, alegre y muy divertida. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Huayna Potosi’ caracterizado por encontrarse la liga deportiva que se encarga de incentivar el deporte amateur y profesional.
Lizeth es morena, de baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con su hermano que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de habas cocidas, ella compra habas y las hace secar para después embolsarlas y venderlas por mayor y al menudeo, “inicié mi negocio con mi madre y mi abuela porque en la provincia de dónde venimos tenemos plantaciones de habas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja en su casa y vende por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar habas por mayor y una cocina. Su sueño es incrementar su mercadería, ella desea comprar habas por mayor y una cocina para secar las habas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lizeth solicita un préstamo para comprar habas por mayor y una cocina para prepararlas.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a youth 20 year old women who is single and has no children. Her business is the production of broad beans.

She is enterprising, joyful and very funny. Her business takes place in the 'Huayna Potosi’ area which houses the sporting club which is in charge of encouraging amateur and professional sport.

Lizeth is dark-skinned, short and thin. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives in the house of her mother who works in the same business and with her brother who studies in school. They live in a room that is their property made of adobe and has all the basic services.

Her business is selling cooked broad beans. She buys the beans and dries them and later puts them in bags and sells them wholesale and retail. "I started my business with my mother and my grandmother because in the province we come from has broad bean plantations", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she works at home and sells wholesale, her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy beans wholesale and a stove. Her dream is to increase her merchandise. She wants to buy beans wholesale and a stove to dry the beans. This is her first loan in the 3 years she has run this business.

For these reasons Lizeth is requesting a loan to buy broad beans wholesale and a stove to prepare them.

loans.use: to buy broad beans wholesale and a stove to prepare them.

loans.name: Lupelele

texts.en:
Lupelele is 54 years old and married with six children.

She has a small garden where she grows tobacco that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Lupelele needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, plastic papers, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014.

She will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, knives, plastic papers, etc.

loans.name: Line

texts.en:
Line is a 21-year-old woman who is single with no child. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Line has requested a loan to buy scissors, needles, a sewing machine, material, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy scissors, needles, a sewing machine, material, thread, etc.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: For five years , Emilia has been operating a sari-sari  (general store) business in Sto. Nino Tukuran. This keeps her occupied and she really enjoys managing her business. Emilia is asking for a loan to buy items such as vegetables, breads, coffee and sugar in bulk to sell. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her store so she can better provide for her family, provide a healthy diet for herself and her husband, and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, breads, coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
Remigio es un hombre de 58 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 7 años, y su negocio es la veterinaria.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor e independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘chirapata’ caracterizado por encontrarse en cercanías al lago Titicaca.
Remigio es de baja estatura, tez morena y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará (que se habla en el lugar) y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la producción de queso y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de vertiente. Su negocio es la veterinaria, él se ocupa de realizar inseminación artificial al ganado del lugar actividad que aprendió a través de una capacitación por una entidad no gubernamental, “inicié mi negocio por el aprecio que tengo a los animales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes por temporada, la desventaja es el clima del lugar y las distancias largas que debe recorres. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, él desea comprar productos veterinarios por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Remigio solicita un préstamo para comprar productos veterinarios por mayor para realizar inseminación artificial al ganado.
texts.en:
Remigio is a 58 year old man, he is married and has a seven year old son. He is a veterinarian.
He is a good father, entrepreneurial and independent. His business is located in the town of Chirpata, characterized by being located near Lake Titicaca.
Remigio is short and thin, with a dark complexion. His mother tongue is Aymará (which is spoken in his town) and he also speaks Spanish.
He shares his life with his wife, who works making cheese, and with his son who studies in school. They live in their own home which is made of adobe and has electricity and running water.
He works as a veterinarian. He performs artificial insemination for cattle, which he learned through training by a non-governmental organization. "I started my business because of the regard I have for animals," he comments.
The advantage of his business is that he relies on customers for the season. The disadvantages are the climate where he lives and the far distances that he has to cover.
His dream is to improve his business. He wants to buy veterinarian supplies wholesale. This is his first loan with the institution in the 18 years that he has been working in this area.
It is for these reasons that Remigio is requesting a loan: to buy veterinarian supplies wholesale to continue performing artificial insemination for cattle.

loans.use: to buy veterinarian supplies wholesale to continue performing artificial insemination for cattle.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 45-year-old mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son is a turner by profession and has been operating a lathe for many years. He takes order for manufacturing vehicles' spare parts and has to complete orders on time.

For manufacturing purposes, he utilizes types of cutting tools, dies, and miscellaneous tools. With the passage of time and due to continuously working upon the lathe, many important tools have worn out. He wants to buy new tools, but due to the high cost, he is unable to purchase them from the market.

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy tools and can operate the lathe again smoothly. In this way he can easily continue his manufacturing business and can complete his orders in the given time.

Shabana hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to replace worn-out tools with new ones for her son's lathe so he can complete his orders in the given time period.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 40-year-old married man who has three children. Four years ago, he started seaweed farming. He grows seaweed and sells it to the locals in his area. Wilson is also engaged in fishing, selling fresh fish to the neighbors and local dwellers.

Wilson would like to boost his seaweed farming but he has no capital to do so. He decided to take out a loan to buy materials such as straw, rope and seaweed seedlings for seaweed farming. With these, he could slowly expand and improve the yield of his farm and provide for the needs of his children, including good nutrition and better living conditions. In the future, Wilson is hopeful that he will become productive in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy materials such as straw, rope and seaweed seedlings for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Robi

texts.en:
Robi is a 37-year-old lady and a responsible mother of one daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running his own call center business for the past one year. Robi's husband needs to purchase different types of equipment (e.g., computers, wood tables, chairs, headphones, etc.) for his business.

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this equipment. To meet the needs of her husband, Robi has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, she will assist her husband to buy this equipment for business purposes. It will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will enable him to meet his family's needs.

Robi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her husband's call center business.

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
After successfully maintaining pigs with the last loan, the Sari Kencana group agrees to continue the loan cycle. Now they proposed to increasing the loan size. They succeeded in selling their pigs with a high price and earn a satisfactory profit. The reason they want a increasing loan size is because the price for feed is very expensive. One member made her payment and decided to resign because she had enough profit and can continue the pig business with her own money.

After being evaluated by MUK’s staff, the Sari Kencana group received 9,000,000 IDR for 9 members. Jro Nyoman, the head of the group, succeeded to sell her piglets and now she has a sow who just birthed 12 healthy piglets. She’s very happy for that. She will use her loan to purchase feed only. She must prepare a lot of feed to make sure the piglets grow rapidly.

Jro Nyoman hopes all the piglets will be healthy and their growth is maximized to get a high price when she sells them later. With the profit Jro Nyoman has a dream to renovate her house and support her children's education.

Two members are not in pictured because of illness.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Agai

texts.en:
Agai is a 58-year-oldwoman who is married with 6 children. She has a small business operating a bingo in her village. She has 2 years with this business.

Agai needs a loan to buy bingo packages, pens, etc. She will use her profits to extend her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Aga joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bingo supplies.

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, drinks, chicken legs, toiletries, sugar, canned food, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Sose needs a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, toiletries, frozen food, etc. to sell. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
This is Felicidad, 49 years old, from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Raymond, her business partner, and they have three children, of which one is studying in college, one is already working, and one still stays at home.

The majority of the people in the Philippines live below the poverty level but they don't lose hope that life will get better as they strive hard and trust in God. Felicidad trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 19,000 to help her expand her store and pay for grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. Sometimes she encounters customers who don't fulfill their obligations but she maintains her positive attitude that things will get better as sure as the sun rises. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help.

Felicidad aims to own a bigger grocery store. Her precious dream is to see her children become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Wa Ne Noogo Group

texts.fr:
Mme ESTHER est la responsable du groupe  WA NE NOOGO. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40 ans et le moins âgé a 21 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charges.
Mme fait du maraîchage depuis 25 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 03 planches d’oignons, 12 sacs d’engrais et 02 boîtes de produits.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande productrice.
texts.en:
Mme Esther is the representative of this group called Wa Ne Noogo. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 40 and the youngest aged 21. Four children go to school and she is supporting four persons. She has been doing market gardening for 25 years. She buys her supplies in the surrounding villages.

With the loan money, Esther intends to buy three trays of onions, 12 sacks of fertilizer, and two packages of products. She wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to become an important producer.

loans.use: to buy three trays of onions, 12 sacks of fertilizer, and two packages of products.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana, age 30, is a mother of two children. She has been running a jewelry business in the market for past 6 years. This is the only source of income for her family.

Sana needs to purchase new varieties of jewelry to resell. However due to lack of money she finds it difficult. This purchase will help her to offer more variety to her customers and to continue her work efficiently and professionally. For that reasons, Sana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping herself. She will purchase new varieties of jewelry.

Sana is feeling happy that she will be able to get help with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children from his low income. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Bushra has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan so that her son can buy a new rickshaw along with the contribution of her savings.

Bushra is a 55-year-old woman living with her four children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is a 27-years-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Nomi is also providing sewing services and earn additional income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

Nomi needs different kinds of goods, e.g a sewing machine, needles, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nomi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine & sewing supplies.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 35-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motorcars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles and renews the turbine and radiators.

Shama's husband has been doing this business for many years and until this time his business is much settled. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have torn off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the affected parts, it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband does not have a sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problem of the lathe machine and to buy cutting tools. Therefore, Shama requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy spare parts for his lathe machine.

Shama hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business, as well as for her family.

loans.use: to repair a lathe for her husband's machine shop.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 35 and is married. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband purchases cloth from the market which she sells from her home and her husband sells over his bicycle. In this way they both contribute to their monthly income. They have been selling cloth related to the summer season, now the weather is going to change and customers demand warmer cloth.

Mumtaz is compelled to take a Kiva loan so she can buy warm cloth to offer and cope with the demand. In this way they can offer warm cloth and can generate maximum income for their cherished family. She hopes that she can utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming cloths for her children.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed, 47 years old, is a Palestinian man from the city of Bethlehem. He is married and the father of four children. Waheed chose to take a loan from ACAD so he can buy a new grill and some needed equipment for baking pastry. Waheed is the sole breadwinner of his family so, in addition to his pastry store, he works as a chef at the Bethlehem Arab Society For Rehabilitation.

Competition in his area is the main business challenge that Waheed faces. He plans to expand his business and open new branches of pastry stores. Finally, Waheed wants to thank ACAD and Kiva for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy a new grill and needed equipment for baking pastry.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma has requested a loan for her son's gym club. Both of her sons have been running this club for many years, which is why most of the weights have depreciated and need to be replaced with new ones.

Najma came to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and applied for a loan for her sons. They will buy new weights and equipment for the gym so they can attract more customers and ultimately easily generate maximum income to provide for the rest of the family members.

Najma, aged 55, is the mother of seven children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy new weights and equipment for her son's gym club.

loans.name: Elisabete

texts.en:
Elisabete has been in business for the past six months. She is originally from Brazil and is the proud owner of Dance Palooza, a dance and martial arts studio that offers a variety of classes for children and adults in the Harrison area.

Originally from Brazil, Elisabete moved to Newark twenty years ago. At a very young age, Elisabete learned the traditional martial art of Capoeira, a Brazilian art form that combines elements of dance, acrobatics, and music in a fun and playful way.

Two years ago Elisabete started teaching small classes of Capoeira to children ages 3 and up in Newark. She saw how her classes provided an opportunity for children to exercise and learn a new skill in a non-competitive environment that encourages creativity, discipline, and focus.

This past summer, Elisabete decided to open her own location with two studio rooms to offer classes every morning and evening from Monday through Friday. Elisabete's studio now offers Capoeira to children and adults, as well as ballet, tap, hip hop and jazz dance classes. She also offers yoga, Taekwondo, and Zumba. Starting with 80 students, both children and adults, Elisabete is excited to receive new registrations for her classes every day.

A Kiva loan from you will help Elisabete install new flooring in one of her studios. Her vision is to turn her studio into a venue where people of all ages can come to learn lifelong skills while building community and having fun.

loans.use: to install a beautiful dance floor in her new studio.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, aged 35, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services along with her husband. Both sew garments with mutual efforts and sell garments to the boutique.

Due to increase in household expenses and basic needs, Kousar wants to increase her production. For this purpose she requires more cloth and sewing materials such as zippers, laces, spools, threads, etc. She does not have enough cash in hand because she spend a lot of money on household expenses on a daily basis. This is the reason Kousar has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can increase her production and ultimately turnover more money.

Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Inayat

texts.en:
Inayat is a 46-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She has five children and her husband has run a general store for nine years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Inayat's husband wants to purchase rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other items for his business but does not have the funds. Inayat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy all these commodities and help her husband to earn an income to manage his household and business.

Inayat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, etc. for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 45-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her children have reached up to the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her three sons have been driving auto rickshaws for many years. Their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to maintain the auto rickshaw body but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem.

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy the auto rickshaw body.

She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings until the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Bibimo

texts.ru: Веселая женщина Бибимо. Она замужем и у нее одна дочка. Мужу 56 лет, а дочери 25 лет. Бибимо живет в городе Куляб вместе с дочкой. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Бибимо дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Она в 2005 году начала свою деятельность. Бибимо до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свою работу. Ей в работе помогает ее дочка. Бибимо шьет женскую одежду.  Сейчас у Бибимо закончилось ткани и швейные принадлежности. Она хочет взять кредит и приобрести швейные принадлежности. Запрашиваемый кредит продвигать деятельность и сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en: This cheerful woman is Bibimo. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is 56 years old, and her daughter is 25. Bibimo lives in the city of Kulob with her daughter. Her husband is away earning in the Russian Federation. Bibimo offers her services as a seamstress from home. She started her business in 2005. Bibimo continues this work to this day. Her daughter helps her with her work. Bibimo sews women's clothing. Now Bibimo's cloth and sewing supplies have run out. She wants to take a loan and buy some sewing supplies. The requested loan will maintain the business and preserve her source of income.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Xiengkiew Group

texts.en:
Boun understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Boun purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Boun is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy is a 35-year-old spinster. She is a professional cook who lives in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a cook since 2013, and can earn approximately $6.66 per day.

Kunthy would like to request a loan, because she needs finances to buy more groceries to sell. With this loan, she will be able to buy groceries to sell and improve her family’s income. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Las Unicas Group

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer d e47 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 28 y 29 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por encontrarse la mayor parte de la población y la producción manufacturera.
Tania es de cabello gris, tez morena y baja estatura (sentada la primera de la derecha, viste chamarra lila), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son mayores de edad e independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. la necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevaron a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; recauchutado de llantas, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella tiene un taller llamado ‘clínica de jeans’ donde realiza todo tipo de arreglo a prendas de vestir como; ancho de cintura, largo de bota pie, ancho de espalda, arreglo de rasgaduras, desgarros y otros, “inicié mi negocio porque la demanda es mayor que para confeccionar ropa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea comprar material de costura como; tela, hilos, botones y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Tania solicita un pprestamo para comprar material de costura para mejorar su clínica de jeans.
texts.en:
Tania is a 47 year old woman. She is single and has two children aged 28 and 29. Her business is tailoring.

She is enterprising, independent and very hard-working. Her business takes place in the Southern area of the city which has the majority of population and the manufacturing production.

Tania has grey hair, dark skin and is short. (in the photo she is seated first to the right wearing a purple coat). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children who are adults and independent. They live in their own house which is made of brick and has all the basic services. The need to improve her income led her to head a communal bank. The businesses of the members are: retreading tires, selling food, the sales of used clothing, the sale of natural products for the health, leather crafts, making hats and a neighborhood store.

Her business is tailoring. She has a workshop called the 'clínica de jeans’ where she does all kinds of repairs to clothing like: letting out waists, lengthening the leg, broadening the shoulders, repairing rips, tears, and others. "I started my business because the demand was greater than making clothing', she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has regular clients, her disadvantage is the competition. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to buy sewing materials like fabric, thread, buttons and others. This is her first loan with the institution in the six years she has been doing this activity.

For these reasons Tania is requesting a loan to improve her sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy sewing material to improve her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором молодая женщина из городка Дангара. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Дочкам 2 и 1 года. Ее муж работает заграницей. Он от безысходности был вынужден уехать на заработки. Воспитание детей возложено на хрупкие плечи Дилором. Работа мужа очень тяжелая. Дилором понимает, как ему нелегко работать на чужбине. Она дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Дилором старается хоть какие-то расходы семьи покрыть своим трудом, чтобы ее мужу было легче. Дилором хочет купить швейную машинку (которая изображена на фотографии), так как ее старая машинка сломалась и больше не пригодна для использования. Она надеется, что ее финансово поддержат и эта машинка останется с ней.
texts.en: Dilorom is a young woman from the town of Dangara. She is 33 years old. She is married and has two children. Her daughters are two years old and one year old. Her husband works abroad. In desperation he was obliged to go away to work. The raising of their children was placed on Dilorom's fragile shoulders. Her husband's work is very hard. Dilorom understands how difficult it is to work in a foreign land. She provides dressmaking services from home. Dilorom strives somehow to cover the family's expenses with her labor to make things easier for her husband. Dilorom wants to buy a sewing machine (depicted in the photograph), since her old sewing machine is broken and no longer suitable for use. She hopes that she will get financial support and that this sewing machine will be hers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and create good working conditions.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera, tienen 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Ella es buen madre, decidida y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘el torno’ situado a 32 Km de la ciudad, el idioma predominante es el español, aunque también se habla guaraní, quechua y aymará, debido a la migración permanente de gente de otras regiones del país.
Melania es morena de baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como productos de limpieza, refrescos fríos y otros, en su tienda de barrio, “traemos productos de la ciudad para abastecer mi tienda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para ampliar el negocio comprando nueva mercadería. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea comprar mercadería por mayor para bastecer su tienda de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Melania solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor para bastecer su tienda de barrio.
texts.en: Melania is a 42 year old woman. She is single and has two children, 10 and 15 years old, and her business is a grocery store. She is a good mother, decisive and very enterprising. She has her business in the town of "El Torno", located 32 kilometers from the city. The main language spoken is Spanish, although also Guarani, Quechua and Aymara are spoken here because of the permanent migration of people from other regions of the country. Melania is dark skinned, short and thin. Her native language is Guarani and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children who attend school. They live in a house owned by the family, built with brick, with electricity and well water. Her business is selling food and basic needs items, such as cleaning products, cold beverages and other things, in her neighborhood store. “We bring products from the city to stock up my store...", she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales; the disadvantage is the lack of money to expand the business by buying new merchandise. Her dream is to expand her business. She wants to buy merchandise at wholesale prices to stock up her neighborhood store. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the five years she has been working in this activity. For these reasons, Melania is requesting a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale prices in order to stock up her neighborhood store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale prices in order to stock up her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla has been selling grocery goods for many years. She earns enough from the business to provide for her family, and has successfully repaid her previous business loan. Through her determination, she has sustained her business.

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods and drinks to sell, in order to boost her inventory stock. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

location.town: BOUGINVILLA, POB. SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTA

loans.name: Boua Group

texts.en:
Bounmee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Bounmee and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Bounmee and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within these two years, filter users like Bounmee’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 27-year-old single young man who left school at an early age to help his father in covering the needs and expenses of their family that consists of three members. Almost a year ago, he opened a cosmetics shop. He is becoming well-known in his region and has a good reputation among his customers.

Kassem is an ambitious, independent, and responsible man who has a lot of plans for his future and he is always working hard to achieve what he wants. Today, Kassem is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business. With this loan he will be able to increase his merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics for the winter season to satisfy his customers' requests. Kassem hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and enable him to build his own family and life.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics for the winter season

loans.name: Naoung Group

texts.en:
Pheangphed understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. She knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pheangphed purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Pheangphed is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 45 and the mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and has been selling fresh fruits from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can maximize sales in the fruit-selling business.

Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits to resell. Nazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy excess seasonal fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sokpha's Group

texts.en:
Sokpha’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokpha makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Channy makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ladmon Group

texts.en: Mee is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Mee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Mee and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Mee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne diseases. After totaling up the costs, Mee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 59 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Luzminda has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for eight years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn has mastered her hog raising business in Polo Pitogo, Plaridel. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family.

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs.

Now, the loan of PHP 30,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that will support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens.

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena, age 57, is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a marble shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase a grinder machine for marble to resell. However due to lack of money her husband finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife, Sakeena, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase a grinder machine and a new variety of marble materials. Sakeena is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a grinder machine for her husband's marble business.

loans.name: Seedat

texts.en: Seedat is 21 years old, a single student who is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. His family are rice farmers and they depend on farming as revenue. Currently, Seedat is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management at a university in the city. Because Seedat is short of finances to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. For his dreams, he wants to find a proper job with a reasonable salary so he will be able to save money to build a proper house and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to cover his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Bích's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích is 54 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than ten years. Bích lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when some disease of poultry happens, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell, and she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Bích faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Bích's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard. Her group consists of three members.

In the future, Bích hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Ibaale Kwesiga Women Group

texts.en:
Tadeo is a member of Ibaale Kwesiga Women Group, in which members guarantee each other at the time of borrowing and loan payment. He operates a produce business, selling items like posho, rice and beans. He started the business in 2009, with a hope of financially supporting himself. He is looking forward to becoming financially independent and expanding his business to new areas for increased profits.

Tadeo faces the challenge of limited capital, which leads to little stock and little income at the end of the month. Tadeo has asked for a loan in a group to help him add stock of posho, rice and beans to sell in his produce business.

loans.use: to add stock of posho, rice and beans to sell in his produce business.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya, 46 years old, is a hardworking woman. She is married, has five children and lives in San Juan Pana-on (a village in which the main livelihood is farming). Her husband is also a farmer. To help her husband to earn a living, she decided to make a vegetable garden. Their business is already 25 years in existence and earns a profit of PHP 5,000 per month.

This income is not enough for them, so she plans to make a bigger vegetable garden so that she can continue to send her children to school. Her huge problem is she needs additional funds to buy fertilizers and seedlings. For this, she went to Gata Daku MPC to ask for help. She applied for a loan amount of PHP 4,000, which was released September 30, 2015.

Ligaya’s main objective is to help her husband to earn a living so they can continue sending their children to school. She aims to have another piece of land for the expansion of her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jemena

texts.es:
Jemena es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva.
Ella es buena madre, solidaria y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ceja de el alto’ caracterizado por encontrarse al borde de la ciudad, desde ese lugar se baja a la ciudad.
Jemena es morena de cabello negro y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hija que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva, se inició costurando con su esposo chaquetas deportivas, “los clientes están conociendo mi tienda poco a poco…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en un lugar comercial, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar una máquina de coser ‘collareta’. Su sueño es incrementar su producción, contratar operarios y mejorar la variedad de prendas de vestir, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser tipo ‘collareta’ para incrementar la mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jemena solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser tipo collareta para incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
Jemena is a young 21 year-old woman, who's married and has a 3 year old daughter. Her business is the production of athletic apparel. She's a good mother, supportive and very patient. She runs her business in the "Ceja del Alto" area, known for its location on the edge of the city from which you can travel to the city itself.

Jemena has a dark complexion, black hair, and is short of stature. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works in the same business and with her daughter who's not yet school age. They live in a family-owned home built from brick that has all of the basic amenities. Her business is making athletic apparel and she started off by sewing athletic jackets with her husband. "Little by little the customers are becoming familiar with my store..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it's located in a commercial area, and the disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase a specialized sewing machine. 

Her dream is to increase her production, hire operators and expand the variety of garments. She wants to buy a specialized sewing machine to expand her merchandise. This is her first loan with the institution in the year that she's been doing this work. These are the reasons why Jemena is applying for a loan to purchase a specialized sewing machine to increase production.

loans.use: To purchase a specialized sewing machine to increase her production.

loans.name: Ma. Alelie

texts.en:
Her name is Ma. Alelie, aged 52, from Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she has her own business which enables her to help her aging parents as it is unique to Filipino culture to take care of their parents as they get old.

Ma. Alelie derives her income from a small general store she has been running for six years already. She puts her best effort and time on it for it is how she supports her and her parents' everyday needs. She earns by buying grocery supplies and clothes at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.

To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 35,000 loan to fill her small store with grocery items such as rice, frozen foods, biscuits, canned goods, instant noodles, eggs, etc. Having more essential food items to offer will make her small store attractive to consumers. Your valued help with her livelihood will be highly appreciated.

Ma. Alelie plans to install a coffee vending machine as an additional feature at her store. She aims to assist her parents and some of her siblings who are in need. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru: 39 летный бизнесмен Назир. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Детям 10 и 5 лет. Его жена с сестрой находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Назир сейчас живет вместе с братьями и детьми.
