Он у себя дома выращивает скота и параллельно занимается перевозчиком. Назир арендует грузовую машину, и перевозить товар. Он перевозить строй материалы ( цемент, алебастр, щебень) и другое. Назир хочет купить себе грузовую автомашину для своего бизнеса. Потому что ему не выгодно арендовать машину. По этой причине он решил зарабатывать на своем грузовом машине. Назир очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Nazir, a 39-year-old businessman. He is married and the father of two children. His children are 10 and 5 years old. His wife and sister are away working in the Russian Federation. Now Nazir is living with his brothers and children. He rears livestock at home and also works in parallel as a transporter. Nazir rents a truck and transports goods. He transports construction materials (cement, plaster, gravel) and more. Nazir wants to buy himself a truck for his business because it is not profitable to rent one. For this reason he has decided to earn money in his own truck. Nazir very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn hails from the rural town of Tolosa, Leyte. She is married and has seven children. Two of her children are still attending school and are 7 and 12 years old respectively.

She earns a living operating a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. She sells commodities like edible oil, vinegar, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, noodles, biscuits, bread, and toiletries. Her husband is a laborer.

For almost three years now, Evelyn has been serving mostly neighbors in her place. She would like to boost the contents of the store. Her biggest challenge is maintaining enough liquid capital to sustain her project.

Evelyn wants to purchase goods like rice, biscuits, condiments and beverages. With these items in stock, she would be able to cope with customer demand. Slowly, she could start to invest in other possible business ventures to become sustainable.

Evelyn is grateful for your continued support.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell, like rice, biscuits, condiments and beverages.

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en:
Esmael is a 41-year-old married man and he lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is employed in a private company but unfortunately earns only a minimum salary.

To support the needs of his family, he created a transport business. He has been running a transport service for about three years, and this business is a big help in raising his three children.

He is applying for a microcredit loan to purchase tires and accessories. In the future, he hopes to improve his business and have another motorcycle for the business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and tires.

loans.name: Rosalío

texts.es:
Rosalio  es un hombre de 29 años de edad, el como muchas personas sus vidas sean transformado por los créditos a los que han tendido acceso, Rosalio  cuenta que el ultimo préstamo lo utilizo para compra de semillas de cebolla y zanahoria, afortunadamente obtuvo una buena cosecha y le dejo una buena ganancia. Rosalio está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de cebolla y abono químico para su próximo cultivo. El espera contar con este crédito para poder adquirir sus insumos para realizar su cultivo.
Su gran sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, esto con mucho trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Rosalío is a 29-year-old man.  His life, like many other people's lives, has been transformed by the loans he has had access to.  Rosalío tells that he used the last loan to buy onion and carrot seeds.  Fortunately, he got a good harvest and it made him a good profit.

Rosalío is requesting a new loan for the purchase of onion seeds and chemical fertilizer for his next crop.  He hopes to count on this loan to be able to buy his supplies to carry out his cultivation.  His big dream is to improve his family's quality of life, with lots of work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Alianza Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALIANZA DEL SUR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. El negocio que las integrantes de  la asociación comunal llevan adelante es la venta de leche.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución, que se realizó en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace diez años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de forraje que adquirirá de su comunidad, esta compra le ayudara en la alimentación de su ganado, para que el mismo tenga una mejor producción de leche, para  posteriormente comercializarlo a una empresa de lácteos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association called “ALIANZA DEL SUR” will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, which is part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. There are eight members of the group which takes direction from a board whose President is a lady named Ruth. The members of the communal association make a living from selling milk.

The loan will benefit Ruth's small businesses. She says that this is the first time that she has been part of Pro Mujer. Ruth was invited to join as part of a large campaign run by the organisation in her community. She currently makes a living by selling milk, having learned the business from her parents ten years ago.

The loan that she will now draw down is to buy fodder which she will source from her community. The purchase will help to feed her cattle, improving milk production, so that the milk can subsequently be sold to a dairy. This type of work allows her to earn an income to support her family financially; she is single with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she said that she likes the training that the organization provides her.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline has switched from selling snacks to retailing consumable goods. Her business is doing well when she doubles her time in responding to the needs of her customers. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

That's the reason why she took another loan from PMPC to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Myljo

texts.en:
Myljo is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines and the husband of June, a vendor. They’re helping each other to make a living. Myljo has been engaged in selling ready-to-wear clothes and bags for three years now. She admits that it’s not easy to earn a living nowadays, since prices of products vary from time to time. That’s why she’s persistent in running the business, for she has children to raise and daily needs to sustain.

Myljo is thankful that she has a hardworking husband who’s helping her with the business. Their approximate earning reaches to about PHP 11,000 in a month.

She applied for a PHP 10,000 loan to buy additional ready-to-wear-clothes and other items for the business. She believes that this amount will help support her children’s educational expenses and also improve her profit, since she can have the chance to sell a variety of designs to customers.

Myljo regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience in the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes and other items for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
In every business, you should be patient and persistent if you are aiming for success. Rosemarie still has the business for she has those attributes an entrepreneur should possess. She’s thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) helped her financially by granting her previous loan amount of PHP 25,000. Now, she’s able to earn to approximately PHP 20,000 every month.

Rosemarie is grateful for having the business since it helps sustain their daily needs. She works hard to make the business flourish, which is one of her goals in life, and she's planning to invest for their own house and lot someday. This year, Rosemarie wants to apply for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy different designs of gowns for the business. She’s anticipating that her request will be granted since this will be a great help for the business to attract more patrons and increase her sales.

Rosemarie believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending her weekly fellowship group for CCT partners, that consists of 15 to 30 members. It's a place where she can gain spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, repay microfinance loans, and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase more bridal gowns for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Mabeth

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Mabeth owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities like canned goods, bread, noodles, seasonings, cooking oil, sugar, bath soap and shampoo, which she has uses to manage the economy of her house. Aside from managing a sari-sari store, she also sells " tuba" (coconut wine), to the locals in her place. She is married and has two young children residing in the town of Tolosa, Leyte together with her husband.

Mabeth has requested a loan to purchase coconut wine. In this way, she will be able to have an adequate supply to meet the demand. She would like to continue to improve her sari-sari store but she has to focus on her coconut wine business, which is at peak sales nowadays.  With these, her income will improve and she could start to save for expansion.

She is hoping that someday she will become productive to be able  support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to  purchase tuba (coconut wine)

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son sells plumbing goods such as water pumps, water taps, geezers, sinks, joints, water pipes, joints, elbows, showers, etc., generating income for the family.

Ghazala's son has only single source of income, which is his plumbing shop. He was in another business selling construction goods, which proved less beneficial for him. He established his new business and hopes that it will prove more beneficial than last one. He retained a list of good customers in a short time and this business is going well. He wants to make further investment to complete the remaining inventories for his business but he does not have enough funds.

Therefore, GHAZALA requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her son will use to buy the remaining plumbing stock.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing goods for her son's shop.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is 51 years old, and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. Levon graduated from the Institute of Physical Education, and now he works at the school as a teacher of physical education, and at the same time, at the city’s sport school, he works as a chess coach.

Levon is a very intellectual and clever person who finds chess the best way of training the human brain; it is especially good when pupils are interested in it from a very young age. Nowadays chess training courses are greatly involved in all school programs in Armenia, and this really gives good results in pupils’ studying quality.

Levon combines both of his beloved occupations, which give him great pleasure and bring income, as well. Levon’s two daughters are students; these young ladies are very laborious and interested in their education, and they have a lot of achievements in their education. Levon’s smallest daughter studies at the Yerevan State Linguistic University at the paid division.

For Levon, his daughter’s tuition fee sometimes turns out to be a hardship, and for this first semester, he lacks money for the repayment. From this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Levon seeks, he will pay his daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester with 200,000, and he will be happy to use the other part of the loan for the purchase of a computer and some professional literature to be aware of any news and different championships that are in the chess world.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and some professional literature to be aware of any news and different championships that are in the chess world.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A cliente Lúcia , comerciante de 48 anos de idade,solteira e mãe de 01 filho já maior de idade, vive  na casa própria e sustenta 01 neto e 01 nora .
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar 01 saco de feijão , 01 saco de amendoim, 10 sacos de batata, 10 sacos de cebola, para ampliar o seu negocio.
A cliente tem como sonho ter uma barraca, comprar um carro e concluir a sua casa  para melhorar as condições.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Lucia is a 48 year old trader. She is single and the mother of one son who is now an adult. She lives in her own home and supports her grandson and her daugher-in-law.

With the money from this loan Lucia will buy a bag of beans, a bag of peanuts, 10 bags of potatoes and 10 bags of onions to expand her business.

Lucia dreams of having her own stall, buying a car and finishing the building work on her house to improve her living conditions. Her main challenge is her finances, however she has been working and she intends to take out more loans so she can make her dreams reality.

loans.use: to buy a bag of beans, a bag of peanuts, 10 bags of potatoes and 10 bags of onions to expand her store.

loans.name: La Honestidad Group

texts.es: Un grupo consolidado y laborioso,  siendo mujeres luchadoras, orgullosas de ser madre pero a la vez orgullosas por formar parte de  las mujeres emprendedoras de nuestro país se encuentra el grupo solidario ¨La Honestidad¨. Nohemy es la coordinadora de 29 años, casada y madre de 4 hijos de edades 12, 7, 5 y 1 año.  Dueña de una pulpería ubicada en su hogar,  quien logro obtener con el dinero que recibió en su trabajo anterior. Ahora para tener surtido su minitienda requiere el dinero para invertirlo en arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, jabones, papeles higiénicos. Las demás socias son Yolanda quien tiene una pulpería. Fátima a la venta de verduras y Cesia quien comercializa ropa usada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group La Honestidad is a united and hard-working group of women who are fighters and proud to be mothers, but at the same time proud to form part of the women entrepreneurs of our country. 

Nohemy is the coordinator. She is 29 years old, married, and the mother of four children, ages 12, 7, 5 and 1 year. She owns a convenience store located at her home, which she was able to obtain with the money she received from her previous job. Now, to have variety, her convenience store requires the money to invest in rice, oil, sugar, beans, soaps and toilet paper. 

The other members are: Yolanda, who owns a convenience store; Fátima, who sells vegetables; and Cesia who sells used clothing.

loans.use: to invest in rice, oil, sugar, beans, soaps and toilet paper.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung is 31 years old and married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for five years.

Dung lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because if a disease happened to her poultry, they could die, which would leave her nothing to sell and in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.

In the future, Dung hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Alexis Javier

texts.es: Alexis es un hombre trabajador de 26 años de edad, acompañado y padre de un niño de tres años, por quien trabaja fuerte para que no le falte nada, Alexis es propietario de una pulpería desde hace tres años y solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento de la institución para cumplir su meta que es ampliarlo con la oferta de productos como gaseosa, arroz, aceite, azúcar, sal y pan.
texts.en: Alexis is a hardworking 26 year old man. He is a married father of a three year old, for whom he works hard so he will lack for nothing. Alexis has been the owner of a store for three years and he is asking for his first loan from the institution to meet his goal of expanding the range of products, such as soda, rice, oil, salt and bread.

loans.use: to buy sodas, rice, oil, sugar, salt and bread.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is already 46 years old. She lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with five children.

She is a hardworking woman. She applied and was luckily hired as a housekeeper for one of the prominent families in her town, while her husband is also a family driver. But the salary they get is not enough to provide for the needs of their children.

She wants her children to continue to go to school; that’s why she is looking for extra income. Last year, she started swine fattening, and to her surprise, she got a profit of 3,000 PHP in two months. For this reason, she wishes to continue what she started.

She went to GDMPC to borrow an amount of PHP 5,000 to be used to buy piglets and feeds (food for the piglets). Her future plan, if God permits, is to have a piggery business run by her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Janeth Patricia

texts.es: Janeth es una joven emprendedora de 25 años de edad que en compañía de su cónyuge aperturaron un taller de marroquinería en un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla, aunque ella no contaba con la experticia para realizar esta labor, su cónyuge se encargó de capacitarla en toda la parte productiva del negocio gracias a su experiencia en este arte, adquirida en sus anteriores empleos. Ellos lograron contactar clientes en las otras ciudades; Cartagena, Santa Marta y Maicao, a quienes distribuyen bolsos, billeteras, mochilas, morrales, los cuales son cancelados de contado. Todos los días de la semana laboran en su taller a partir de las 8 a.m. y finalizan a las 7 p.m.  sus compras las realizan a proveedores ubicados en un sector del centro de Barranquilla, especialistas en materiales como cueros, cuerinas, broches, hebillas, hilos, cremalleras y demás. La temporada que se aproxima es la de mayor demanda del año y requieren una inyección de capital para sacar adelante sus pedidos, es por ello que está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en las materias primas, con el fin de incrementar el surtido de productos.  Su meta a futuro es incrementar la distribución a otras ciudades, en lo personal desean adquirir su casa propia para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Janeth is a young 25-year-old entrepreneur who, along with her husband, opened a leather goods shop in a neighborhood located to the south of Barranquilla. Although she didn't have the expertise to do this job, her husband took it upon himself to teach her everything about production in this business, thanks to his own experience with this skill, which he acquired from previous jobs.

They were able to contact customers in other cities: Cartagena, Santa Marta, and Maicoa. They send handbags, wallets, backpacks, and satchels, which are paid for in cash. Every day of the week they work in their shop starting at 8 a.m. and finishing at 7 p.m. They buy from suppliers located in an area in downtown Barranquilla, who are specialists in materials such as leather, imitation leather, clasps, buckles, thread, zippers, and others.

This coming season is when they have the biggest demand of the year and need a boost in capital to meet their orders, which is why they are applying for a loan. Their first credikiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will be to invest in the raw materials with the aim of increasing their supply of products. Their goal for the future is to increase distribution to other cities. They also want a home of their own to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, imitation leather, clasps, buckles, thread, zippers, and others

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate has been with UGAFODE for three years now. She is married with four children, two of whom still attend school. She is dealing in banana and yellow banana sales to accumulate income to support her family.

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX, aiming at restocking her business, so that she pay the rising school dues for her children. She is hardworking and appreciative of the Kiva support toward her business.

loans.use: to buy matooke [bananas used for cooking]

loans.name: Dalina

texts.pt:
A cliente Dalina , cozinheira de 60 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 03 filhos todos  já maiores de idade, vive  na casa própria e sustenta ainda 04 neto.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cimento, varões, chapas, blocos para reabilitar a sua casa e concluir  a dependência .
A cliente tem como sonho, vedar a sua casa, e comprar carro. Com o credito anterior construiu uma dependência .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Dalina is a 60 year old cook who is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom are adults. She lives in her own home and supports four grandchildren.

With the money from this loan she will buy cement, rods, tin sheeting and concrete blocks to renovate her home and finish building an outhouse.

Dalina dreams of draughtproofing her home and buying a car. With her previous loan she built an outhouse.

Dalina's main challenge is her finances, however she has been working in order to take out more loans to make her dreams reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, tin sheeting and concrete blocks to renovate her home and finish building an outhouse.

loans.name: Los Tres Pinos Group

texts.es: Grupo Tres pinos, un grupo consolidado y de mujeres unidas por un solo propósito, sacar adelante sus negocios y sentirse orgullosas por brindarle a sus familias las mejores condiciones posibles. María es la líder del grupo, casada y con 2 hijos a su responsabilidad. Con el negocio de venta de ropa y productos plásticos como sillas y planchas. Ahora requiere del crédito para la compra de pantalones, blusas, ropa interior como bóxer, blumers, brazzieres, tobilleras,  sillas, planchas y licuadoras. Así cubrirá la demanda que realizar sus clientes por medio de los pedidos. Las demás integrantes son Rosa, quien  compra y vende frutas y verduras. Margarita, quien comprara cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en:
Grupo Tres Pinos (Three Pines Group) is a consolidated group of united women for one purpose: to get ahead in their business and feel proud of themselves for providing for their families the best conditions possible.  María is the leader of the group.  She is married, and has two children for whom she is responsible.  She has a business of selling clothing and plastic products such as chairs and irons.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, interior clothing such as boxers, underwear, bras, anklets, chairs, irons, and blenders.  Thus she could cover the demand that her customers ask for.  The other members are Rosa, who works buying and selling fruits and vegetables; and Margarita, who buys crops of tamarind (a type of fruit).

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, interior clothing such as boxers, underwear, bras, anklets, chairs, irons, and blenders.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros, 44, is a farmer living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She has two dependent children. One of them, whose name is Kim Sroy, is studying for a bachelor's degree in Accounting at Royal University of Law and Economics.

Rice farming has been the primary source of Sros's income for 26 years. Moreover, she earns additional income from husking rice. Recently, her farm was threatened by insects, which caused her to earn less income than before.

Now, she is applying for a loan with VisionFund in order to pay for her daughter’s school fees. She hopes her daughter can complete her bachelor's degree and get a good job, with help from this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s school fees to complete a bachelor's degree in Accounting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a repeat client with UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 6 years, only 2 of his children are attending school.

Ambrose is a farmer with banana plantations, and coffee. He is a resident of Rwankola Bwonjera Kajara, Ntungamo district and he has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000/=

Ambrose will use the loan to buy coffee to resell. He believes this will boost his sales and profit.

loans.use: To boost his coffee trade business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A senhora Rosa tem 57 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 06 filhos dos quais 02 estão na sua responsabilidade e os restantes nos seus lares.
Com o empréstimo vai comprar roupa usada para revender. Sonha em reabrir a sua mercearia que se localiza no quintal da sua casa.
Enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, e a falta de produtos para sua actividade. Pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old, widowed and the mother of six children of whom two are under her care while the others all live in their own homes.

With this loan Rosa will buy used clothing to resell. She dreams of reopening her grocery store which is located in her backyard.

Rosa faces financial difficulties and a lack of products to carry out her work. She plans to take out more loans to overcome her struggles and make her dreams reality.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло ответственный человек из маленького городка Дангара. Он примерный семьянин, любящий муж и прекрасный отец. Хикматулло всю жизнь работал и зарабатывал честно нажитым трудом. Он фермер. Хикматулло имеет не большое количество скотов и довольствуется ими. Он благодарит Господа за то, что имеет, за любимую жену, здоровых детей, и не большой бизнес, позволяющий прокормить семью. Хикматулло решил увеличить поголовья скотов, чтобы расширить бизнес и увеличить доход. Его дети скоро окончат школу, и ему придется собирать деньги на дальнейшее их образование. Хикматулло обращается за помощью, чтобы приобрести скотин и расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo is a responsible man from the small town of Dangara. He is a model family man, a loving husband and a wonderful father. He is a farmer and has worked and earned a living through hard work all his life. He has a small number of cattle and is satisfied with them. He thanks the Lord that he has a loving wife, healthy children and a small business that allows him to feed his family.

Hikmatullo has decided to increase his head count of cattle in order to expand his business and increase his income. His children will soon be finishing grade school and he needs to save up for their further education. He is looking for help to buy cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand his business

loans.name: Lexia Vittina

texts.en:
23-year-old Lexia Vittina is a hard-working woman who earns a living by selling personal and household products like whitening soap, fabric conditioner, lotion, creams and other household wares.

She has sold personal products for three years now. Her husband also has an income that supports the needs of his family.

Aside from selling personal products, she is also a retailer and a dealer of MSE (Marikina Shoe Exchange) footwear and Avon products like face powder and other cosmetics.

With all of her hard work, she is able to feed her family with nutritious foods and provide a better place to live. She is doing her best to handle her business properly to make it more productive.

Lexia Vittina is hopeful that she will become prosperous in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy supplies of personal products like powdered soap, body spray, and apparel.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family.

Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories for houses, such as doors and windows. He has also been providing door-to-door services to repair broken accessories.

A few days ago his welding equipment broke down due to overheating and needs to be replaced. He wants to buy new welding equipment, but he does not have cash to do this due to excessive household expenses.

Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so her husband can buy welding equipment to continue his work.

loans.use: to buy new welding equipment for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Mungu Ni Mwema Group

texts.en: Suzana is a member of the Mungu Ni Mwema Group, part of Wezesha Project in Uvira in Eastern Democratic Republic Of Congo. She is a 45-year-old married mother of 13 children. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital to run her business and make money for her family.  This is her third loan to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her last loan ended well, generated her more income and now she is asking for another loan to finance her charcoal business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
O Sr Romão de 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 06 filhos dos quais 04 estão na sua responsabilidade. Trabalha numa empresa de serralharia como serralheiro.
Está a construir a sua casa e com este empréstimo vai comprar cimento, blocos, varroes, pedra para dar continuidade da sua obra. Sonha em concluir a sua casa para confortar a sua familia e melhorar as condiçoes da dieta alimentar.
O desafio é concluir a sua casa e reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Romao is 33 years of age, married and the father of six children of whom four are under his care. He works in a locksmith's workshop as a locksmith.

Romao is building his house and with this loan he will buy cement, concrete blocks, rods and rocks to continue construction. He dreams of finishing his home to provide comfort for his family and improve their diet.

His challenges are to finish his home and repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks, rods and rocks to continue building.

loans.name: Dúo Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Tejedoras
Lo integran Maria Maximiliana. Se dedica a elaborar bordados y tejidos típicos, Maximiliana es viuda y está al frente de sus cuatro hijos por los cuales lucha y trabaja arduamente para darle a sus hijos estudio y así tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. Agradece a Kiva y Fape por el apoyo que le brindan ya que necesita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos y artículos para bordar. Tiene buen record de pago.
texts.en:
Dúo Tejedoras [Weavers Duo]

Maria Maximiliana is a member. She makes embroideries and typical fabrics. Maximiliana is a widow and is in charge of her four children, for whose sake she struggles and works arduously to provide them with an education so that they may thus have better opportunities in life. She thanks Kiva and Fape for the support that they give her since she needs the loan to buy fabrics, yarns and embroidery items. She has a good payment record.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make embroidered items to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.pt:
A senhora Nora tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 04 filhos que frequentam o ensino escolar. Sustenta ainda mais 02 sobrinhos que também frequentam a escola. Com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construçao como cimento, varroes, pedra, blocos para dar continuidade a sua obra .
A cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa e confortar a sua familia.
Enfrenta dificuldades financeiras, e a falta de produtos para sua actividade e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Nora is 35 years old, single, and the mother of four children who go to school. She also supports two nephews who go to school as well.

With this loan Nora plans to buy building materials such as cement, rods, rocks and concrete blocks to continue building.

Nora dreams of finishing her home to provide her family with comfort. She has run into financial difficulties and lacks the products she needs for the job, but she plans to take out more loans so she can overcome her struggles and reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, rocks and concrete blocks to continue building.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben, aged 24, is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is a very active person involved in agriculture and especially his banana plantation, a business which he started in 2012. He has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (two million Ugandan shillings) to improve his agricultural production (especially banana production) through the application of organic manure. He will also complete his house.

Ben works nine hours every day including working as a teacher at Kikunda Primary School where he earns an additional income. He is not yet married but is taking care of his young sister, paying her school fees and providing for her other basic needs.

Ben carries out his agricultural production in the rural area of Mwizi, Bushwere in the Rubirizi district. He began the business to earn more income in addition to his salary. His clients are all kinds of people.

Through this loan, Ben hopes to boost his agricultural business, having been faced with bad weather conditions and limited capital, and to construct a bigger and better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure to improve his banana production

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin is married and lives with his family in the village of Mahmmudlu in the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Parvin’s wife is a housewife, and they have one child. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land of Fuzuli city.

Parvin is in the animal breeding business. He buys young calves and raises and then sells them in a local bazar.

His salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. Parvin has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy hay and straw for his animals for the coming winter.

In the future, Parvin wants to give a good education to his child. He is thankful for the help from Kiva and Kiva's lenders.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw for his animals for the coming winter.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Manuel tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 04 filhos todos na sua responsabilidade. Desses, 02 frequentam o ensino primário e os outros são menores de idade escolar. É motorista de profissão.
Vive em casa dos sogros e está a construir a sua habitação num espaço que foi cedido pelos vizinhos. Com o empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, varrões, blocos, estribos, pedra e area para dar continuidade na construção da sua casa.
Sonha em concluir a sua casa para dar conforto a sua familia e construir um pequeno Centro para acolher crianças orfao. Seu desafio  é de reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 29 years old, married, and the father of four children, all of whom are under his care. Two of his children go to primary school and the others are too young for school. He is a driver by trade.

Manuel lives in his parents-in-law's home and is building a house in a spot that was ceded to him by his neighbours. With this loan he plans to buy cement, rods, concrete blocks, steps, rocks and sand to continue building his house.

Manuel dreams of finishing his home to provide his family with comfort and to build a small centre to accommodate orphaned children. His challenge is to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, concrete blocks, steps, rocks and sand to continue building his house.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Mío Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios Mío
Este dúo está conformado por Lucia es originaria de Sumpango, Sac, Lucia es soltera, tiene su propio negocio, el negocio de Lucia es La venda de Elotes cocidos y además a tejer blusas típicas , la venta de elotes y frutas lo tiene en la puerta de su casa, y cada día se traslada en la terminal de Guatemala para poder comprar su mercadería, pero la dificultad que tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder comprar y surtir sus ventas por lo que solicita de un crédito de para poder ampliar su negocio, ella promete cumplir con los pagos de cada mes, además desde ya esta agradecida con la ayuda que le brindaran.
texts.en: Lucia is part of this group, Dúo Dios Mío, she is a native of Sumpango, Sac. Lucia is single and has her own business. She sells cooked corn on the cob and in addition she weaves traditional blouses.  She sells the corn and fruit from the door of her house. She goes to the Guatemala terminal every day to buy her merchandise. The difficulty she has is that she does not have enough capital to purchase and supply her inventory. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan, to expand her business. She promises to make her payments each month. She is already thankful for the help she will receive.

loans.use: to purchase corn to sell and to purchase raw materials to make typical woven textiles to sell.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi, aged 45, is a married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a chef by profession; he provides services by cooking food for marriage ceremonies, parties and funfair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken and fish and for sweet dishes, he prepares firni and kheer. He is a very famous chef in his town and most people like him to cook food for their ceremonies. Sometimes he has to cook many dishes at the same time, so he faces problems due to his shortage of cauldrons.

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband will be able to buy a new cauldron, spices, utensils and firewood for cooking food.

loans.use: to buy a new cauldron, spices, utensils and firewood for her husband who provides chef services in ceremonies and at parties.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, aged 22, is from the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia and is a single credit officer at a micro-finance institution. He has worked in the province since 2014, and earns approximately $6 per day. Currently, Mom is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in management at a university in the province.

Due to the fact that he is short of the finances needed to pay his third-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. This is Mom's second loan cycle with Kiva. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and to successfully complete his third year. Mom dreams of having a better job in a bank, so he can save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fees

loans.name: Karima

texts.en:
Karima is a 47-year-old, married mother of four. She started, almost a year ago, selling used clothes to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. Despite her hard working to develop her business, her income is not enough anymore to satisfy all her family's expenses.

Today, Karima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her children's school tuition fees. She believes that education can transform a person to live a better life and even in social well-being, and promote good habits, values and awareness. Karima hopes to expand her business in the future, to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Las Aparecidas Group

texts.es:
Yoselin es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 4 años y su negocio es la venta de tamales y horneados.
Ella es buena madre, trabajadora y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘cotoca’ caracterizada por encontrarse la capilla de la virgen patrona de la ciudad.
Yoselin es morena de baja estatura y físico mediano (al centro en la fila de atrás, viste polera sin mangas color marrón con flores verdes), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en casa familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por cuidar a sus niños la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de refrescos, venta de comida, taller de llaves, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao, verdulería y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de tamales y horneados, los tamales son una especie de empanadas de choclo, se rellenan con charque, pasas de uva, y ají colorado y los horneados son masitas típicas lugareñas mayormente con insumos propios del lugar como harina de yuca y maíz, “inicié mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar para mantener a mis niños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que le deja tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar harina y latas para hornear. Su sueño es tener 2 hornos más y mejorar sus ganancias, ella desea comprar choclos, harina y latas para hornear. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yoselin solicita un préstamo para comprar choclos, harina y latas para hornear.
texts.en:
Yoselin is a young 22 year old woman. She is single and has two children aged 1 and 4 years old. Her business is selling tamales and baked goods.

She is a good mother, hard-working and very responsible. Her business takes place in 'Cotoca’ where the Chapel for the Virgin patron saint of the city is located.

Yoselin is dark-skinned, short and of medium build. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her children who are not yet school age. They live in the family house which is made of brick and has all the basic services. The need to care for her children led her to head a communal bank. The members' businesses are: the sale of soft drinks, food sales, a locksmith shop, leather crafts, making straw hats, a greengrocer and a neighborhood store.

Her business is selling tamales and baked goods. The tamales are a type of corn empanada. They are filled with dried meat, raisins and red pepper. The baked goods are traditional local doughs with mainly local products like yucca and corn flour. "I started my business out of the necessity to work to support my children", she commented. The advantage of her business is that it leaves her time to care for her children. Her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy flour and canned goods to bake. This is her first loan with the institution in the five years she has carried out this business.

For these reasons Yoselin is requesting a loan to buy corn, flour and canned goods to bake.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour and canned goods to bake.

loans.name: Women Learn To Do Business-N6T1Tduong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 33 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling cake for 10 years.

Lan lives in Thieu Hoa district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to make the cake for sale.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make cake for sale.

loans.name: Funny Women - N3T3Tdương Group

texts.en:
Tư is 30 years old and married. She has operated a food stall/ restaurant selling fruit for 10 years. Tư lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tư faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

In 2014, Tư joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Tư has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Tư hopes to maintain a successful business. She hopes for her children to find a good job and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Raead is a 30-year-old, married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip. He lives with his family in a small, old house, where he is the main breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support. Raead has a motorcycle repair shop in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Raead took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a set of new tools for motorcycles maintenance . He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tools for motorcycle maintenance  .

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, aged 55, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Reynaldo, a security guard, she has a child who is a college student and another one who is already working. No matter how hard life is in a third-world country, the couple has faith that as they help each other make a living, God will see them through.

Since a security guard's salary is barely enough to meet their needs, Ana thought of putting up a general store, which has helped fund their personal, household and school needs of their children. To help her expand operations of her store, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc., to sell at her small store. She is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and for supporting the livelihood of small businesswomen like her.

Ana's simple dream is that someday, her store will be a big grocery. She would love to see her other child graduate from college to allow her better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it is there that she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en: Khim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 45 years old. She is a silk weaver and a married woman with two children in her care. She has been a silk weaver since 2011. Her two children attend school. Her husband earns his main income from rice milling. They all live in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. They can earn approximately USD $8 per day.

Now, Eng would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves.

In the future, Eng is going to save money to build a proper new house and support her two children to go through bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is a 20 year old single man. He is living with his parents and two siblings who still attending school. His parents are the main income source in the family in order to satisfy their needs. Due to the hard financial situation, today, he is asking to take a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.  He will be utilizing the loan to pay the first installment of his educational fees. In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering his study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of his advanced educational fees.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es buena madre, precavida y muy confiada en sí misma. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Dolores’ caracterizado por ser el barrio más antiguo de la ciudad.
Alcira es morena, de baja estatura y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como constructor y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado, construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de verduras por mayor, anteriormente tenía un puesto de venta fijo, lo vendió y ahora vende ambulante mente, “viajé a la Argentina a trabajar y ahora que volví estoy restableciendo mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor eso le permite vender toda la mercadería, la desventaja es que no puede mantener la verdura fresca varios días. Su sueño es lograr ser proveedora mayorista y extender su negocio, ella desea comprar verduras por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alcira solicita u préstamo para comprar verduras por mayor para restablecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alcira is 33 years old. She is married, has a nine-year-old daughter, and earns a living selling vegetables.

Alcira is a good mother, prudent, and very self-confident. She runs her business in the Villa Dolores area, which is known for being the oldest neighbourhood in the city.

Alcira is short and has a tanned complexion. She dresses in traditional clothing (bowler hat, thick shawl, and pleated skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a builder, and their daughter, who goes to school. They live in a rented room, which is made of brick and has all the basic utilities.

She runs a business selling vegetables in bulk. She used to have a permanent stall, but she sold it, and now she goes from place to place selling her goods. "I travelled to Argentina to work, and now that I've returned, I'm re-establishing my business," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she sells in bulk, which enables her to sell all of the merchandise; the disadvantage is that she can't keep the vegetables fresh for a longer period of time.

Her dreams include becoming a wholesale provider and expanding her business.

This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been following this occupation.

For these reasons, Alcira is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in bulk to re-establish her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk to re-establish her business.

loans.name: Love Kids - N6 T7Tdương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Trang is 23 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling fruit for 10 years. Trang lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Trang faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell. In 2012, Trang joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Trang has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Trang hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tâm's Group -N4T5Tdương

texts.en:
Mrs Tâm is 42 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for 10 years. Tâm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

In 2014, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Tâm hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Caryn

texts.en:
Caryn is a 54-year-old businesswoman who operates a mini department store that sells school supplies and a selection of commonly purchased personal items. She’s a hardworking mother and an active borrower of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in Intramuros, Manila. She’s been an entrepreneur for five years now with average earnings of PHP 30,000 every month.

Like any other entrepreneur, Caryn wants to make her business flourish so she can continue to help support her family’s needs. Her business enables her to pay their household bills and other expenses. In order to further enhance her skills and resources as an entrepreneur, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 25,000, which will buy additional school supplies and personal items for her business. Caryn prays that God will continually bless her family, not just financially but with good health and relationships as well. She believes that your support will help start the growth of her business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Caryn spares time to attend CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, and this is where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and commonly purchased personal items for her business.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Lek is with Kristina in the picture. They do recycling of plastic and other metal items to earn an income of about $250/month in total and they have been pictured holding large bags of recycled items. They both are in their early fifties and are very poor and they have only one child, the 24-year-old who requires an immediate surgery.

" To dig in the large garbage bins to get out the plastics or other recycle items. People stare at us; they look down at us most of the time. But we've got to make a living no matter how small that is. We've got to try. We walk every day, dragging the garbage bags everywhere we go. It's very depressing and it gets to us very often." This was quoted from the conversation that the couple had with the loan officer and the branch assistant.

This loan will be used to pay for their daughter's scheduled surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his 24-year-old daughter's surgery.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 35 years old and the mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband sells vegetables by profession, for example selling onions, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household expenses.

Shaheen's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn a maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in the position to purchase the vegetables he needs for his business.

Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she will be able to help her husband purchase the above items.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her husband to sell from his business.

loans.name: Dilore

texts.en:
Dilore is 55 years old and a married mother of two grown-ups. About a year ago, she started a sort of agricultural activity. Her yard is about 300 square meters, thus, she had to rent about 6000 more meters to plant animal feed such as vetch, lucerne and fodder. So far, she's got chickens and two sows with piglets, and now Dilore wants to add two dairy cows to sell raw milk and also homemade dairy products, and to sell calves also. Doing this, her family's income will improve great deal, according to Dilore.

Prior to their current location, she and her husband lived far off in the Albanian Alps where life was pretty harsh, with 10 months of winter a year and the ground covered in snow almost all year around with no technology and infrastructure. "Life here is much better, however, we will have no retirement pensions, thus, we've got to do something. Until now, our sons who live in Italy have been helping financially if we needed some money for medications. But we have to cover for them ourselves, " said Dilore to the branch assistant who took her Kiva interview.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 38 and she is married. She lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this for many years and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to upcoming winter season, the demand for warm clothing will increase as well.

This is the reason she showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of warm clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and provide some charming clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy variety of warm clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Chantrea

texts.en: Chantrea is 29 years old, a single teacher living in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a teacher since 2000, making approximately $7 per day. Chantrea would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Chantrea is going to save money to build a proper new house and support her child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.en:
The 9 women of “Santa Rosa de Lima” trust bank live in the town of Santa Rosa La Laguna, Uspantán, in the department of Quiché, Western Guatemala. With a mainly indigenous population, in addition to Spanish, the spoken language of the area is Uspanteco. 

Between the ages of 20 and 70, this group is home to a wide range of women, mothers of between 1 and 8 children who are receiving education. The majority of the group was not able to study past 6th grade, very few of the women reached secondary school. 

Clara is 29 years old, and president of her trust bank. She is married and the couple has 3 children, providing them with the opportunity of education, with 2 children in primary school. Clara was able to study through about 9th grade, in secondary school, and now runs several businesses, raising pigs and chickens and selling kitchen cloths and tablecloths that she embroiders with designs traditional to the area. With her loan, this intelligent woman will invest in her project to create a corral for her animals, buying laminate and other materials for the construction, as well as 4 more pigs.

For careers, the women of Santa Rosa de Lima manage convenient stores, grow and sell tomatoes, raise and sell chickens, sell used clothes, and run tailoring shops, embroidering tablecloths and kitchen cloths. As a new group, all of the members are very excited to be receiving credit from Kiva and to be a part of Friendship Bridge, waiting expectantly for the resulting growth that will come in their businesses and lives.

loans.use: in her project to create a corral for her animals, buying laminate and other materials for the construction, as well as 4 more pigs.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 42-year-old married mother of three children. She opened her current lingerie selling shop in 2010 to support her husband who is an employee with a limited monthly salary to develop and improve their family's living.
Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children increasing school tuition fees. 
She believes that education will provide her children with a brighter future.
She hopes that she can stay capable of developing her business and replying to her family's increasing living needs.

loans.use: to pay for her children increasing school tuition fees .

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 39 year old married woman living with her husband. She is mother of eight children, some of them are still attending school and a housewife dedicated only for her family, and her husband works in the agriculture sector and represents the main income provider in order to fulfill their family needs. But because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children educational installment fees. This is the first time that she request kiva’s support to pay the school fees and she is very happy because she will be able to register her children with the coming school.

loans.use: to pay her children educational installment fees

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 19-year-old married woman. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her increasing university tuition fees and to buy school supplies.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low-income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Randa hopes to continue her education and improve her living.

loans.use: to pay her increasing university tuition fees and to buy school supplies

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi, who is in her early 30s, is single and has one child who is still in school. She has been running two projects: a beauty salon and cosmetics sales for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Zawadi's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her salon equipment and to start the cosmetics sales business. She has been able to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan experience. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay her loans, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to increase her stock of cosmetics.

Zawadi will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Girasoles De Barrial Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal GIRASOLES DE BARRIAL, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Olga continua con su negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales, la socia continua criando a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Girasoles de Barrial". The bank is located in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

The member, Olga, carries on her agricultural and animal-raising businesses. The member keeps raising her animals to sell them afterwards to the customers that request them. The member is a responsible person. The member has had her business for a long time which provides her personal satisfaction, as this is the way the member provides for her family. 

The member requested the loan to invest in seeds and fertilizers among others. The members feel grateful for the loan and commit to fulfill the established fees.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers among others.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Feliciano runs and owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various merchandise ranging from canned goods to pouches of soy sauce, bread, energy drinks, sugar, powdered milk, and toiletries.

He is a married man, living in the rural town of Getafe, Bohol with his wife. He has three grown children. Feliciano also engages in selling sand for supplemental income.

He has been serving his neighbors for a long period of time. He would like to maintain the inventory of merchandise to cater for the demand of his customers. He needs enough capital to make that happen.

Feliciano decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost his business. With the 10,000 PHP loan he wants to buy assorted groceries including food and water, and to have additional capital for his sand business.

He is hoping that he can improve his business by investing in other sources of income to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries including food, water, and to be used as additional capital for his  sand  business.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
For the past 9 years, Algin has run a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic household commodities such as salt, cooking oil, pouch vinegar, coffee, energy drinks, soap, shampoo, mosquito repellent, matches and condiments. She is a 31-year-old, married woman and has two young children. On the other hand, her husband earns a living by means of fishing.

Algin wants to fill her store with variety of goods. The problem is she has insufficient funds to do so. She joined CEVI, to access loans to buy one sack of rice, ten cases Pepsi (soft drink) and five cases beer. In that way, she can cater the demands and be able to maintain the cash flow of the business.

Algin is hopeful that with determination and proper handling of resources, she will become productive and these will continue her to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, ten cases of pepsi (soft drink) and five cases beer.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar es un hombre amable, y muy generoso, tiene 56 años de edad, con una linda familia que es la razón por la cual todos los días busca superarse, el utilizo su préstamo en su negocio de ropa casual, comprando una variedad de ropa, con estos productos a sus clientes puedo satisfacer. Cesar con el anhelo de seguir mejorando sus productos para que los clientes siempre tengan donde escoger solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa para damas, caballeros y niñas. Su esperanza de vida es que con esta nueva inversión fortalecerá su negocio, pero también anhela contar con su propio local.
texts.en:
Cesar is a friendly and very generous man. He is 56 years old and has a beautiful family, who are the reason why he seeks to excel everyday. He used his previous loan in his business of selling casual clothing, to buy a variety of clothes. With these products he was able to satisfy his customers.
Cesar wants to continue improving his products so that his customers always have options to choose from.
He is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise of clothing for women, men and children. He hopes that this new investment will strengthen his business, and he also hopes to have his own location.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Myzafer

texts.en:
Myzafer is 55 and a married father of two who has been photographed on the porch of his little family house. For nearly 20 years, he and his family have been doing agriculture to earn a living. They own about 7 dynyms of agricultural land and rent 8 more dynyms from others for a small annual fee. He plants red onions, potatoes, beans and wheat. His family sells the products and makes annual gross revenue as follows: red onions, $2,700; white potatoes, $4,750; and beans, $900. He does not sell wheat because they use it for family consumption. The earnings are very little for a family and sometimes their products are not sold due to low demand or because the land with the plantings gets flooded from rains, something that in general has not been treated as an emergency by the governments. Rural families suffer from this issue.

Myzafer needs to make some basic repairs to his house. They live in a very cold region where the snow starts in the end of September and goes all the way to the end of April.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to his house before the winter's extreme cold and heavy snow starts.

loans.name: Rubina Shaheen

texts.en:
Rubina Shaheen is 41 years old and is the mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He owns a hotel, which he has been running for 12 years now to meet the family’s expenses.

Nowadays, Rubina’s husband wants to buy more assets and inventory items for his hotel, such as furniture, utensils, etc.; but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these items he requires to earn an income.

Therefore, Rubina Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Rubina’s husband can purchase the items he requires to earn an income.

Rubina and her family will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy more items such as furniture, utensils, etc. for his hotel business.

loans.name: Gul Jan

texts.en:
Gul Jan is the age of 51 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw two years to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Gul Jan’s husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy it. Therefore Gul Jan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provides the proper transportation services to earn an income. She and her family are thankful to the Kiva, lenders’ and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en: Ley’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ley makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is 26, married, and has 2 children. He is financially responsible for his father who is old and suffers from a serious disease. He has small grocery store and is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as kinds of biscuits, potato chips, pasta and rice to afford his father's expensive medications and his sister's marriage expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as kinds of biscuits, potato chips, pasta and rice.

loans.name: Tolkunai

texts.en:
Tolkunai is an 18 years old freshman in the International and Business Law Program at AUCA. She finished at one of the best local schools with good marks. She says that entering AUCA was her dream from childhood, so studied hard and learned English in order to be admitted to this prestigious university.

She lives with her mother and is the only child in her family. Unfortunately, they lost her father several years ago. Tolkunai’s mother is a budgetary worker, what means that they don’t have any additional incomes, just her mother’s salary. The salary is spent for purchase of cloth, food, transportation and education. After paying for the daily expenses, little sum is left for her university tuition fee, so she is in need of financial aid.

Tolkunai and her mother are happy and surprised to learn about Kiva loan at AUCA, as it is provided for students an interest free rate and they can pay it just after graduation for 2 years. Tolkunai is sure that Kiva loan is the best choice for her and thanks all Kiva lenders for their belief in her and promises to meet your expectations.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education for a BA degree in International and Business Law.

loans.name: Ndetaramwa

texts.en:
Ndetaramwa, who is in  her early 30's is married with one kid, who is till at school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years now. She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to earn a small monthly profit.

This will be Ndetaramwa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on her genge stock. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

Ndetaramwa, will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase on her genge stock.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has 3 school-aged children. Her husband is the main income provider. He owns a mobile shop in his town, and he is a hard worker in order to earn enough money to be able to pay the many everyday expenses.

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s school registration fees.

Zeinab said that she is very happy and willing to always take advantage of the benefits from Kiva’s loan to adequately continue her children's education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school registration fees.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 56 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. She is a mother of two children; one is still studying. Her husband works as a farmer and she is a housewife. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay her child’s educational fees. She states that, with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help him to pursue a good education. That makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Amerita

texts.en:
Amerita is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She engages in tailoring. She caters services like dress making , dress adjustment, and other tailoring services. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 21 while the youngest is 8.

Aside from tailoring services, she also toils the land and goes farming. She grows and sells rice.

She would like to improve the yield of her farm. So she decided to join CEVI, to access loan and to continue make some progress on her farm.

She has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers. In these way, she could able to boost her farm in order to become more productive.

In the future, Amerita is looking forward to handle her both sources of livelihood productively to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers

loans.name: Minjana

texts.en: Minjana is a 41 year-old Lebanese single woman living alone. She works as a housekeeper in order to fulfill her needs and to live in a respectful way. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her nephews’ educational fees. She insist that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for them in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her nephews’ educational fees
