loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro con 36 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y su menor hijo, en el distrito de La Peca,provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas,país Perú. Genaro cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Genaro se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, variedad Catimor. Solicita préstamo para invertir en mantenimiento del cultivo de café. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Genaro es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Genaro is 36 years old and married. He lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife and his youngest child in the district of La Peca, in the province of Bagua, Amazonas department in the country of Peru. 

Genaro has very good personal and professional references from the inhabitants of the area. The majority of the inhabitants of this location work in  agriculture, trade and ranching.

Genaro works in agriculture, specifically growing of the coffee variety Catimor. He is requesting the loan to invest in the maintenance of the coffee cultivation. This investment will allow him to obtain bigger earnings to improve his economic condition and therefore to invest in better life conditions.

Genaro is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of the coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara, a 38-year-old Palestinian taxi driver, is married and lives with his wife and 15-year-old son in a refugee camp located in North Lebanon. While his wife is unemployed and his son still goes to school, Maysara bought a car four years ago and started working as a taxi driver. He is an ambitious man who loves his work as he gets to meet new people everyday and share their stories. The main reason he is so hardworking is to ensure a good future for his son.

For the first time, Maysara is asking for a 3,083,000 LBP loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs to register his car and cover a part of its maintenance costs. Registering it will allow him to cover a wider range of destinations, which will increase his income and network of clients.

loans.use: to register his car and cover its maintenance costs.

loans.name: Sumaira Bibi

texts.en:
Sumaira is the age of 27 and a mother of two daughters, living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is engaged in juice selling to earn an income. He started his business 12 years ago, because he wanted to help his family and to meet the other expenses.

Sumaira’s husband buys the fruit from the main bazaar. Another person handles his transactions with his customers. He now needs to buy a new blender machine, so that he can earn better profits for his family. He has become an expert in his field. So Sumaira requested a loan, so that her husband could be able to buy the blender machine and continue earning. Sumaira is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a blender machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Akuavi  Mawulawoe

texts.fr: Akuavi est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomè et âgée de 56 ayant trois enfants à charge. Akuavi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akuavi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Akuavi is a married woman living in Adidogomè, aged 56 and responsible for three children. Akuavi buys and sells charcoal and renews her stock three times a month at the market, reselling the charcoal at her home.

To finance her purchase, Akuavi needs this loan so as to order some sacks of charcoal. She wants to resell the charcoal at a better price and make more profit so that she can help her husband with the family expenses and permit their children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy 16 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a young Palestinian man, lives alone in a refugee camp located in North Lebanon. He works as a painter and interior decorator. He started working as an apprentice in the construction field 13 years ago when he was just 14, until he decided to start his own business and work on his own in 2010.

Although his is only 27 years old, Ahmad is well known in the area for his honesty, professionalism and good taste. Also, the success of his business allows him to support his parents financially as they both stopped working.

In order to develop his business and increase his income, he decided to ask for a loan of 1,543,992 LBP for the first time from Kiva's partner, Ibdaa. He believes that with this loan he will be able to take on more projects and improve the quality of his work. In fact, he will be able to buy quality supplies of gypsum that he needs for his projects.

loans.use: to buy supplies of gypsum.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Peter is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Peter would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Peter will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Peter now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is 29, recently married, and has a small frozen meats sales store (rented). He lives his father who works as a laborer and his mother who works as a school cleaner.. He is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy frozen meat and some products such as rice, pasta and canned tuna and expand his project and increase his income after marriage.

loans.use: to buy frozen meat and some products such as rice, pasta and canned tuna. .

loans.name: Hanem

texts.en: Hanem is 45, married to a farmer, and has four children; one of them is handicapped. She has a small poultry business and is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy chickens, ducks and geese to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, ducks and geese

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer from Tafida village. As a member of Babban Gona, Kabiru is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Kabiru is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Safiyanu

texts.en:
Safayanu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Safayanu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Safayanu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safayanu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season, when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Safayanu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream, to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Basiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Basiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are typically at their lowest market price, in order to meet his immediate cash needs.

However, with the help of this loan, Basiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price. As a Babban Gona member, Basiru will also benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

Basiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Relwende De Wobzougou Group

texts.fr:
Mme ELISE est la représentante du groupe RELWENDE DE WOBZOUGOU. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme fait du maraîchage depuis 25 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  02 boîtes d’oignons, 02 sacs d’engrais, 02 boîtes de choux et 02 boîtes de tomates.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et épargner. Elle ambitionne  la vente de planches  afin que les gens viennent acheter chez elle.
texts.en:
Mme Elise is the representative of the group called Relwende de Wobzougou. She is married and the mother of eight children. The oldest is 30 and the youngest 9 years old. Five children go to school and she is responsible for five children. Elise has been doing market gardening for 25 years. She buys her supplies in the nearby villages.

With the loan, she intends to buy two containers of onion seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, two containers of cabbage seeds, and two containers of tomato seeds. She wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her activity and to put aside savings. Her ambition is to sell planks so that people come to buy from her.

loans.use: to buy two containers of onion seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, two containers of cabbage seeds, and two containers of tomato seeds.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 48 years old, and she is living with her husband and 3 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Rehana's son is a turner by profession and manufactures spare vehicle parts. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. However, his lathe machine has been out of order due to continuous operation and now needs maintenance. He has spent all of his savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have the funds to fix his lathe machine.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan for her son so that he can fix his lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her son will be able to easily operate his lathe machine again.

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and also to repair the lathe machine for her son's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza is a young and positive woman. She lives with her son and husband in a rural area of Tajikistan. She likes her country very much.

Feruza and her husband always try to provide good living conditions for their child. 2 years ago Feruza began her own food market business. She sells a variety of food items in her store which is located near their house. She sells sugar, butter, bread, fruits, vegetables, meat products, etc. Feruza always tries to sell fresh products. Her buyers are very happy with her products.

To be a responsible business woman, Feruza plans to buy new food items. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy food items such as sugar, pasta, butter, etc. so she can earn more and increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items such as sugar, pasta, butter, etc.

loans.name: Suheir

texts.en:
Suheir is a 36-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and only child. She works as a hairdresser to help her husband financially to enhance their way of living.

Today, Suheir is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help him continue his education.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 3, 6, 9, 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de refrigerio.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural que se encarga de acopiar la producción agrícola de la zona.
Natividad es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada la primera de la derecha con su niño en brazos), su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, bien en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los socios tiene negocios como; venta de refrescos, venta de comida, elaboración de sombreros de sao, artesanía en cuero, venta de cerámica, venta de ropa de segunda mano y tienda de barrio. Su negocio es la venta de refrigerio, los refrigerios sándwiches de pan de miga con jamón y queso, puede ser con pollo y tomate las variedades son según los ingredientes  de temporada, “vendo ambulantemente y recorro las mismas calles donde tengo clientes fijos y otros casuales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con rutas establecidas y clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor como; jamón, queso, pan y otros. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina para preparar refrigerios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para preparar refrigerios.
texts.en:
Natividad is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and has 5 children, of 3, 6, 9, 10, and 12 years of age. Her business is selling snacks as a street vendor. She is a good mother, constant, and very hard-working. She carries out her job in the locality of "El Torno," a rural area that is in charge of collecting the agricultural production of the area.

Natividad (sitting all the way to the right with her son in her arms) is dark-haired, short in height, and physically robust. Her native tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in agriculture, and with her sons, who attend school. They live in their own home, constructed of wood, that has electricity and well water.

The necessity to better her business led her to lead the communal bank. The members have business like: selling soft-drinks, selling food, making straw hats, making leather crafts, selling pottery, selling second-hand clothes, and running a corner shop. Her business is selling snacks, including sandwiches made with a specific type of loaf bread, ham, and cheese, and which can have chicken and tomato. The varieties depend on the ingredients of the season. "I sell while traveling, and I go over the same streets where I have regular clients and other casual clients," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she counts on established routes with regular clients. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cooking supplies like: ham, cheese, bread, etc.

Her dream is to have a stable business. She wants to buy cooking supplies to prepare snacks. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that this activity has been carried out. For these reasons, Natividad asks for a loan to buy cooking supplies to make snacks.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies to prepare snacks.
